237
238// Returns the default item type, used for the null item (default constructed),
239// the returned pointer is always valid, it's never cleared by the @ref Item_factory.
240static const itype *nullitem()
241{
242 static itype nullitem_m;
243 return &nullitem_m;
244}
245
246item &null_item_reference()
247{
248 static item result{};
249 // reset it, in case a previous caller has changed it
250 result = item();
251 return result;
252}
253
254namespace item_internal
255{
256static bool goes_bad_temp_cache = false;
257static const item *goes_bad_temp_cache_for = nullptr;
258static bool goes_bad_cache_fetch()
259{
260 return goes_bad_temp_cache;
261}
262static void goes_bad_cache_set( const item *i )
263{
264 goes_bad_temp_cache = i->goes_bad();
265 goes_bad_temp_cache_for = i;
266}
267static void goes_bad_cache_unset()
268{
269 goes_bad_temp_cache = false;
270 goes_bad_temp_cache_for = nullptr;
271}
272static bool goes_bad_cache_is_for( const item *i )
273{
274 return goes_bad_temp_cache_for == i;
275}
276
277struct scoped_goes_bad_cache {
278 explicit scoped_goes_bad_cache( item *i ) {
279 goes_bad_cache_set( i );
280 }
281 ~scoped_goes_bad_cache() {
282 goes_bad_cache_unset();
283 }
284};
285} // namespace item_internal
286
287const int item::INFINITE_CHARGES = INT_MAX2147483647;
288
289item::item() : bday( calendar::start_of_cataclysm )
290{
291 type = nullitem();
292 charges = 0;
293 contents = item_contents( type->pockets );
294 select_itype_variant();
295}
296
297item::item( const itype *type, time_point turn, int qty ) : type( type ), bday( turn )
298{
299 contents = item_contents( type->pockets );
300 if( type->countdown_interval > 0_seconds ) {
301 countdown_point = calendar::turn + type->countdown_interval;
302 }
303 item_vars = type->item_variables;
304
305 update_prefix_suffix_flags();
306 if( has_flag( flag_CORPSE ) ) {
307 corpse = &type->source_monster.obj();
308 if( !type->source_monster.is_null() && !type->source_monster->zombify_into.is_empty() ) {
309 set_var( "zombie_form", type->source_monster->zombify_into.c_str() );
310 }
311 }
312
313 if( qty >= 0 ) {
314 charges = qty;
315 } else {
316 if( type->tool && type->tool->rand_charges.size() > 1 ) {
317 const int charge_roll = rng( 1, type->tool->rand_charges.size() - 1 );
318 const int charge_count = rng( type->tool->rand_charges[charge_roll - 1],
319 type->tool->rand_charges[charge_roll] );
320 ammo_set( ammo_default(), charge_count );
321 } else {
322 charges = type->charges_default();
323 }
324 }
325
326 if( has_flag( flag_SPAWN_ACTIVE ) ) {
327 activate();
328 }
329
330 if( has_flag( flag_COLLAPSE_CONTENTS ) ) {
331 for( item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_standard_pockets() ) {
332 pocket->settings.set_collapse( true );
333 }
334 } else {
335 auto const mag_filter = []( item_pocket const & pck ) {
336 return pck.is_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE ) ||
337 pck.is_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL );
338 };
339 for( item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_pockets( mag_filter ) ) {
340 pocket->settings.set_collapse( true );
341 }
342 }
343
344 if( has_flag( flag_NANOFAB_TEMPLATE ) ) {
345 itype_id nanofab_recipe =
346 item_group::item_from( type->nanofab_template_group ).typeId();
347 set_var( "NANOFAB_ITEM_ID", nanofab_recipe.str() );
348 }
349
350 select_itype_variant();
351 if( type->gun ) {
352 for( const itype_id &mod : type->gun->built_in_mods ) {
353 item it( mod, turn, qty );
354 it.set_flag( flag_IRREMOVABLE );
355 put_in( it, pocket_type::MOD );
356 }
357 for( const itype_id &mod : type->gun->default_mods ) {
358 put_in( item( mod, turn, qty ), pocket_type::MOD );
359 }
360
361 } else if( type->magazine ) {
362 if( type->magazine->count > 0 ) {
363 put_in( item( type->magazine->default_ammo, calendar::turn, type->magazine->count ),
364 pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
365 }
366
367 } else if( has_temperature() ) {
368 active = true;
369 last_temp_check = bday;
370
371 } else if( type->tool ) {
372 if( ammo_remaining() && !ammo_types().empty() ) {
373 ammo_set( ammo_default(), ammo_remaining() );
374 }
375 }
376
377 if( ( type->gun || type->tool ) && !magazine_integral() ) {
378 set_var( "magazine_converted", 1 );
379 }
380
381 if( !type->snippet_category.empty() ) {
382 snip_id = SNIPPET.random_id_from_category( type->snippet_category );
383 }
384
385 if( type->expand_snippets ) {
386 set_var( "description", SNIPPET.expand( type->description.translated() ) );
387 }
388
389 if( has_itype_variant() && itype_variant().expand_snippets ) {
390 set_var( "description", SNIPPET.expand( variant_description() ) );
391 }
392
393 if( current_phase == phase_id::PNULL ) {
394 current_phase = type->phase;
395 }
396 // item always has any relic properties from itype.
397 if( type->relic_data ) {
398 relic_data = type->relic_data;
399 }
400}
401
402item::item( const itype_id &id, time_point turn, int qty )
403 : item( find_type( id ), turn, qty ) {}
404
405item::item( const itype *type, time_point turn, default_charges_tag )
406 : item( type, turn, type->charges_default() ) {}
407
408item::item( const itype_id &id, time_point turn, default_charges_tag tag )
409 : item( find_type( id ), turn, tag ) {}
410
411item::item( const itype *type, time_point turn, solitary_tag )
412 : item( type, turn, type->count_by_charges() ? 1 : -1 ) {}
413
414item::item( const itype_id &id, time_point turn, solitary_tag tag )
415 : item( find_type( id ), turn, tag ) {}
416
417safe_reference<item> item::get_safe_reference()
418{
419 return anchor->reference_to( this );
420}
421
422static const item *get_most_rotten_component( const item &craft )
423{
424 const item *most_rotten = nullptr;
425 for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : craft.components ) {
426 if( !tvp.second.front().goes_bad() ) {
427 // they're all the same type, so this should be the same for all
428 continue;
429 }
430 for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
431 if( !most_rotten || it.get_relative_rot() > most_rotten->get_relative_rot() ) {
432 most_rotten = &it;
433 }
434 }
435 }
436 return most_rotten;
437}
438
439// sorts with localized_compare, and enumerates entries, if more than \p max entries
440// the rest are abbreviated into " and %d more"
441static std::string enumerate_lcsorted_with_limit( const std::vector<std::string> &v,
442 const int max = 5 )
443{
444 if( max < 1 ) {
445 debugmsg( "Expected max to be 1 or more" )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "445", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Expected max to be 1 or more");
446 return std::string();
447 }
448 std::vector<std::string> c( std::min<size_t>( max, v.size() ) );
449 std::partial_sort_copy( v.begin(), v.end(), c.begin(), c.end(), localized_compare );
450 const int more = static_cast<int>( v.size() - c.size() );
451 if( more == 0 ) {
452 return enumerate_as_string( c );
453 }
454 const std::string res = enumerate_as_string( c, enumeration_conjunction::none );
455 return string_format( max == 1 ? _( "%s and %d more" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "%s and %d more" ) ) ) : _( "%s, and %d more" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "%s, and %d more" ) ) ), res, more );
456}
457
458static time_duration get_shortest_lifespan_from_components( const item &craft )
459{
460 const item *shortest_lifespan_component = nullptr;
461 time_duration shortest_lifespan = 0_turns;
462 for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : craft.components ) {
463 if( !tvp.second.front().goes_bad() ) {
464 // they're all the same type, so this should be the same for all
465 continue;
466 }
467 for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
468 time_duration lifespan = it.get_shelf_life() - it.get_rot();
469 if( !shortest_lifespan_component || ( lifespan < shortest_lifespan ) ) {
470 shortest_lifespan_component = &it;
471 shortest_lifespan = shortest_lifespan_component->get_shelf_life() -
472 shortest_lifespan_component->get_rot();
473 }
474 }
475 }
476 return shortest_lifespan;
477}
478
479static bool shelf_life_less_than_each_component( const item &craft )
480{
481 for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : craft.components ) {
482 if( !tvp.second.front().goes_bad() || !tvp.second.front().is_comestible() ) {
483 // they're all the same type, so this should be the same for all
484 continue;
485 }
486 for( const item &it : tvp.second ) {
487 if( it.get_shelf_life() < craft.get_shelf_life() ) {
488 return false;
489 }
490 }
491 }
492 return true;
493}
494
495// There are two ways rot is inherited:
496// 1) Inherit the remaining lifespan of the component with the lowest remaining lifespan
497// 2) Inherit the relative rot of the component with the highest relative rot
498//
499// Method 1 is used when the result of the recipe has a lower maximum shelf life than all of
500// its component's maximum shelf lives. Relative rot is not good to inherit in this case because
501// it can make an extremely short resultant remaining lifespan on the product.
502//
503// Method 2 is used when any component has a longer maximum shelf life than the result does.
504// Inheriting the lowest remaining lifespan can not be used in this case because it would break
505// food preservation recipes.
506static void inherit_rot_from_components( item &it )
507{
508 if( shelf_life_less_than_each_component( it ) ) {
509 const time_duration shortest_lifespan = get_shortest_lifespan_from_components( it );
510 if( shortest_lifespan > 0_turns && shortest_lifespan < it.get_shelf_life() ) {
511 it.set_rot( it.get_shelf_life() - shortest_lifespan );
512 }
513 } else {
514 const item *most_rotten = get_most_rotten_component( it );
515 if( most_rotten ) {
516 it.set_relative_rot( most_rotten->get_relative_rot() );
517 }
518 }
519}
520
521item::item( const recipe *rec, int qty, item_components items, std::vector<item_comp> selections )
522 : item( "craft", calendar::turn )
523{
524 craft_data_ = cata::make_value<craft_data>();
525 craft_data_->making = rec;
526 craft_data_->disassembly = false;
527 craft_data_->batch_size = qty;
528 components = std::move( items );
529 craft_data_->comps_used = std::move( selections );
530
531 if( has_temperature() ) {
532 active = true;
533 last_temp_check = bday;
534 if( goes_bad() ) {
535 inherit_rot_from_components( *this );
536 }
537 }
538
539 for( item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
540 for( item &component : tvp.second ) {
541 for( const flag_id &f : component.get_flags() ) {
542 if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
543 set_flag( f );
544 }
545 }
546 for( const flag_id &f : component.type->get_flags() ) {
547 if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
548 set_flag( f );
549 }
550 }
551 }
552 }
553}
554
555item::item( const recipe *rec, int qty, item &component )
556 : item( "disassembly", calendar::turn )
557{
558 craft_data_ = cata::make_value<craft_data>();
559 craft_data_->making = rec;
560 craft_data_->disassembly = true;
561 craft_data_->batch_size = qty;
562 item_components items;
563 items.add( component );
564 components = items;
565
566 if( has_temperature() ) {
567 active = true;
568 last_temp_check = bday;
569 if( goes_bad() ) {
570 inherit_rot_from_components( *this );
571 }
572 }
573
574 for( item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
575 for( item &comp : tvp.second ) {
576 for( const flag_id &f : comp.get_flags() ) {
577 if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
578 set_flag( f );
579 }
580 }
581 for( const flag_id &f : comp.type->get_flags() ) {
582 if( f->craft_inherit() ) {
583 set_flag( f );
584 }
585 }
586 }
587 }
588}
589
590item::item( const item & ) = default;
591item::item( item && ) noexcept = default;
592item::~item() = default;
593item &item::operator=( const item & ) = default;
594item &item::operator=( item && ) noexcept = default;
595
596item item::make_corpse( const mtype_id &mt, time_point turn, const std::string &name,
597 const int upgrade_time )
598{
599 if( !mt.is_valid() ) {
600 debugmsg( "tried to make a corpse with an invalid mtype id" )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "600", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "tried to make a corpse with an invalid mtype id"
);
601 }
602
603 std::string corpse_type = mt == mtype_id::NULL_ID() ? "corpse_generic_human" : "corpse";
604
605 item result( corpse_type, turn );
606 result.corpse = &mt.obj();
607
608 if( result.corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_REVIVES ) ) {
609 if( one_in( 20 ) ) {
610 result.set_flag( flag_REVIVE_SPECIAL );
611 }
612 result.set_var( "upgrade_time", std::to_string( upgrade_time ) );
613 }
614
615 if( !mt->zombify_into.is_empty() ) {
616 result.set_var( "zombie_form", mt->zombify_into.c_str() );
617 }
618
619 // This is unconditional because the const itemructor above sets result.name to
620 // "human corpse".
621 result.corpse_name = name;
622
623 return result;
624}
625
626item &item::convert( const itype_id &new_type, Character *carrier )
627{
628 // Carry over relative rot similar to crafting
629 const double rel_rot = get_relative_rot();
630 type = find_type( new_type );
631 set_relative_rot( rel_rot );
632 requires_tags_processing = true; // new type may have "active" flags
633 item temp( *this );
634 temp.contents = item_contents( type->pockets );
635 for( const item *it : contents.mods() ) {
636 if( !temp.put_in( *it, pocket_type::MOD ).success() ) {
637 debugmsg( "failed to insert mod" )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "637", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "failed to insert mod");
638 }
639 }
640 temp.update_modified_pockets();
641 temp.contents.combine( contents, true );
642 contents = temp.contents;
643 current_phase = new_type->phase;
644 if( count_by_charges() != new_type->count_by_charges() ) {
645 charges = new_type->charges_default();
646 }
647
648 if( temp.type->countdown_interval > 0_seconds ) {
649 countdown_point = calendar::turn + type->countdown_interval;
650 active = true;
651 }
652 if( carrier && carrier->has_item( *this ) ) {
653 carrier->on_item_acquire( *this );
654 }
655
656 update_prefix_suffix_flags();
657 return *this;
658}
659
660item &item::deactivate( const Character *ch, bool alert )
661{
662 if( !active ) {
663 return *this; // no-op
664 }
665
666 if( type->revert_to ) {
667 if( ch && alert && !type->tool->revert_msg.empty() ) {
668 ch->add_msg_if_player( m_info, type->tool->revert_msg.translated(), tname() );
669 }
670 convert( *type->revert_to );
671 active = false;
672
673 }
674 return *this;
675}
676
677item &item::activate()
678{
679 if( active ) {
680 return *this; // no-op
681 }
682
683 active = true;
684
685 return *this;
686}
687
688bool item::activate_thrown( const tripoint &pos )
689{
690 return type->invoke( nullptr, *this, pos ).value_or( 0 );
691}
692
693units::energy item::mod_energy( const units::energy &qty )
694{
695 if( !is_vehicle_battery() ) {
696 debugmsg( "Tried to set energy of non-battery item" )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "696", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Tried to set energy of non-battery item"
);
697 return 0_J;
698 }
699
700 units::energy val = energy_remaining( nullptr ) + qty;
701 if( val < 0_J ) {
702 return val;
703 } else if( val > type->battery->max_capacity ) {
704 energy = type->battery->max_capacity;
705 } else {
706 energy = val;
707 }
708 return 0_J;
709}
710
711item &item::ammo_set( const itype_id &ammo, int qty )
712{
713 if( !ammo->ammo ) {
714 if( !has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
715 debugmsg( "can't set ammo %s in %s as it is not an ammo", ammo.c_str(), type_name() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "715", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "can't set ammo %s in %s as it is not an ammo"
, ammo.c_str(), type_name());
716 }
717 return *this;
718 }
719 const ammotype &ammo_type = ammo->ammo->type;
720 if( qty < 0 ) {
721 // completely fill an integral or existing magazine
722 //if( magazine_current() ) then we need capacity of the magazine instead of the item maybe?
723 if( magazine_integral() || magazine_current() ) {
724 qty = ammo_capacity( ammo_type );
725
726 // else try to add a magazine using default ammo count property if set
727 } else if( !magazine_default( true ).is_null() ) {
728 item mag( magazine_default( true ) );
729 if( mag.type->magazine->count > 0 ) {
730 qty = mag.type->magazine->count;
731 } else {
732 qty = mag.ammo_capacity( ammo_type );
733 }
734 }
735 }
736
737 if( qty <= 0 ) {
738 ammo_unset();
739 return *this;
740 }
741
742 // handle reloadable tools and guns with no specific ammo type as special case
743 if( ammo.is_null() && ammo_types().empty() ) {
744 if( magazine_integral() ) {
745 if( is_tool() ) {
746 charges = std::min( qty, ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) );
747 } else if( is_gun() ) {
748 const item temp_ammo( ammo_default(), calendar::turn, std::min( qty, ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) ) );
749 put_in( temp_ammo, pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
750 }
751 }
752 return *this;
753 }
754
755 // check ammo is valid for the item
756 std::set<itype_id> mags = magazine_compatible();
757 if( ammo_types().count( ammo_type ) == 0 && !( magazine_current() &&
758 magazine_current()->ammo_types().count( ammo_type ) ) &&
759 !std::any_of( mags.begin(), mags.end(), [&ammo_type]( const itype_id & mag ) {
760 return mag->magazine->type.count( ammo_type );
761 } ) ) {
762 debugmsg( "Tried to set invalid ammo of %s for %s", ammo.c_str(), typeId().c_str() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "762", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Tried to set invalid ammo of %s for %s"
, ammo.c_str(), typeId().c_str());
763 return *this;
764 }
765
766 if( is_magazine() ) {
767 ammo_unset();
768 item set_ammo( ammo, calendar::turn, std::min( qty, ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) ) );
769 if( has_flag( flag_NO_UNLOAD ) ) {
770 set_ammo.set_flag( flag_NO_DROP );
771 set_ammo.set_flag( flag_IRREMOVABLE );
772 }
773 put_in( set_ammo, pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
774
775 } else {
776 if( !magazine_current() ) {
777 itype_id mag = magazine_default();
778 if( !mag->magazine ) {
779 debugmsg( "Tried to set ammo of %s without suitable magazine for %s",realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "780", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Tried to set ammo of %s without suitable magazine for %s"
, ammo.c_str(), typeId().c_str())
780 ammo.c_str(), typeId().c_str() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "780", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Tried to set ammo of %s without suitable magazine for %s"
, ammo.c_str(), typeId().c_str());
781 return *this;
782 }
783
784 item mag_item( mag );
785 // if default magazine too small fetch instead closest available match
786 if( mag_item.ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) < qty ) {
787 std::vector<item> opts;
788 for( const itype_id &mag_type : mags ) {
789 if( mag_type->magazine->type.count( ammo_type ) ) {
790 opts.emplace_back( mag_type );
791 }
792 }
793 if( opts.empty() ) {
794 const std::string magazines_str = enumerate_as_string( mags,
795 []( const itype_id & mag ) {
796 const std::string ammotype_str = enumerate_as_string( mag->magazine->type,
797 []( const ammotype & a ) {
798 return a.str();
799 } );
800 return string_format( _( "%s (taking %s)" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "%s (taking %s)" ) ) ), mag.str(), ammotype_str );
801 } );
802 debugmsg( "Cannot find magazine fitting %s with any capacity for ammo %s "realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "804", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Cannot find magazine fitting %s with any capacity for ammo %s "
"(ammotype %s). Magazines considered were %s", typeId().str
(), ammo.str(), ammo_type.str(), magazines_str)
803 "(ammotype %s). Magazines considered were %s",realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "804", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Cannot find magazine fitting %s with any capacity for ammo %s "
"(ammotype %s). Magazines considered were %s", typeId().str
(), ammo.str(), ammo_type.str(), magazines_str)
804 typeId().str(), ammo.str(), ammo_type.str(), magazines_str )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "804", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Cannot find magazine fitting %s with any capacity for ammo %s "
"(ammotype %s). Magazines considered were %s", typeId().str
(), ammo.str(), ammo_type.str(), magazines_str);
805 return *this;
806 }
807 std::sort( opts.begin(), opts.end(), [&ammo_type]( const item & lhs, const item & rhs ) {
808 return lhs.ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) < rhs.ammo_capacity( ammo_type );
809 } );
810 auto iter = std::find_if( opts.begin(), opts.end(), [&qty, &ammo_type]( const item & mag ) {
811 return mag.ammo_capacity( ammo_type ) >= qty;
812 } );
813 if( iter != opts.end() ) {
814 mag = iter->typeId();
815 } else {
816 mag = opts.back().typeId();
817 }
818 }
819 put_in( item( mag ), pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL );
820 }
821 item *mag_cur = magazine_current();
822 if( mag_cur != nullptr ) {
823 mag_cur->ammo_set( ammo, qty );
824 }
825 }
826 return *this;
827}
828
829item &item::ammo_unset()
830{
831 if( !is_tool() && !is_gun() && !is_magazine() ) {
832 // do nothing
833 } else if( is_magazine() ) {
834 if( is_money() ) { // charges are set wrong on cash cards.
835 charges = 0;
836 }
837 contents.clear_magazines();
838 } else if( magazine_integral() ) {
839 charges = 0;
840 if( is_gun() ) {
841 contents.clear_magazines();
842 }
843 } else if( magazine_current() ) {
844 magazine_current()->ammo_unset();
845 }
846
847 return *this;
848}
849
850int item::damage() const
851{
852 return damage_;
853}
854
855int item::degradation() const
856{
857 return degradation_;
858}
859
860void item::rand_degradation()
861{
862 if( type->degrade_increments() == 0 ) {
863 return; // likely count_by_charges
864 }
865 set_degradation( rng( 0, damage() ) * 50.0f / type->degrade_increments() );
866}
867
868int item::damage_level( bool precise ) const
869{
870 return precise ? damage_ : type->damage_level( damage_ );
871}
872
873float item::damage_adjusted_melee_weapon_damage( float value ) const
874{
875 if( type->count_by_charges() ) {
876 return value; // count by charges items don't have partial damage
877 }
878 return value * ( 1.0f - 0.1f * std::max( 0, damage_level() - 1 ) );
879}
880
881float item::damage_adjusted_gun_damage( float value ) const
882{
883 if( type->count_by_charges() ) {
884 return value; // count by charges items don't have partial damage
885 }
886 return value - 2 * std::max( 0, damage_level() - 1 );
887}
888
889float item::damage_adjusted_armor_resist( float value ) const
890{
891 if( type->count_by_charges() ) {
892 return value; // count by charges items don't have partial damage
893 }
894 return value * ( 1.0f - std::max( 0, damage_level() - 1 ) * 0.125f );
895}
896
897void item::set_damage( int qty )
898{
899 damage_ = std::clamp( qty, degradation_, max_damage() );
900}
901
902void item::set_degradation( int qty )
903{
904 if( type->degrade_increments() > 0 ) {
905 degradation_ = std::clamp( qty, 0, max_damage() );
906 } else {
907 degradation_ = 0;
908 }
909 set_damage( damage_ );
910}
911
912item item::split( int qty )
913{
914 if( !count_by_charges() || qty <= 0 || qty >= charges ) {
915 return item();
916 }
917 item res = *this;
918 res.charges = qty;
919 charges -= qty;
920 return res;
921}
922
923bool item::is_null() const
924{
925 // Actually, type should never by null at all.
926 return ( type == nullptr || type == nullitem() || typeId().is_null() );
927}
928
929bool item::is_frozen_liquid() const
930{
931 return made_of( phase_id::SOLID ) && made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID );
932}
933
934bool item::covers( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const
935{
936 // if the item has no armor data it doesn't cover that part
937 const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
938 if( armor == nullptr ) {
939 return false;
940 }
941
942 bool has_sub_data = false;
943
944 // If the item has no sub location info and covers the part's parent,
945 // then assume that the item covers that sub body part.
946 for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->sub_data ) {
947 if( !data.sub_coverage.empty() ) {
948 has_sub_data = true;
949 }
950 }
951
952 if( !has_sub_data ) {
953 return covers( bp->parent );
954 }
955
956 bool does_cover = false;
957 bool subpart_cover = false;
958
959 iterate_covered_sub_body_parts_internal( get_side(), [&]( const sub_bodypart_str_id & covered ) {
960 does_cover = does_cover || bp == covered;
961 } );
962
963 return does_cover || subpart_cover;
964}
965
966bool item::covers( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
967{
968 bool does_cover = false;
969 bool subpart_cover = false;
970 iterate_covered_body_parts_internal( get_side(), [&]( const bodypart_str_id & covered ) {
971 does_cover = does_cover || bp == covered;
972 } );
973
974 return does_cover || subpart_cover;
975}
976
977std::optional<side> item::covers_overlaps( const item &rhs ) const
978{
979 if( get_layer() != rhs.get_layer() ) {
980 return std::nullopt;
981 }
982 const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
983 if( armor == nullptr ) {
984 return std::nullopt;
985 }
986 const islot_armor *rhs_armor = rhs.find_armor_data();
987 if( rhs_armor == nullptr ) {
988 return std::nullopt;
989 }
990 body_part_set this_covers;
991 for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->data ) {
992 if( data.covers.has_value() ) {
993 this_covers.unify_set( *data.covers );
994 }
995 }
996 body_part_set rhs_covers;
997 for( const armor_portion_data &data : rhs_armor->data ) {
998 if( data.covers.has_value() ) {
999 rhs_covers.unify_set( *data.covers );
1000 }
1001 }
1002 if( this_covers.intersect_set( rhs_covers ).any() ) {
1003 return rhs.get_side();
1004 } else {
1005 return std::nullopt;
1006 }
1007}
1008
1009std::vector<sub_bodypart_id> item::get_covered_sub_body_parts() const
1010{
1011 return get_covered_sub_body_parts( get_side() );
1012}
1013
1014std::vector<sub_bodypart_id> item::get_covered_sub_body_parts( const side s ) const
1015{
1016 std::vector<sub_bodypart_id> res;
1017 iterate_covered_sub_body_parts_internal( s, [&]( const sub_bodypart_id & bp ) {
1018 res.push_back( bp );
1019 } );
1020 return res;
1021}
1022
1023body_part_set item::get_covered_body_parts() const
1024{
1025 return get_covered_body_parts( get_side() );
1026}
1027
1028body_part_set item::get_covered_body_parts( const side s ) const
1029{
1030 body_part_set res;
1031 iterate_covered_body_parts_internal( s, [&]( const bodypart_str_id & bp ) {
1032 res.set( bp );
1033 } );
1034 return res;
1035}
1036
1037namespace
1038{
1039
1040const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> &left_side_parts()
1041{
1042 static const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> result{ {
1043 body_part_arm_l,
1044 body_part_hand_l,
1045 body_part_leg_l,
1046 body_part_foot_l
1047 } };
1048 return result;
1049}
1050
1051const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> &right_side_parts()
1052{
1053 static const std::array<bodypart_str_id, 4> result{ {
1054 body_part_arm_r,
1055 body_part_hand_r,
1056 body_part_leg_r,
1057 body_part_foot_r
1058 } };
1059 return result;
1060}
1061
1062} // namespace
1063
1064static void iterate_helper_sbp( const item *i, const side s,
1065 const std::function<void( const sub_bodypart_str_id & )> &cb )
1066{
1067 const islot_armor *armor = i->find_armor_data();
1068 if( armor == nullptr ) {
1069 return;
1070 }
1071
1072 for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->sub_data ) {
1073 if( !data.sub_coverage.empty() ) {
1074 if( !armor->sided || s == side::BOTH || s == side::num_sides ) {
1075 for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.sub_coverage ) {
1076 cb( bpid );
1077 }
1078 continue;
1079 }
1080 for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.sub_coverage ) {
1081 if( bpid->part_side == s || bpid->part_side == side::BOTH ) {
1082 cb( bpid );
1083 }
1084 }
1085 }
1086 }
1087}
1088
1089void item::iterate_covered_sub_body_parts_internal( const side s,
1090 const std::function<void( const sub_bodypart_str_id & )> &cb ) const
1091{
1092 iterate_helper_sbp( this, s, cb );
1093
1094 //check for ablative armor too
1095 if( is_ablative() ) {
1096 for( const item_pocket *pocket : get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
1097 if( !pocket->empty() ) {
1098 // get the contained plate
1099 const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
1100
1101 iterate_helper_sbp( &ablative_armor, s, cb );
1102 }
1103 }
1104 }
1105}
1106
1107static void iterate_helper( const item *i, const side s,
1108 const std::function<void( const bodypart_str_id & )> &cb )
1109{
1110 const islot_armor *armor = i->find_armor_data();
1111 if( armor == nullptr ) {
1112 return;
1113 }
1114
1115 // If we are querying for only one side of the body, we ignore coverage
1116 // for parts on the opposite side of the body.
1117 const auto &opposite_side_parts = s == side::LEFT ? right_side_parts() : left_side_parts();
1118
1119 for( const armor_portion_data &data : armor->data ) {
1120 if( data.covers.has_value() ) {
1121 if( !armor->sided || s == side::BOTH || s == side::num_sides ) {
1122 for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
1123 cb( bpid );
1124 }
1125 continue;
1126 }
1127 for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
1128 if( std::find( opposite_side_parts.begin(), opposite_side_parts.end(),
1129 bpid ) == opposite_side_parts.end() ) {
1130 cb( bpid );
1131 }
1132 }
1133 }
1134 }
1135}
1136
1137void item::iterate_covered_body_parts_internal( const side s,
1138 const std::function<void( const bodypart_str_id & )> &cb ) const
1139{
1140 iterate_helper( this, s, cb );
1141
1142 //check for ablative armor too
1143 if( is_ablative() ) {
1144 for( const item_pocket *pocket : get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
1145 if( !pocket->empty() ) {
1146 // get the contained plate
1147 const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
1148
1149 iterate_helper( &ablative_armor, s, cb );
1150 }
1151 }
1152 }
1153}
1154
1155bool item::is_sided() const
1156{
1157 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1158 return t ? t->sided : false;
1159}
1160
1161side item::get_side() const
1162{
1163 // MSVC complains if directly cast double to enum
1164 return static_cast<side>( static_cast<int>( get_var( STATIC( std::string{ "lateral" } )(([]()-> const auto &{ using ExprType = std::decay_t<
decltype(static_argument_identity( std::string{ "lateral" } )
)>; using CachedType = std::conditional_t<std::is_same_v
<ExprType, const char*>, std::string, ExprType>; static
const CachedType _cached_expr = static_argument_identity( std
::string{ "lateral" } ); return _cached_expr; })()),
1165 static_cast<int>( side::BOTH ) ) ) );
1166}
1167
1168bool item::set_side( side s )
1169{
1170 if( !is_sided() ) {
1171 return false;
1172 }
1173
1174 if( s == side::BOTH ) {
1175 erase_var( "lateral" );
1176 } else {
1177 set_var( "lateral", static_cast<int>( s ) );
1178 }
1179
1180 return true;
1181}
1182
1183bool item::swap_side()
1184{
1185 return set_side( opposite_side( get_side() ) );
1186}
1187
1188bool item::is_ablative() const
1189{
1190 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1191 return t ? t->ablative : false;
1192}
1193
1194bool item::has_additional_encumbrance() const
1195{
1196 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1197 return t ? t->additional_pocket_enc : false;
1198}
1199
1200bool item::has_ripoff_pockets() const
1201{
1202 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1203 return t ? t->ripoff_chance : false;
1204}
1205
1206bool item::has_noisy_pockets() const
1207{
1208 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
1209 return t ? t->noisy : false;
1210}
1211
1212bool item::is_worn_only_with( const item &it ) const
1213{
1214 return is_power_armor() && it.is_power_armor() && it.covers( bodypart_id( "torso" ) );
1215}
1216bool item::is_worn_by_player() const
1217{
1218 return get_player_character().is_worn( *this );
1219}
1220
1221item item::in_its_container( int qty ) const
1222{
1223 return in_container( type->default_container.value_or( itype_null ), qty,
1224 type->default_container_sealed, type->default_container_variant.value_or( "" ) );
1225}
1226
1227item item::in_container( const itype_id &cont, int qty, bool sealed,
1228 const std::string &variant ) const
1229{
1230 if( cont.is_null() ) {
1231 return *this;
1232 }
1233
1234 if( qty <= 0 ) {
1235 qty = count();
1236 }
1237 item container( cont, birthday() );
1238 if( !variant.empty() ) {
1239 container.set_itype_variant( variant );
1240 }
1241 if( container.is_container() ) {
1242 container.fill_with( *this, qty );
1243 container.invlet = invlet;
1244 if( sealed ) {
1245 container.seal();
1246 }
1247 if( !container.has_item_with( [&cont]( const item & it ) {
1248 return it.typeId() == cont;
1249 } ) ) {
1250 debugmsg( "ERROR: failed to put %s in its container %s", typeId().c_str(), cont.c_str() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1250", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "ERROR: failed to put %s in its container %s"
, typeId().c_str(), cont.c_str());
1251 return *this;
1252 }
1253 container.add_automatic_whitelist();
1254 return container;
1255 } else if( is_software() && container.is_software_storage() ) {
1256 container.put_in( *this, pocket_type::SOFTWARE );
1257 container.invlet = invlet;
1258 return container;
1259 }
1260 return *this;
1261}
1262
1263void item::add_automatic_whitelist()
1264{
1265 std::vector<item_pocket *> pkts = get_all_contained_pockets();
1266 if( pkts.size() == 1 && contents_only_one_type() ) {
1267 pkts.front()->settings.whitelist_item( contents.first_item().typeId() );
1268 pkts.front()->settings.set_priority( 100 );
1269 }
1270}
1271
1272void item::clear_automatic_whitelist()
1273{
1274 std::vector<item_pocket *> pkts = get_all_contained_pockets();
1275 if( pkts.size() == 1 && !pkts.front()->settings.was_edited() ) {
1276 cata::flat_set<itype_id> const &wl = pkts.front()->settings.get_item_whitelist();
1277 if( !wl.empty() ) {
1278 pkts.front()->settings.clear_item( *wl.begin() );
1279 pkts.front()->settings.set_priority( 0 );
1280 }
1281 }
1282}
1283
1284void item::update_modified_pockets()
1285{
1286 std::optional<const pocket_data *> mag_or_mag_well;
1287 std::vector<const pocket_data *> container_pockets;
1288
1289 // Prevent cleanup of pockets belonging to the item base type
1290 for( const pocket_data &pocket : type->pockets ) {
1291 if( pocket.type == pocket_type::CONTAINER ) {
1292 container_pockets.push_back( &pocket );
1293 } else if( pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE ||
1294 pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL ) {
1295 mag_or_mag_well = &pocket;
1296 }
1297 }
1298
1299 // Prevent cleanup of added modular pockets
1300 for( const item *it : contents.get_added_pockets() ) {
1301 for( const pocket_data &pocket : it->type->pockets ) {
1302 if( pocket.type == pocket_type::CONTAINER ) {
1303 container_pockets.push_back( &pocket );
1304 }
1305 }
1306 }
1307
1308 for( const item *mod : mods() ) {
1309 if( mod->type->mod ) {
1310 for( const pocket_data &pocket : mod->type->mod->add_pockets ) {
1311 if( pocket.type == pocket_type::CONTAINER ) {
1312 container_pockets.push_back( &pocket );
1313 } else if( pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE ||
1314 pocket.type == pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL ) {
1315 mag_or_mag_well = &pocket;
1316 }
1317 }
1318 }
1319 }
1320
1321 contents.update_modified_pockets( mag_or_mag_well, container_pockets );
1322}
1323
1324int item::charges_per_volume( const units::volume &vol, bool suppress_warning ) const
1325{
1326 if( count_by_charges() ) {
1327 if( type->volume == 0_ml ) {
1328 if( !suppress_warning ) {
1329 debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1329", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname
());
1330 }
1331 return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1332 }
1333 // Type cast to prevent integer overflow with large volume containers like the cargo
1334 // dimension
1335 return vol * static_cast<int64_t>( type->stack_size ) / type->volume;
1336 } else {
1337 units::volume my_volume = volume();
1338 if( my_volume == 0_ml ) {
1339 if( !suppress_warning ) {
1340 debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1340", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname
());
1341 }
1342 return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1343 }
1344 return vol / my_volume;
1345 }
1346}
1347
1348int item::charges_per_weight( const units::mass &m, bool suppress_warning ) const
1349{
1350 if( count_by_charges() ) {
1351 if( type->weight == 0_gram ) {
1352 if( !suppress_warning ) {
1353 debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero weight", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1353", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Item '%s' with zero weight", tname
());
1354 }
1355 return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1356 }
1357 return m / type->weight;
1358 } else {
1359 units::mass my_weight = weight();
1360 if( my_weight == 0_gram ) {
1361 if( !suppress_warning ) {
1362 debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero weight", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1362", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Item '%s' with zero weight", tname
());
1363 }
1364 return INFINITE_CHARGES;
1365 }
1366 return m / my_weight;
1367 }
1368}
1369
1370bool item::display_stacked_with( const item &rhs, bool check_components ) const
1371{
1372 return !count_by_charges() && stacks_with( rhs, check_components );
1373}
1374
1375bool item::can_combine( const item &rhs ) const
1376{
1377 if( !contents.empty() || !rhs.contents.empty() ) {
1378 return false;
1379 }
1380 if( !count_by_charges() ) {
1381 return false;
1382 }
1383 if( !stacks_with( rhs, true, true ) ) {
1384 return false;
1385 }
1386 return true;
1387}
1388
1389bool item::combine( const item &rhs )
1390{
1391 if( !can_combine( rhs ) ) {
1392 return false;
1393 }
1394 if( has_temperature() ) {
1395 if( goes_bad() ) {
1396 //use maximum rot between the two
1397 set_relative_rot( std::max( get_relative_rot(),
1398 rhs.get_relative_rot() ) );
1399 }
1400 const float lhs_energy = get_item_thermal_energy();
1401 const float rhs_energy = rhs.get_item_thermal_energy();
1402 if( rhs_energy > 0 && lhs_energy > 0 ) {
1403 const float combined_specific_energy = ( lhs_energy + rhs_energy ) / ( to_gram(
1404 weight() ) + to_gram( rhs.weight() ) );
1405 set_item_specific_energy( units::from_joule_per_gram( combined_specific_energy ) );
1406 }
1407
1408 }
1409 charges += rhs.charges;
1410 if( !rhs.has_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES ) ) {
1411 unset_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES );
1412 }
1413 return true;
1414}
1415
1416bool item::same_for_rle( const item &rhs ) const
1417{
1418 if( type != rhs.type ) {
1419 return false;
1420 }
1421 if( charges != rhs.charges ) {
1422 return false;
1423 }
1424 if( !contents.empty_with_no_mods() || !rhs.contents.empty_with_no_mods() ) {
1425 return false;
1426 }
1427 if( has_itype_variant( false ) != rhs.has_itype_variant( false ) ||
1428 ( has_itype_variant( false ) && rhs.has_itype_variant( false ) &&
1429 itype_variant().id != rhs.itype_variant().id ) ) {
1430 return false;
1431 }
1432 return stacks_with( rhs, true, false, false, 0, 999, true );
1433}
1434
1435namespace
1436{
1437
1438bool _stacks_whiteblacklist( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1439{
1440 bool wbl = false;
1441 if( lhs.get_contents().size() == rhs.get_contents().size() ) {
1442 std::vector<item_pocket const *> const lpkts = lhs.get_all_contained_pockets();
1443 std::vector<item_pocket const *> const rpkts = rhs.get_all_contained_pockets();
1444 if( lpkts.size() == rpkts.size() ) {
1445 wbl = true;
1446 for( std::size_t i = 0; i < lpkts.size(); i++ ) {
1447 wbl &= lpkts[i]->settings.get_item_whitelist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_item_whitelist() &&
1448 lpkts[i]->settings.get_item_blacklist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_item_blacklist() &&
1449 lpkts[i]->settings.get_category_whitelist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_category_whitelist() &&
1450 lpkts[i]->settings.get_category_blacklist() == rpkts[i]->settings.get_category_blacklist();
1451 if( !wbl ) {
1452 break;
1453 }
1454 }
1455 }
1456 }
1457 return wbl;
1458}
1459
1460bool _stacks_weapon_mods( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1461{
1462 item const *const lb = lhs.is_gun() ? lhs.gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) : nullptr;
1463 item const *const rb = rhs.is_gun() ? rhs.gunmod_find( itype_barrel_small ) : nullptr;
1464 return ( ( lb && rb ) || ( !lb && !rb ) ) &&
1465 lhs.has_flag( flag_REMOVED_STOCK ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_REMOVED_STOCK ) &&
1466 lhs.has_flag( flag_DIAMOND ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_DIAMOND );
1467}
1468
1469bool _stacks_location_hint( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1470{
1471 static const std::string omt_loc_var = "spawn_location_omt";
1472 const tripoint_abs_omt this_loc( lhs.get_var( omt_loc_var, tripoint_max ) );
1473 const tripoint_abs_omt that_loc( rhs.get_var( omt_loc_var, tripoint_max ) );
1474 if( this_loc == that_loc ) {
1475 return true;
1476 } else if( this_loc.raw() != tripoint_max && that_loc.raw() != tripoint_max ) {
1477 const tripoint_abs_omt player_loc( ms_to_omt_copy( get_map().getabs(
1478 get_player_character().pos() ) ) );
1479 const int this_dist = rl_dist( player_loc, this_loc );
1480 const int that_dist = rl_dist( player_loc, that_loc );
1481 static const auto get_bucket = []( const int dist ) {
1482 if( dist < 1 ) {
1483 return 0;
1484 } else if( dist < 6 ) {
1485 return 1;
1486 } else if( dist < 30 ) {
1487 return 2;
1488 } else {
1489 return 3;
1490 }
1491 };
1492 return get_bucket( this_dist ) == get_bucket( that_dist );
1493 }
1494 return false;
1495}
1496
1497bool _stacks_rot( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool combine_liquid )
1498{
1499 // Stack items that fall into the same "bucket" of freshness.
1500 // Distant buckets are larger than near ones.
1501 std::pair<int, clipped_unit> my_clipped_time_to_rot =
1502 clipped_time( std::max( lhs.get_shelf_life() - lhs.get_rot(), 0_seconds ) );
1503 std::pair<int, clipped_unit> other_clipped_time_to_rot =
1504 clipped_time( std::max( rhs.get_shelf_life() - rhs.get_rot(), 0_seconds ) );
1505
1506 return ( ( combine_liquid && lhs.made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) &&
1507 rhs.made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) ||
1508 my_clipped_time_to_rot == other_clipped_time_to_rot ) &&
1509 lhs.rotten() == rhs.rotten();
1510}
1511
1512bool _stacks_mushy_dirty( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1513{
1514 return lhs.has_flag( flag_MUSHY ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_MUSHY ) &&
1515 lhs.has_own_flag( flag_DIRTY ) == rhs.has_own_flag( flag_DIRTY );
1516}
1517
1518bool _stacks_food_status( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1519{
1520 return ( lhs.is_fresh() == rhs.is_fresh() || lhs.is_going_bad() == rhs.is_going_bad() ||
1521 lhs.rotten() == rhs.rotten() ) &&
1522 _stacks_mushy_dirty( lhs, rhs );
1523}
1524
1525bool _stacks_food_traits( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1526{
1527 return ( !lhs.is_food() && !rhs.is_food() ) ||
1528 ( lhs.is_food() && rhs.is_food() &&
1529 lhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_POISON ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_POISON ) &&
1530 lhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_HALLU ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_HALLU ) );
1531}
1532
1533bool _stacks_food_irradiated( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1534{
1535 return lhs.has_flag( flag_IRRADIATED ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_IRRADIATED );
1536}
1537
1538bool _stacks_food_perishable( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool check_cat )
1539{
1540 return !check_cat || ( !lhs.is_food() && !rhs.is_food() ) ||
1541 ( lhs.is_food() && rhs.is_food() && lhs.goes_bad() == rhs.goes_bad() &&
1542 lhs.has_flag( flag_INEDIBLE ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_INEDIBLE ) );
1543}
1544
1545bool _stacks_clothing_size( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1546{
1547 avatar &u = get_avatar();
1548 item::sizing const u_sizing = lhs.get_sizing( u );
1549 return u_sizing == rhs.get_sizing( u ) &&
1550 ( u_sizing == item::sizing::ignore ||
1551 ( lhs.has_flag( flag_FIT ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_FIT ) &&
1552 lhs.has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) ) );
1553}
1554
1555bool _stacks_wetness( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool precise )
1556{
1557 return lhs.wetness == rhs.wetness || ( !precise && ( lhs.wetness > 0 ) == ( rhs.wetness > 0 ) );
1558}
1559
1560bool _stacks_cbm_status( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1561{
1562 return ( !lhs.is_bionic() && !rhs.is_bionic() ) ||
1563 ( lhs.is_bionic() && rhs.is_bionic() &&
1564 lhs.has_flag( flag_NO_PACKED ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_NO_PACKED ) &&
1565 lhs.has_flag( flag_NO_STERILE ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_NO_STERILE ) );
1566}
1567
1568bool _stacks_ethereal( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1569{
1570 static const std::string varname( "ethereal" );
1571 return ( !lhs.ethereal && !rhs.ethereal ) ||
1572 ( lhs. ethereal && rhs.ethereal && lhs.get_var( varname ) == rhs.get_var( varname ) );
1573}
1574
1575bool _stacks_ups( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1576{
1577 return ( !lhs.is_tool() && !rhs.is_tool() ) ||
1578 ( lhs.is_tool() && rhs.is_tool() &&
1579 lhs.has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) );
1580}
1581
1582bool _stacks_mods( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1583{
1584 const std::vector<const item *> this_mods = lhs.mods();
1585 const std::vector<const item *> that_mods = rhs.mods();
1586 if( lhs.is_armor() && rhs.is_armor() && lhs.has_clothing_mod() != rhs.has_clothing_mod() ) {
1587 return false;
1588 }
1589 if( this_mods.size() != that_mods.size() ) {
1590 return false;
1591 }
1592 for( const item *it1 : this_mods ) {
1593 bool match = false;
1594 const bool i1_isnull = it1 == nullptr;
1595 for( const item *it2 : that_mods ) {
1596 const bool i2_isnull = it2 == nullptr;
1597 if( i1_isnull != i2_isnull ) {
1598 continue;
1599 } else if( it1 == it2 || it1->typeId() == it2->typeId() ) {
1600 match = true;
1601 break;
1602 }
1603 }
1604 if( !match ) {
1605 return false;
1606 }
1607 }
1608 return true;
1609}
1610
1611bool _stacks_variant( item const &lhs, item const &rhs )
1612{
1613 return ( !lhs.has_itype_variant() && !rhs.has_itype_variant() ) ||
1614 ( lhs.has_itype_variant() && rhs.has_itype_variant() &&
1615 lhs.itype_variant().id == rhs.itype_variant().id );
1616}
1617
1618bool _stacks_components( item const &lhs, item const &rhs, bool check_components )
1619{
1620 return ( !check_components && !lhs.is_comestible() && !lhs.is_craft() ) ||
1621 // Only check if at least one item isn't using the default recipe or is comestible
1622 ( lhs.components.empty() && rhs.components.empty() ) ||
1623 ( lhs.get_uncraft_components() == rhs.get_uncraft_components() );
1624}
1625
1626} // namespace
1627
1628stacking_info item::stacks_with( const item &rhs, bool check_components, bool combine_liquid,
1629 bool check_cat, int depth, int maxdepth, bool precise ) const
1630{
1631 tname::segment_bitset bits;
1632 if( type == rhs.type ) {
1633 bits.set( tname::segments::TYPE );
1634 bits.set( tname::segments::WHEEL_DIAMETER );
1635 bits.set( tname::segments::WHITEBLACKLIST, _stacks_whiteblacklist( *this, rhs ) );
1636 }
1637
1638 if( !check_cat && bits.none() ) {
1639 return {};
1640 }
1641
1642 bits.set( tname::segments::CATEGORY,
1643 !check_cat ||
1644 get_category_of_contents( depth, maxdepth ).get_id() ==
1645 rhs.get_category_of_contents( depth, maxdepth ).get_id() );
1646
1647 if( check_cat && bits.none() ) {
1648 return {};
1649 }
1650
1651 bits.set( tname::segments::VARIANT, _stacks_variant( *this, rhs ) );
1652 bool const same_type = bits[tname::segments::TYPE] && bits[tname::segments::VARIANT];
1653
1654 bits.set( tname::segments::RELIC, is_same_relic( rhs ) );
1655
1656 // This function is also used to test whether items counted by charges should be merged, for that
1657 // check the, the charges must be ignored. In all other cases (tools/guns), the charges are important.
1658 bits.set( tname::segments::CHARGES,
1659 same_type && ( count_by_charges() || charges == rhs.charges ) );
1660 bits.set( tname::segments::FAVORITE_PRE, is_favorite == rhs.is_favorite );
1661 bits.set( tname::segments::FAVORITE_POST, is_favorite == rhs.is_favorite );
1662 bits.set( tname::segments::DURABILITY,
1663 damage_level( precise ) == rhs.damage_level( precise ) && degradation_ == rhs.degradation_ );
1664 bits.set( tname::segments::BURN, burnt == rhs.burnt );
1665 bits.set( tname::segments::ACTIVE, active == rhs.active );
1666 bits.set( tname::segments::FILTHY, is_filthy() == rhs.is_filthy() );
1667 bits.set( tname::segments::WETNESS, _stacks_wetness( *this, rhs, precise ) );
1668 bits.set( tname::segments::WEAPON_MODS, _stacks_weapon_mods( *this, rhs ) );
1669
1670 if( combine_liquid && same_type && has_temperature() && made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
1671 // we can combine liquids of same type and different temperatures
1672 bits.set( tname::segments::TAGS, equal_ignoring_elements( rhs.get_flags(), get_flags(),
1673 { flag_COLD, flag_FROZEN, flag_HOT, flag_NO_PARASITES, flag_FROM_FROZEN_LIQUID } ) );
1674 bits.set( tname::segments::TEMPERATURE );
1675 } else {
1676 bits.set( tname::segments::TEMPERATURE, is_same_temperature( rhs ) );
1677 bits.set( tname::segments::TAGS, item_tags == rhs.item_tags );
1678 }
1679
1680 bits.set( tname::segments::CUSTOM_ITEM_PREFIX, bits[tname::segments::TAGS] );
1681 bits.set( tname::segments::CUSTOM_ITEM_SUFFIX, bits[tname::segments::TAGS] );
1682
1683 bits.set( tname::segments::FAULTS, faults == rhs.faults );
1684 bits.set( tname::segments::TECHNIQUES, techniques == rhs.techniques );
1685 bits.set( tname::segments::OVERHEAT, overheat_symbol() == rhs.overheat_symbol() );
1686 bits.set( tname::segments::DIRT, get_var( "dirt", 0 ) == rhs.get_var( "dirt", 0 ) );
1687 bits.set( tname::segments::SEALED, all_pockets_sealed() == rhs.all_pockets_sealed() );
1688 bits.set( tname::segments::CBM_STATUS, _stacks_cbm_status( *this, rhs ) );
1689 bits.set( tname::segments::BROKEN, is_broken() == rhs.is_broken() );
1690 bits.set( tname::segments::UPS, _stacks_ups( *this, rhs ) );
1691 // Guns that differ only by dirt/shot_counter can still stack,
1692 // but other item_vars such as label/note will prevent stacking
1693 static const std::set<std::string> ignore_keys = { "dirt", "shot_counter", "spawn_location_omt", "ethereal" };
1694 bits.set( tname::segments::VARS, map_equal_ignoring_keys( item_vars, rhs.item_vars, ignore_keys ) );
1695 bits.set( tname::segments::ETHEREAL, _stacks_ethereal( *this, rhs ) );
1696 bits.set( tname::segments::LOCATION_HINT, _stacks_location_hint( *this, rhs ) );
1697
1698 bool const this_goes_bad = goes_bad();
1699 bool const that_goes_bad = rhs.goes_bad();
1700 if( this_goes_bad && that_goes_bad ) {
1701 if( same_type ) {
1702 bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_STATUS,
1703 _stacks_rot( *this, rhs, combine_liquid ) && _stacks_mushy_dirty( *this, rhs ) );
1704
1705 } else {
1706 bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_STATUS, _stacks_food_status( *this, rhs ) );
1707 }
1708 bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_IRRADIATED, _stacks_food_irradiated( *this, rhs ) );
1709 } else if( !this_goes_bad && !that_goes_bad ) {
1710 bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_STATUS );
1711 bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_IRRADIATED );
1712 }
1713
1714 bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_TRAITS, _stacks_food_traits( *this, rhs ) );
1715 bits.set( tname::segments::CORPSE,
1716 ( corpse == nullptr && rhs.corpse == nullptr ) ||
1717 ( corpse != nullptr && rhs.corpse != nullptr && corpse->id == rhs.corpse->id &&
1718 corpse_name == rhs.corpse_name ) );
1719 bits.set( tname::segments::FOOD_PERISHABLE, _stacks_food_perishable( *this, rhs, check_cat ) );
1720 bits.set( tname::segments::CLOTHING_SIZE, _stacks_clothing_size( *this, rhs ) );
1721 bits.set( tname::segments::BROKEN, is_broken() == rhs.is_broken() );
1722 // In-progress crafts are always distinct items. Easier to handle for the player,
1723 // and there shouldn't be that many items of this type around anyway.
1724 bits.set( tname::segments::CRAFT, !craft_data_ && !rhs.craft_data_ );
1725 bits.set( tname::segments::COMPONENTS, same_type &&
1726 _stacks_components( *this, rhs, check_components ) );
1727 bits.set( tname::segments::LINK,
1728 link_length() == rhs.link_length() && max_link_length() == rhs.max_link_length() );
1729 bits.set( tname::segments::MODS, _stacks_mods( *this, rhs ) );
1730 bits.set( tname::segments::last_segment );
1731
1732 // only check contents if everything else matches
1733 bool const b_contents =
1734 ( bits | tname::tname_contents ).all() && contents.stacks_with( rhs.contents, depth, maxdepth );
1735 bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS, b_contents );
1736 bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS_FULL, b_contents );
1737 bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS_ABREV, b_contents );
1738 bits.set( tname::segments::CONTENTS_COUNT, b_contents );
1739 return { bits };
1740}
1741
1742bool item::same_contents( const item &rhs ) const
1743{
1744 return get_contents().same_contents( rhs.get_contents() );
1745}
1746
1747bool item::merge_charges( const item &rhs )
1748{
1749 if( !count_by_charges() || !stacks_with( rhs ) ) {
1750 return false;
1751 }
1752 // Prevent overflow when either item has "near infinite" charges.
1753 if( charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES / 2 || rhs.charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES / 2 ) {
1754 charges = INFINITE_CHARGES;
1755 return true;
1756 }
1757 // We'll just hope that the item counter represents the same thing for both items
1758 if( item_counter > 0 || rhs.item_counter > 0 ) {
1759 item_counter = ( static_cast<double>( item_counter ) * charges + static_cast<double>
1760 ( rhs.item_counter ) * rhs.charges ) / ( charges + rhs.charges );
1761 }
1762 charges += rhs.charges;
1763 return true;
1764}
1765
1766int item::obtain_cost( const item &it ) const
1767{
1768 return contents.obtain_cost( it );
1769}
1770
1771int item::insert_cost( const item &it ) const
1772{
1773 return contents.insert_cost( it );
1774}
1775
1776ret_val<void> item::put_in( const item &payload, pocket_type pk_type,
1777 const bool unseal_pockets, Character *carrier )
1778{
1779 ret_val<item *> result = contents.insert_item( payload, pk_type, false, unseal_pockets );
1780 if( !result.success() ) {
1781 debugmsg( "tried to put an item (%s) count (%d) in a container (%s) that cannot contain it: %s",realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1782", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "tried to put an item (%s) count (%d) in a container (%s) that cannot contain it: %s"
, payload.typeId().str(), payload.count(), typeId().str(), result
.str())
1782 payload.typeId().str(), payload.count(), typeId().str(), result.str() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1782", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "tried to put an item (%s) count (%d) in a container (%s) that cannot contain it: %s"
, payload.typeId().str(), payload.count(), typeId().str(), result
.str());
1783 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( result.str() );
1784 }
1785 if( pk_type == pocket_type::MOD ) {
1786 update_modified_pockets();
1787 }
1788 if( carrier ) {
1789 result.value()->on_pickup( *carrier );
1790 }
1791 on_contents_changed();
1792 return ret_val<void>::make_success( result.str() );
1793}
1794
1795void item::force_insert_item( const item &it, pocket_type pk_type )
1796{
1797 contents.force_insert_item( it, pk_type );
1798 update_inherited_flags();
1799}
1800
1801void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const int value )
1802{
1803 std::ostringstream tmpstream;
1804 tmpstream.imbue( std::locale::classic() );
1805 tmpstream << value;
1806 item_vars[name] = tmpstream.str();
1807}
1808
1809void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const long long value )
1810{
1811 std::ostringstream tmpstream;
1812 tmpstream.imbue( std::locale::classic() );
1813 tmpstream << value;
1814 item_vars[name] = tmpstream.str();
1815}
1816
1817// NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-no-long)
1818void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const long value )
1819{
1820 std::ostringstream tmpstream;
1821 tmpstream.imbue( std::locale::classic() );
1822 tmpstream << value;
1823 item_vars[name] = tmpstream.str();
1824}
1825
1826void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const double value )
1827{
1828 item_vars[name] = string_format( "%f", value );
1829}
1830
1831double item::get_var( const std::string &name, const double default_value ) const
1832{
1833 const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1834 if( it == item_vars.end() ) {
1835 return default_value;
1836 }
1837 const std::string &val = it->second;
1838 char *end;
1839 errno(*__errno_location ()) = 0;
1840 double result = strtod( val.data(), &end );
1841 if( errno(*__errno_location ()) != 0 ) {
1842 debugmsg( "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s",realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1843", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s"
, val, strerror( (*__errno_location ()) ))
1843 val, strerror( errno ) )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1843", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s"
, val, strerror( (*__errno_location ()) ));
1844 return default_value;
1845 }
1846 if( end != val.data() + val.size() ) {
1847 if( *end == ',' ) {
1848 // likely legacy format with localized ',' for fraction separator instead of '.'
1849 std::string converted_val = val;
1850 converted_val[end - val.data()] = '.';
1851 errno(*__errno_location ()) = 0;
1852 double result = strtod( converted_val.data(), &end );
1853 if( errno(*__errno_location ()) != 0 ) {
1854 debugmsg( "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s",realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1855", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s"
, val, strerror( (*__errno_location ()) ))
1855 val, strerror( errno ) )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1855", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Error parsing floating point value from %s in item::get_var: %s"
, val, strerror( (*__errno_location ()) ));
1856 return default_value;
1857 }
1858 if( end != converted_val.data() + converted_val.size() ) {
1859 debugmsg( "Stray characters at end of floating point value %s in item::get_var", val )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1859", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Stray characters at end of floating point value %s in item::get_var"
, val);
1860 }
1861 return result;
1862 }
1863 debugmsg( "Stray characters at end of floating point value %s in item::get_var", val )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1863", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Stray characters at end of floating point value %s in item::get_var"
, val);
1864 }
1865 return result;
1866}
1867
1868void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const tripoint &value )
1869{
1870 item_vars[name] = string_format( "%d,%d,%d", value.x, value.y, value.z );
1871}
1872
1873tripoint item::get_var( const std::string &name, const tripoint &default_value ) const
1874{
1875 const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1876 if( it == item_vars.end() ) {
1877 return default_value;
1878 }
1879 std::vector<std::string> values = string_split( it->second, ',' );
1880 cata_assert( values.size() == 3 )(static_cast <bool> (values.size() == 3) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("values.size() == 3", "/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, 1880, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1881 auto convert_or_error = []( const std::string_view s ) {
1882 ret_val<int> result = try_parse_integer<int>( s, false );
1883 if( result.success() ) {
1884 return result.value();
1885 } else {
1886 debugmsg( "Error parsing tripoint coordinate in item::get_var: %s", result.str() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "1886", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Error parsing tripoint coordinate in item::get_var: %s"
, result.str());
1887 return 0;
1888 }
1889 };
1890 return tripoint( convert_or_error( values[0] ),
1891 convert_or_error( values[1] ),
1892 convert_or_error( values[2] ) );
1893}
1894
1895void item::set_var( const std::string &name, const std::string &value )
1896{
1897 item_vars[name] = value;
1898}
1899
1900std::string item::get_var( const std::string &name, const std::string &default_value ) const
1901{
1902 const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1903 if( it == item_vars.end() ) {
1904 return default_value;
1905 }
1906 return it->second;
1907}
1908
1909std::string item::get_var( const std::string &name ) const
1910{
1911 return get_var( name, "" );
1912}
1913
1914std::optional<std::string> item::maybe_get_var( const std::string &name ) const
1915{
1916 const auto it = item_vars.find( name );
1917 return it == item_vars.end() ? std::nullopt : std::optional<std::string> { it->second };
1918}
1919
1920bool item::has_var( const std::string &name ) const
1921{
1922 return item_vars.count( name ) > 0;
1923}
1924
1925void item::erase_var( const std::string &name )
1926{
1927 item_vars.erase( name );
1928}
1929
1930void item::clear_vars()
1931{
1932 item_vars.clear();
1933}
1934
1935// TODO: Get rid of, handle multiple types gracefully
1936static int get_ranged_pierce( const common_ranged_data &ranged )
1937{
1938 if( ranged.damage.empty() ) {
1939 return 0;
1940 }
1941
1942 return ranged.damage.damage_units.front().res_pen;
1943}
1944
1945std::string item::info( bool showtext ) const
1946{
1947 std::vector<iteminfo> dummy;
1948 return info( showtext, dummy );
1949}
1950
1951std::string item::info( bool showtext, std::vector<iteminfo> &iteminfo ) const
1952{
1953 return info( showtext, iteminfo, 1 );
1954}
1955
1956std::string item::info( bool showtext, std::vector<iteminfo> &iteminfo, int batch ) const
1957{
1958 return info( iteminfo, showtext ? &iteminfo_query::all : &iteminfo_query::notext, batch );
1959}
1960
1961// Generates a long-form description of the freshness of the given rottable food item.
1962// NB: Doesn't check for non-rottable!
1963static std::string get_freshness_description( const item &food_item )
1964{
1965 // So, skilled characters looking at food that is neither super-fresh nor about to rot
1966 // can guess its age as one of {quite fresh,midlife,past midlife,old soon}, and also
1967 // guess about how long until it spoils.
1968 const double rot_progress = food_item.get_relative_rot();
1969 const time_duration shelf_life = food_item.get_shelf_life();
1970 time_duration time_left = shelf_life - ( shelf_life * rot_progress );
1971
1972 // Correct for an estimate that exceeds shelf life -- this happens especially with
1973 // fresh items.
1974 if( time_left > shelf_life ) {
1975 time_left = shelf_life;
1976 }
1977
1978 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1979 if( food_item.is_fresh() ) {
1980 // Fresh food is assumed to be obviously so regardless of skill.
1981 if( player_character.can_estimate_rot() ) {
1982 return string_format( _( "* This food looks as <good>fresh</good> as it can be. "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks as <good>fresh</good> as it can be. "
"It still has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." )
) )
1983 "It still has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks as <good>fresh</good> as it can be. "
"It still has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." )
) ),
1984 to_string_approx( time_left ) );
1985 } else {
1986 return _( "* This food looks as <good>fresh</good> as it can be." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks as <good>fresh</good> as it can be."
) ) );
1987 }
1988 } else if( food_item.is_going_bad() ) {
1989 // Old food likewise is assumed to be fairly obvious.
1990 if( player_character.can_estimate_rot() ) {
1991 return string_format( _( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "
"It's just <info>%s</info> from becoming inedible."
) ) )
1992 "It's just <info>%s</info> from becoming inedible." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "
"It's just <info>%s</info> from becoming inedible."
) ) ),
1993 to_string_approx( time_left ) );
1994 } else {
1995 return _( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "
"It's on the brink of becoming inedible." ) ) )
1996 "It's on the brink of becoming inedible." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <bad>old</bad>. "
"It's on the brink of becoming inedible." ) ) );
1997 }
1998 }
1999
2000 if( !player_character.can_estimate_rot() ) {
2001 // Unskilled characters only get a hint that more information exists...
2002 return _( "* This food looks <info>fine</info>. If you were more skilled in "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <info>fine</info>. If you were more skilled in "
"cooking or survival, you might be able to make a better estimation."
) ) )
2003 "cooking or survival, you might be able to make a better estimation." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <info>fine</info>. If you were more skilled in "
"cooking or survival, you might be able to make a better estimation."
) ) );
2004 }
2005
2006 // Otherwise, a skilled character can determine the below options:
2007 if( rot_progress < 0.3 ) {
2008 //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2009 return string_format( _( "* This food looks <good>quite fresh</good>. "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <good>quite fresh</good>. "
"It has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." ) ) )
2010 "It has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks <good>quite fresh</good>. "
"It has <info>%s</info> until it spoils." ) ) ),
2011 to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2012 } else if( rot_progress < 0.5 ) {
2013 //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2014 return string_format( _( "* This food looks like it is reaching its <neutral>midlife</neutral>. "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks like it is reaching its <neutral>midlife</neutral>. "
"There's <info>%s</info> before it spoils." ) ) )
2015 "There's <info>%s</info> before it spoils." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks like it is reaching its <neutral>midlife</neutral>. "
"There's <info>%s</info> before it spoils." ) ) ),
2016 to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2017 } else if( rot_progress < 0.7 ) {
2018 //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2019 return string_format( _( "* This food looks like it has <neutral>passed its midlife</neutral>. "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks like it has <neutral>passed its midlife</neutral>. "
"Edible, but will go bad in <info>%s</info>." ) )
)
2020 "Edible, but will go bad in <info>%s</info>." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks like it has <neutral>passed its midlife</neutral>. "
"Edible, but will go bad in <info>%s</info>." ) )
),
2021 to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2022 } else {
2023 //~ here, %s is an approximate time span, e.g., "over 2 weeks" or "about 1 season"
2024 return string_format( _( "* This food looks like it <bad>will be old soon</bad>. "( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks like it <bad>will be old soon</bad>. "
"It has <info>%s</info>, so if you plan to use it, it's now or never."
) ) )
2025 "It has <info>%s</info>, so if you plan to use it, it's now or never." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "* This food looks like it <bad>will be old soon</bad>. "
"It has <info>%s</info>, so if you plan to use it, it's now or never."
) ) ),
2026 to_string_approx( time_left ) );
2027 }
2028}
2029
2030item::sizing item::get_sizing( const Character &p ) const
2031{
2032 const islot_armor *armor_data = find_armor_data();
2033 if( !armor_data ) {
2034 return sizing::ignore;
2035 }
2036 bool to_ignore = true;
2037 for( const armor_portion_data &piece : armor_data->data ) {
2038 if( piece.encumber != 0 ) {
2039 to_ignore = false;
2040 }
2041 }
2042 if( to_ignore ) {
2043 return sizing::ignore;
2044 } else {
2045 const bool small = p.get_size() == creature_size::tiny;
2046
2047 const bool big = p.get_size() == creature_size::huge;
2048
2049 if( has_flag( flag_INTEGRATED ) ) {
2050 if( big ) {
2051 return sizing::big_sized_big_char;
2052 } else if( small ) {
2053 return sizing::small_sized_small_char;
2054 } else {
2055 return sizing::human_sized_human_char;
2056 }
2057 }
2058
2059 // due to the iterative nature of these features, something can fit and be undersized/oversized
2060 // but that is fine because we have separate logic to adjust encumbrance per each. One day we
2061 // may want to have fit be a flag that only applies if a piece of clothing is sized for you as there
2062 // is a bit of cognitive dissonance when something 'fits' and is 'oversized' and the same time
2063 const bool undersize = has_flag( flag_UNDERSIZE );
2064 const bool oversize = has_flag( flag_OVERSIZE );
2065
2066 if( undersize ) {
2067 if( small ) {
2068 return sizing::small_sized_small_char;
2069 } else if( big ) {
2070 return sizing::small_sized_big_char;
2071 } else {
2072 return sizing::small_sized_human_char;
2073 }
2074 } else if( oversize ) {
2075 if( big ) {
2076 return sizing::big_sized_big_char;
2077 } else if( small ) {
2078 return sizing::big_sized_small_char;
2079 } else {
2080 return sizing::big_sized_human_char;
2081 }
2082 } else {
2083 if( big ) {
2084 return sizing::human_sized_big_char;
2085 } else if( small ) {
2086 return sizing::human_sized_small_char;
2087 } else {
2088 return sizing::human_sized_human_char;
2089 }
2090 }
2091 }
2092}
2093
2094static int get_base_env_resist( const item &it )
2095{
2096 const islot_armor *t = it.find_armor_data();
2097 if( t == nullptr ) {
2098 if( it.is_pet_armor() ) {
2099 return it.type->pet_armor->env_resist * it.get_relative_health();
2100 } else {
2101 return 0;
2102 }
2103 }
2104
2105 return t->avg_env_resist() * it.get_relative_health();
2106}
2107
2108bool item::is_owned_by( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
2109{
2110 // owner.is_null() implies faction_id( "no_faction" ) which shouldn't happen, or no owner at all.
2111 // either way, certain situations this means the thing is available to take.
2112 // in other scenarios we actually really want to check for id == id, even for no_faction
2113 if( get_owner().is_null() ) {
2114 return available_to_take;
2115 }
2116 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
2117 debugmsg( "Character %s has no faction", c.disp_name() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "2117", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Character %s has no faction",
c.disp_name());
2118 return false;
2119 }
2120 return c.get_faction()->id == get_owner();
2121}
2122
2123bool item::is_owned_by( const monster &m, bool available_to_take ) const
2124{
2125 // owner.is_null() implies faction_id( "no_faction" ) which shouldn't happen, or no owner at all.
2126 // either way, certain situations this means the thing is available to take.
2127 // in other scenarios we actually really want to check for id == id, even for no_faction
2128 if( get_owner().is_null() ) {
2129 return available_to_take;
2130 }
2131 for( const std::pair<const faction_id, faction> &fact : g->faction_manager_ptr->all() ) {
2132 if( fact.second.mon_faction != m.faction.id() ) {
2133 continue;
2134 }
2135 return fact.first == get_owner();
2136 }
2137 return false;
2138}
2139
2140bool item::is_old_owner( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
2141{
2142 if( get_old_owner().is_null() ) {
2143 return available_to_take;
2144 }
2145 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
2146 debugmsg( "Character %s has no faction.", c.disp_name() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "2146", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Character %s has no faction."
, c.disp_name());
2147 return false;
2148 }
2149 return c.get_faction()->id == get_old_owner();
2150}
2151
2152std::string item::get_old_owner_name() const
2153{
2154 if( !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_old_owner() ) ) {
2155 debugmsg( "item::get_owner_name() item %s has no valid nor null faction id", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "2155", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "item::get_owner_name() item %s has no valid nor null faction id"
, tname());
2156 return "no owner";
2157 }
2158 return g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_old_owner() )->name;
2159}
2160
2161std::string item::get_owner_name() const
2162{
2163 if( !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_owner() ) ) {
2164 debugmsg( "item::get_owner_name() item %s has no valid nor null faction id ", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "2164", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "item::get_owner_name() item %s has no valid nor null faction id "
, tname());
2165 return "no owner";
2166 }
2167 return g->faction_manager_ptr->get( get_owner() )->name;
2168}
2169
2170void item::set_owner( const faction_id &new_owner )
2171{
2172 owner = new_owner;
2173 for( item *e : contents.all_items_top() ) {
2174 e->set_owner( new_owner );
2175 }
2176}
2177
2178void item::set_owner( const Character &c )
2179{
2180 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
2181 debugmsg( "item::set_owner() Character %s has no valid faction", c.disp_name() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "2181", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "item::set_owner() Character %s has no valid faction"
, c.disp_name());
2182 return;
2183 }
2184 set_owner( c.get_faction()->id );
2185}
2186
2187faction_id item::get_owner() const
2188{
2189 validate_ownership();
2190 return owner;
2191}
2192
2193faction_id item::get_old_owner() const
2194{
2195 validate_ownership();
2196 return old_owner;
2197}
2198
2199void item::validate_ownership() const
2200{
2201 if( !old_owner.is_null() && !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( old_owner, false ) ) {
2202 remove_old_owner();
2203 }
2204 if( !owner.is_null() && !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( owner, false ) ) {
2205 remove_owner();
2206 }
2207}
2208
2209static void insert_separation_line( std::vector<iteminfo> &info )
2210{
2211 if( info.empty() || info.back().sName != "--" ) {
2212 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", "--" );
2213 }
2214}
2215
2216/*
2217 * 0 based lookup table of accuracy - monster defense converted into number of hits per 10000
2218 * attacks
2219 * data painstakingly looked up at http://onlinestatbook.com/2/calculators/normal_dist.html
2220 */
2221static constexpr std::array<double, 41> hits_by_accuracy = {
2222 0, 1, 2, 3, 7, // -20 to -16
2223 13, 26, 47, 82, 139, // -15 to -11
2224 228, 359, 548, 808, 1151, // -10 to -6
2225 1587, 2119, 2743, 3446, 4207, // -5 to -1
2226 5000, // 0
2227 5793, 6554, 7257, 7881, 8413, // 1 to 5
2228 8849, 9192, 9452, 9641, 9772, // 6 to 10
2229 9861, 9918, 9953, 9974, 9987, // 11 to 15
2230 9993, 9997, 9998, 9999, 10000 // 16 to 20
2231};
2232
2233double item::effective_dps( const Character &guy, Creature &mon ) const
2234{
2235 const float mon_dodge = mon.get_dodge();
2236 float base_hit = guy.get_dex() / 4.0f + guy.get_hit_weapon( *this );
2237 base_hit *= std::max( 0.25f, 1.0f - guy.avg_encumb_of_limb_type( body_part_type::type::torso ) /
2238 100.0f );
2239 float mon_defense = mon_dodge + mon.size_melee_penalty() / 5.0f;
2240 constexpr double hit_trials = 10000.0;
2241 const int rng_mean = std::max( std::min( static_cast<int>( base_hit - mon_defense ), 20 ),
2242 -20 ) + 20;
2243 double num_all_hits = hits_by_accuracy[ rng_mean ];
2244 /* critical hits have two chances to occur: triple critical hits happen much less frequently,
2245 * and double critical hits can only occur if a hit roll is more than 1.5 * monster dodge.
2246 * Not the hit roll used to determine the attack, another one.
2247 * the way the math works, some percentage of the total hits are eligible to be double
2248 * critical hits, and the rest are eligible to be triple critical hits, but in each case,
2249 * only some small percent of them actually become critical hits.
2250 */
2251 const int rng_high_mean = std::max( std::min( static_cast<int>( base_hit - 1.5 * mon_dodge ),
2252 20 ), -20 ) + 20;
2253 double num_high_hits = hits_by_accuracy[ rng_high_mean ] * num_all_hits / hit_trials;
2254 double double_crit_chance = guy.crit_chance( 4, 0, *this );
2255 double crit_chance = guy.crit_chance( 0, 0, *this );
2256 double num_low_hits = std::max( 0.0, num_all_hits - num_high_hits );
2257
2258 double moves_per_attack = guy.attack_speed( *this );
2259 // attacks that miss do no damage but take time
2260 double total_moves = ( hit_trials - num_all_hits ) * moves_per_attack;
2261 double total_damage = 0.0;
2262 double num_crits = std::min( num_low_hits * crit_chance + num_high_hits * double_crit_chance,
2263 num_all_hits );
2264 // critical hits are counted separately
2265 double num_hits = num_all_hits - num_crits;
2266 // sum average damage past armor and return the number of moves required to achieve
2267 // that damage
2268 const auto calc_effective_damage = [ &, moves_per_attack]( const double num_strikes,
2269 const bool crit, const Character & guy, Creature & mon ) {
2270 bodypart_id bp = bodypart_id( "torso" );
2271 Creature *temp_mon = &mon;
2272 double subtotal_damage = 0;
2273 damage_instance base_damage;
2274 guy.roll_all_damage( crit, base_damage, true, *this, "WEAPON", &mon, bp );
2275 damage_instance dealt_damage = base_damage;
2276 // TODO: Modify DPS calculation to consider weakpoints.
2277 resistances r = resistances( *static_cast<monster *>( temp_mon ) );
2278 for( damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_damage.damage_units ) {
2279 dmg_unit.amount -= std::min( r.get_effective_resist( dmg_unit ), dmg_unit.amount );
2280 }
2281
2282 dealt_damage_instance dealt_dams;
2283 for( const damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_damage.damage_units ) {
2284 int cur_damage = 0;
2285 int total_pain = 0;
2286 temp_mon->deal_damage_handle_type( effect_source::empty(), dmg_unit, bp,
2287 cur_damage, total_pain );
2288 if( cur_damage > 0 ) {
2289 dealt_dams.dealt_dams[dmg_unit.type] += cur_damage;
2290 }
2291 }
2292 double damage_per_hit = dealt_dams.total_damage();
2293 subtotal_damage = damage_per_hit * num_strikes;
2294 double subtotal_moves = moves_per_attack * num_strikes;
