7955 if( has_own_flag( flag_IRRADIATED ) ) {
7956 factor *= 0.25;
7957 }
7958
7959 if( has_own_flag( flag_COLD ) ) {
7960 temp = std::min( temperatures::fridge, temp );
7961 }
7962
7963 rot += factor * time_delta / 1_hours * calc_hourly_rotpoints_at_temp( temp ) * 1_turns;
7964}
7965
7966void item::calc_rot_while_processing( time_duration processing_duration )
7967{
7968 if( !has_own_flag( flag_PROCESSING ) ) {
7969 debugmsg( "calc_rot_while_processing called on non smoking item: %s", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "7969", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "calc_rot_while_processing called on non smoking item: %s"
, tname());
7970 return;
7971 }
7972
7973 // Apply no rot or temperature while smoking
7974 last_temp_check += processing_duration;
7975}
7976
7977float item::get_weight_capacity_modifier() const
7978{
7979 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
7980 if( t == nullptr ) {
7981 return 1;
7982 }
7983 return t->weight_capacity_modifier;
7984}
7985
7986units::mass item::get_weight_capacity_bonus() const
7987{
7988 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
7989 if( t == nullptr ) {
7990 return 0_gram;
7991 }
7992 return t->weight_capacity_bonus;
7993}
7994
7995int item::get_env_resist( int override_base_resist ) const
7996{
7997 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
7998 if( t == nullptr ) {
7999 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->env_resist : 0;
8000 }
8001 // modify if item is a gas mask and has filter
8002 int resist_base = t->avg_env_resist();
8003 int resist_filter = get_var( "overwrite_env_resist", 0 );
8004 int resist = std::max( { resist_base, resist_filter, override_base_resist } );
8005
8006 return std::lround( resist * get_relative_health() );
8007}
8008
8009int item::get_base_env_resist_w_filter() const
8010{
8011 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8012 if( t == nullptr ) {
8013 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->env_resist_w_filter : 0;
8014 }
8015 return t->avg_env_resist_w_filter();
8016}
8017
8018bool item::is_power_armor() const
8019{
8020 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8021 if( t == nullptr ) {
8022 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->power_armor : false;
8023 }
8024 return t->power_armor;
8025}
8026
8027int item::get_avg_encumber( const Character &p, encumber_flags flags ) const
8028{
8029 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8030 if( !t ) {
8031 return 0;
8032 }
8033
8034 int avg_encumber = 0;
8035 int avg_ctr = 0;
8036
8037 for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->data ) {
8038 if( entry.covers.has_value() ) {
8039 for( const bodypart_str_id &limb : entry.covers.value() ) {
8040 int encumber = get_encumber( p, bodypart_id( limb ), flags );
8041 if( encumber ) {
8042 avg_encumber += encumber;
8043 ++avg_ctr;
8044 }
8045 }
8046 }
8047 }
8048 if( avg_encumber == 0 ) {
8049 return 0;
8050 } else {
8051 avg_encumber /= avg_ctr;
8052 return avg_encumber;
8053 }
8054}
8055
8056int item::get_encumber( const Character &p, const bodypart_id &bodypart,
8057 encumber_flags flags ) const
8058{
8059 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8060 int encumber = 0;
8061 if( !t ) {
8062 return 0;
8063 }
8064
8065 float relative_encumbrance;
8066
8067 if( flags & encumber_flags::assume_full ) {
8068 relative_encumbrance = 1.0f;
8069 } else if( flags & encumber_flags::assume_empty ) {
8070 relative_encumbrance = 0.0f;
8071 } else {
8072 // Additional encumbrance from non-rigid pockets
8073
8074 // p.get_check_encumbrance() may be set when it's not possible
8075 // to reset `cached_relative_encumbrance` for individual items
8076 // (e.g. when dropping via AIM, see #42983)
8077 if( !cached_relative_encumbrance || p.get_check_encumbrance() ) {
8078 cached_relative_encumbrance = contents.relative_encumbrance();
8079 }
8080 relative_encumbrance = *cached_relative_encumbrance;
8081 }
8082
8083 if( const armor_portion_data *portion_data = portion_for_bodypart( bodypart ) ) {
8084 encumber = portion_data->encumber;
8085 if( is_gun() ) {
8086 encumber += volume() * portion_data->volume_encumber_modifier /
8087 armor_portion_data::volume_per_encumbrance;
8088 }
8089
8090 // encumbrance from added or modified pockets
8091 int additional_encumbrance = get_contents().get_additional_pocket_encumbrance(
8092 portion_data->volume_encumber_modifier );
8093 encumber += std::ceil( relative_encumbrance * ( portion_data->max_encumber +
8094 additional_encumbrance - portion_data->encumber ) );
8095
8096 // add the encumbrance values of any ablative plates and additional encumbrance pockets
8097 if( has_additional_encumbrance() ) {
8098 for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_contained_pockets() ) {
8099 if( pocket->get_pocket_data()->extra_encumbrance > 0 && !pocket->empty() ) {
8100 encumber += pocket->get_pocket_data()->extra_encumbrance;
8101 }
8102 }
8103 }
8104 }
8105
8106 // even if we don't have data we might have ablative armor draped over it
8107 if( is_ablative() ) {
8108 for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
8109 if( !pocket->empty() ) {
8110 // get the contained plate
8111 const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
8112 encumber += ablative_armor.get_encumber( p, bodypart, flags );
8113 }
8114 }
8115 }
8116
8117 // Fit checked before changes, fitting shouldn't reduce penalties from patching.
8118 if( has_flag( flag_FIT ) && has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) ) {
8119 encumber = std::max( encumber / 2, encumber - 10 );
8120 }
8121
8122 // TODO: Should probably have sizing affect coverage
8123 const sizing sizing_level = get_sizing( p );
8124 switch( sizing_level ) {
8125 case sizing::small_sized_human_char:
8126 case sizing::small_sized_big_char:
8127 // non small characters have a HARD time wearing undersized clothing
8128 encumber *= 3;
8129 break;
8130 case sizing::human_sized_small_char:
8131 case sizing::big_sized_small_char:
8132 // clothes bag up around smol characters and encumber them more
8133 encumber *= 2;
8134 break;
8135 default:
8136 break;
8137 }
8138
8139 encumber += static_cast<int>( std::ceil( get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_encumbrance ) ) );
8140
8141 return encumber;
8142}
8143
8144std::vector<layer_level> item::get_layer() const
8145{
8146 const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
8147 if( armor == nullptr ) {
8148 return std::vector<layer_level>();
8149 }
8150 return armor->all_layers;
8151}
8152
8153static void get_layer_helper( const item *i, bodypart_id bp, std::set<layer_level> &layers )
8154{
8155 const islot_armor *t = i->find_armor_data();
8156 if( t == nullptr ) {
8157 return;
8158 }
8159
8160 for( const armor_portion_data &data : t->data ) {
8161 if( !data.covers.has_value() ) {
8162 continue;
8163 }
8164 for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
8165 if( bp == bpid ) {
8166 layers.insert( data.layers.begin(), data.layers.end() );
8167 }
8168 }
8169 }
8170}
8171
8172std::vector<layer_level> item::get_layer( bodypart_id bp ) const
8173{
8174
8175 std::set<layer_level> layers;
8176
8177 get_layer_helper( this, bp, layers );
8178
8179 //get layers for ablative armor too
8180 if( is_ablative() ) {
8181 for( const item_pocket *pocket : get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
8182 if( !pocket->empty() ) {
8183 // get the contained plate
8184 const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
8185 get_layer_helper( &ablative_armor, bp, layers );
8186 }
8187 }
8188 }
8189
8190 // if the item has additional pockets and is on the torso it should also be strapped
8191 if( bp == body_part_torso && contents.has_additional_pockets() ) {
8192 layers.insert( layer_level::BELTED );
8193 }
8194
8195 return std::vector<layer_level>( layers.begin(), layers.end() );
8196}
8197
8198std::vector<layer_level> item::get_layer( sub_bodypart_id sbp ) const
8199{
8200 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8201 if( t == nullptr ) {
8202 return std::vector<layer_level>();
8203 }
8204
8205 for( const armor_portion_data &data : t->sub_data ) {
8206 for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.sub_coverage ) {
8207 if( sbp == bpid ) {
8208 // if the item has additional pockets and is on the torso it should also be strapped
8209 if( ( sbp == sub_body_part_torso_upper || sbp == sub_body_part_torso_lower ) &&
8210 contents.has_additional_pockets() ) {
8211 std::set<layer_level> with_belted = data.layers;
8212 with_belted.insert( layer_level::BELTED );
8213 return std::vector<layer_level>( with_belted.begin(), with_belted.end() );
8214 } else {
8215 return std::vector<layer_level>( data.layers.begin(), data.layers.end() );
8216 }
8217 }
8218 }
8219 }
8220 // body part not covered by this armour
8221 return std::vector<layer_level>();
8222}
8223
8224bool item::has_layer( const std::vector<layer_level> &ll ) const
8225{
8226 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8227 if( t == nullptr ) {
8228 return false;
8229 }
8230 for( const layer_level &test_level : ll ) {
8231 if( std::find( t->all_layers.begin(), t->all_layers.end(), test_level ) != t->all_layers.end() ) {
8232 return true;
8233 }
8234 }
8235 return false;
8236}
8237
8238bool item::has_layer( const std::vector<layer_level> &ll, const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8239{
8240 const std::vector<layer_level> layers = get_layer( bp );
8241 for( const layer_level &test_level : ll ) {
8242 if( std::find( layers.begin(), layers.end(), test_level ) != layers.end() ) {
8243 return true;
8244 }
8245 }
8246 return false;
8247}
8248
8249bool item::has_layer( const std::vector<layer_level> &ll, const sub_bodypart_id &sbp ) const
8250{
8251 const std::vector<layer_level> layers = get_layer( sbp );
8252 for( const layer_level &test_level : ll ) {
8253 if( std::find( layers.begin(), layers.end(), test_level ) != layers.end() ) {
8254 return true;
8255 }
8256 }
8257 return false;
8258}
8259
8260layer_level item::get_highest_layer( const sub_bodypart_id &sbp ) const
8261{
8262 layer_level highest_layer = layer_level::PERSONAL;
8263
8264 // find highest layer from this item
8265 for( layer_level our_layer : get_layer( sbp ) ) {
8266 if( our_layer > highest_layer ) {
8267 highest_layer = our_layer;
8268 }
8269 }
8270
8271 return highest_layer;
8272}
8273
8274item::cover_type item::get_cover_type( const damage_type_id &type )
8275{
8276 item::cover_type ctype = item::cover_type::COVER_DEFAULT;
8277 if( type->physical ) {
8278 if( type->melee_only ) {
8279 ctype = item::cover_type::COVER_MELEE;
8280 } else {
8281 ctype = item::cover_type::COVER_RANGED;
8282 }
8283 }
8284 return ctype;
8285}
8286
8287int item::get_avg_coverage( const cover_type &type ) const
8288{
8289 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8290 if( !t ) {
8291 return 0;
8292 }
8293 int avg_coverage = 0;
8294 int avg_ctr = 0;
8295 for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->data ) {
8296 if( entry.covers.has_value() ) {
8297 for( const bodypart_str_id &limb : entry.covers.value() ) {
8298 int coverage = get_coverage( limb, type );
8299 if( coverage ) {
8300 avg_coverage += coverage;
8301 ++avg_ctr;
8302 }
8303 }
8304 }
8305 }
8306 if( avg_coverage == 0 ) {
8307 return 0;
8308 } else {
8309 avg_coverage /= avg_ctr;
8310 return avg_coverage;
8311 }
8312}
8313
8314int item::get_coverage( const bodypart_id &bodypart, const cover_type &type ) const
8315{
8316 if( const armor_portion_data *portion_data = portion_for_bodypart( bodypart ) ) {
8317 switch( type ) {
8318 case cover_type::COVER_DEFAULT:
8319 return portion_data->coverage;
8320 case cover_type::COVER_MELEE:
8321 return portion_data->cover_melee;
8322 case cover_type::COVER_RANGED:
8323 return portion_data->cover_ranged;
8324 case cover_type::COVER_VITALS:
8325 return portion_data->cover_vitals;
8326 }
8327 }
8328 return 0;
8329}
8330
8331int item::get_coverage( const sub_bodypart_id &bodypart, const cover_type &type ) const
8332{
8333 if( const armor_portion_data *portion_data = portion_for_bodypart( bodypart ) ) {
8334 switch( type ) {
8335 case cover_type::COVER_DEFAULT:
8336 return portion_data->coverage;
8337 case cover_type::COVER_MELEE:
8338 return portion_data->cover_melee;
8339 case cover_type::COVER_RANGED:
8340 return portion_data->cover_ranged;
8341 case cover_type::COVER_VITALS:
8342 return portion_data->cover_vitals;
8343 }
8344 }
8345 return 0;
8346}
8347
8348bool item::has_sublocations() const
8349{
8350 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8351 if( !t ) {
8352 return false;
8353 }
8354 return t->has_sub_coverage;
8355}
8356
8357const armor_portion_data *item::portion_for_bodypart( const bodypart_id &bodypart ) const
8358{
8359 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8360 if( !t ) {
8361 return nullptr;
8362 }
8363 for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->data ) {
8364 if( entry.covers.has_value() && entry.covers->test( bodypart.id() ) ) {
8365 return &entry;
8366 }
8367 }
8368 return nullptr;
8369}
8370
8371const armor_portion_data *item::portion_for_bodypart( const sub_bodypart_id &bodypart ) const
8372{
8373 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8374 if( !t ) {
8375 return nullptr;
8376 }
8377 for( const armor_portion_data &entry : t->sub_data ) {
8378 for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &tmp : entry.sub_coverage ) {
8379 const sub_bodypart_id &subpart = tmp;
8380 if( subpart == bodypart ) {
8381 return &entry;
8382 }
8383 }
8384 }
8385 return nullptr;
8386}
8387
8388float item::get_thickness() const
8389{
8390 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8391 // if an item isn't armor we assume it is 1mm thick
8392 // TODO: Estimate normal items thickness or protection based on weight and density
8393 if( t == nullptr ) {
8394 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->thickness : 1.0f;
8395 }
8396 return t->avg_thickness();
8397}
8398
8399float item::get_thickness( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8400{
8401 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8402 // don't return a fixed value for this one since an item is never going to be covering a body part
8403 if( t == nullptr ) {
8404 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->thickness : 0.0f;
8405 }
8406
8407 for( const armor_portion_data &data : t->data ) {
8408 if( !data.covers.has_value() ) {
8409 continue;
8410 }
8411 for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : data.covers.value() ) {
8412 if( bp == bpid ) {
8413 return data.avg_thickness;
8414 }
8415 }
8416 }
8417 // body part not covered by this armour
8418 return 0.0f;
8419}
8420
8421float item::get_thickness( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const
8422{
8423 return get_thickness( bp->parent );
8424}
8425
8426int item::get_warmth() const
8427{
8428 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
8429 if( t == nullptr ) {
8430 return 0;
8431 }
8432 int result = t->warmth;
8433
8434 result += get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_warmth );
8435
8436 return result;
8437}
8438
8439int item::get_warmth( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8440{
8441 double warmth_val = 0.0;
8442 float limb_coverage = 0.0f;
8443 if( !covers( bp ) ) {
8444 return 0;
8445 }
8446 warmth_val = get_warmth();
8447 // calculate how much of the limb the armor ideally covers
8448 // idea being that an item that covers the shoulders and torso shouldn't
8449 // heat the whole arm like it covers it
8450 // TODO: fully configure this per armor entry
8451 if( !has_sublocations() ) {
8452 // if it doesn't have sublocations it has 100% covered
8453 limb_coverage = 100;
8454 } else {
8455 for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &sbp : bp->sub_parts ) {
8456 if( !covers( sbp ) ) {
8457 continue;
8458 }
8459
8460 // TODO: handle non 100% sub body part coverages
8461 limb_coverage += sbp->max_coverage;
8462 }
8463 }
8464 return std::round( warmth_val * limb_coverage / 100.0f );
8465}
8466
8467units::volume item::get_pet_armor_max_vol() const
8468{
8469 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->max_vol : 0_ml;
8470}
8471
8472units::volume item::get_pet_armor_min_vol() const
8473{
8474 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->min_vol : 0_ml;
8475}
8476
8477std::string item::get_pet_armor_bodytype() const
8478{
8479 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->bodytype : "";
8480}
8481
8482time_duration item::brewing_time() const
8483{
8484 return is_brewable() ? type->brewable->time * calendar::season_from_default_ratio() : 0_turns;
8485}
8486
8487const std::map<itype_id, int> &item::brewing_results() const
8488{
8489 static const std::map<itype_id, int> nulresult{};
8490 return is_brewable() ? type->brewable->results : nulresult;
8491}
8492
8493bool item::can_revive() const
8494{
8495 return is_corpse() && ( corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_REVIVES ) || has_var( "zombie_form" ) ) &&
8496 damage() < max_damage() &&
8497 !( has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS ) || has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS_FAILED ) ||
8498 has_flag( flag_QUARTERED ) ||
8499 has_flag( flag_SKINNED ) || has_flag( flag_PULPED ) );
8500}
8501
8502bool item::ready_to_revive( map &here, const tripoint &pos ) const
8503{
8504 if( !can_revive() ) {
8505 return false;
8506 }
8507 if( here.veh_at( pos ) ) {
8508 return false;
8509 }
8510 if( !calendar::once_every( 1_seconds ) ) {
8511 return false;
8512 }
8513 int age_in_hours = to_hours<int>( age() );
8514 age_in_hours -= static_cast<int>( static_cast<float>( burnt ) / ( volume() / 250_ml ) );
8515 if( damage_level() > 0 ) {
8516 age_in_hours /= ( damage_level() + 1 );
8517 }
8518 int rez_factor = 48 - age_in_hours;
8519 if( age_in_hours > 6 && ( rez_factor <= 0 || one_in( rez_factor ) ) ) {
8520 // If we're a special revival zombie, wait to get up until the player is nearby.
8521 const bool isReviveSpecial = has_flag( flag_REVIVE_SPECIAL );
8522 if( isReviveSpecial ) {
8523 const int distance = rl_dist( pos, get_player_character().pos() );
8524 if( distance > 3 ) {
8525 return false;
8526 }
8527 if( !one_in( distance + 1 ) ) {
8528 return false;
8529 }
8530 }
8531
8532 return true;
8533 }
8534 return false;
8535}
8536
8537bool item::is_money() const
8538{
8539 return is_money( ammo_types() );
8540}
8541
8542bool item::is_money( const std::set<ammotype> &ammo ) const
8543{
8544 return ammo.count( ammo_money );
8545}
8546
8547bool item::is_cash_card() const
8548{
8549 return typeId() == itype_cash_card;
8550}
8551
8552bool item::is_software() const
8553{
8554 if( const std::optional<itype_id> &cont = type->default_container ) {
8555 return item( *cont ).is_software_storage();
8556 }
8557 return false;
8558}
8559
8560bool item::is_software_storage() const
8561{
8562 return contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::SOFTWARE );
8563}
8564
8565bool item::is_ebook_storage() const
8566{
8567 return contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::EBOOK );
8568}
8569
8570bool item::is_maybe_melee_weapon() const
8571{
8572 item_category_id my_cat_id = get_category_shallow().id;
8573 return my_cat_id == item_category_weapons || my_cat_id == item_category_spare_parts ||
8574 my_cat_id == item_category_tools;
8575}
8576
8577bool item::has_edged_damage() const
8578{
8579 for( const damage_type &dt : damage_type::get_all() ) {
8580 if( dt.edged && is_melee( dt.id ) ) {
8581 return true;
8582 }
8583 }
8584 return false;
8585}
8586
8587bool item::count_by_charges() const
8588{
8589 return type->count_by_charges();
8590}
8591
8592int item::count() const
8593{
8594 return count_by_charges() ? charges : 1;
8595}
8596
8597bool item::craft_has_charges() const
8598{
8599 return count_by_charges() || ammo_types().empty();
8600}
8601
8602float item::get_clothing_mod_val_for_damage_type( const damage_type_id &dmg_type ) const
8603{
8604 // FIXME: Hardcoded damage types
8605 if( dmg_type == damage_bash ) {
8606 return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_bash );
8607 } else if( dmg_type == damage_cut ) {
8608 return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_cut );
8609 } else if( dmg_type == damage_bullet ) {
8610 return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_bullet );
8611 } else if( dmg_type == damage_heat ) {
8612 return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_fire );
8613 } else if( dmg_type == damage_acid ) {
8614 return get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_acid );
8615 }
8616 return 0.0f; // No mods for other damage types
8617}
8618
8619#if defined(_MSC_VER)
8620// Deal with MSVC compiler bug (#17791, #17958)
8621#pragma optimize( "", off )
8622#endif
8623
8624bool item::damage_type_can_damage_items( const damage_type_id &dmg_type ) const
8625{
8626 return dmg_type->physical;
8627}
8628
8629template<typename bodypart_target>
8630float item::resist( const damage_type_id &dmg_type, const bool to_self,
8631 const bodypart_target &bp,
8632 const int resist_value ) const
8633{
8634 if( is_null() ) {
8635 return 0.0f;
8636 }
8637
8638 if( dmg_type.is_null() ) {
8639 return 0.0f;
8640 }
8641
8642 if( !dmg_type.is_valid() ) {
8643 debugmsg( "Invalid damage type: %d", dmg_type.c_str() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "8643", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Invalid damage type: %d", dmg_type
.c_str());
8644 return 0.0f;
8645 }
8646
8647 // Implicit item damage immunity for damage types listed prior to bash
8648 // Acid/fire immunity would be handled in _environmental_resist, but there are more
8649 // dmg types that do not affect items such as PURE/COLD etc..
8650 if( to_self && !damage_type_can_damage_items( dmg_type ) ) {
8651 return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
8652 }
8653
8654 const bool bp_null = bp == bodypart_target();
8655 const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats = armor_made_of( bp );
8656 const float avg_thickness = bp_null ? get_thickness() : get_thickness( bp );
8657 return _resist( dmg_type, to_self, resist_value, bp_null, armor_mats, avg_thickness );
8658}
8659template float item::resist<bodypart_id>( const damage_type_id &dmg_type,
8660 const bool to_self, const bodypart_id &bp, const int resist_value ) const;
8661template float item::resist<sub_bodypart_id>( const damage_type_id &dmg_type,
8662 const bool to_self, const sub_bodypart_id &bp, const int resist_value ) const;
8663
8664float item::_resist( const damage_type_id &dmg_type, bool to_self, int resist_value,
8665 const bool bp_null,
8666 const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats,
8667 const float avg_thickness ) const
8668{
8669 if( dmg_type->env ) {
8670 return _environmental_resist( dmg_type, to_self, resist_value, bp_null, armor_mats );
8671 }
8672
8673 std::optional<std::pair<damage_type_id, float>> derived;
8674 if( !dmg_type->derived_from.first.is_null() ) {
8675 derived = dmg_type->derived_from;
8676 }
8677
8678 float resist = 0.0f;
8679 float mod = get_clothing_mod_val_for_damage_type( dmg_type );
8680
8681 const float damage_scale = damage_adjusted_armor_resist( 1.0f );
8682
8683 if( !bp_null ) {
8684 // If we have armour portion materials for this body part, use that instead
8685 if( !armor_mats.empty() ) {
8686 for( const part_material *m : armor_mats ) {
8687 // only count the material if it's hit
8688
8689 // if roll is -1 each material is rolled at this point individually
8690 int internal_roll;
8691 resist_value < 0 ? internal_roll = rng( 0, 99 ) : internal_roll = resist_value;
8692 if( internal_roll < m->cover ) {
8693 float tmp_add = 0.f;
8694 if( derived.has_value() && !m->id->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8695 tmp_add = m->id->resist( derived->first ) * m->thickness * derived->second;
8696 } else {
8697 tmp_add = m->id->resist( dmg_type ) * m->thickness;
8698 }
8699 resist += tmp_add;
8700 }
8701 }
8702 return ( resist + mod ) * damage_scale;
8703 }
8704 }
8705
8706 // base resistance
8707 const std::map<material_id, int> mats = made_of();
8708 if( !mats.empty() ) {
8709 const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8710 for( const auto &m : mats ) {
8711 float tmp_add = 0.f;
8712 if( derived.has_value() && !m.first->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8713 tmp_add = m.first->resist( derived->first ) * m.second * derived->second;
8714 } else {
8715 tmp_add = m.first->resist( dmg_type ) * m.second;
8716 }
8717 resist += tmp_add;
8718 }
8719 // Average based portion of materials
8720 resist /= total;
8721 }
8722
8723 return ( resist * avg_thickness + mod ) * damage_scale;
8724}
8725
8726float item::_environmental_resist( const damage_type_id &dmg_type, const bool to_self,
8727 int base_env_resist,
8728 const bool bp_null,
8729 const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats ) const
8730{
8731 if( to_self ) {
8732 // Currently no items are damaged by acid, and fire is handled elsewhere
8733 return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
8734 }
8735
8736 std::optional<std::pair<damage_type_id, float>> derived;
8737 if( !dmg_type->derived_from.first.is_null() ) {
8738 derived = dmg_type->derived_from;
8739 }
8740
8741 float resist = 0.0f;
8742 float mod = get_clothing_mod_val_for_damage_type( dmg_type );
8743
8744 if( !bp_null ) {
8745 // If we have armour portion materials for this body part, use that instead
8746 if( !armor_mats.empty() ) {
8747 for( const part_material *m : armor_mats ) {
8748 float tmp_add = 0.f;
8749 if( derived.has_value() && !m->id->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8750 tmp_add = m->id->resist( derived->first ) * m->cover * 0.01f * derived->second;
8751 } else {
8752 tmp_add = m->id->resist( dmg_type ) * m->cover * 0.01f;
8753 }
8754 resist += tmp_add;
8755 }
8756 const int env = get_env_resist( base_env_resist );
8757 if( env < 10 ) {
8758 resist *= env / 10.0f;
8759 }
8760 }
8761 return resist + mod;
8762 }
8763
8764 const std::map<material_id, int> mats = made_of();
8765 if( !mats.empty() ) {
8766 const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8767 // Not sure why cut and bash get an armor thickness bonus but acid/fire doesn't,
8768 // but such is the way of the code.
8769 for( const auto &m : mats ) {
8770 float tmp_add = 0.f;
8771 if( derived.has_value() && !m.first->has_dedicated_resist( dmg_type ) ) {
8772 tmp_add = m.first->resist( derived->first ) * m.second * derived->second;
8773 } else {
8774 tmp_add = m.first->resist( dmg_type ) * m.second;
8775 }
8776 resist += tmp_add;
8777 }
8778 // Average based portion of materials
8779 resist /= total;
8780 }
8781
8782 const int env = get_env_resist( base_env_resist );
8783 if( env < 10 ) {
8784 // Low env protection means it doesn't prevent acid seeping in.
8785 resist *= env / 10.0f;
8786 }
8787
8788 return resist + mod;
8789}
8790
8791#if defined(_MSC_VER)
8792#pragma optimize( "", on )
8793#endif
8794
8795int item::breathability( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8796{
8797 const bool bp_null = bp == bodypart_id();
8798 // if the armor doesn't have armor data
8799 // or its not on a specific limb
8800 if( bp_null || armor_made_of( bp ).empty() ) {
8801 return breathability();
8802 }
8803 const armor_portion_data *a = portion_for_bodypart( bp );
8804 if( a == nullptr ) {
8805 // if it doesn't cover it breathes great
8806 return 100;
8807 }
8808
8809 return a->breathability;
8810}
8811
8812int item::breathability() const
8813{
8814 // very rudimentary average for simple armor and non limb based situations
8815 int breathability = 0;
8816
8817 const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8818 const std::map<material_id, int> mats = made_of();
8819 if( !mats.empty() ) {
8820 for( const auto &m : mats ) {
8821 breathability += m.first->breathability() * m.second;
8822 }
8823 // Average based portion of materials
8824 breathability /= total;
8825 }
8826
8827 return breathability;
8828}
8829
8830int item::chip_resistance( bool worst, const bodypart_id &bp ) const
8831{
8832 int res = worst ? INT_MAX2147483647 : INT_MIN(-2147483647 -1);
8833 if( bp != bodypart_id() ) {
8834 const std::vector<const part_material *> &armor_mats = armor_made_of( bp );
8835 // If we have armour portion materials for this body part, use that instead
8836 if( !armor_mats.empty() ) {
8837 for( const part_material *m : armor_mats ) {
8838 const int val = m->id->chip_resist() * m->cover;
8839 res = worst ? std::min( res, val ) : std::max( res, val );
8840 }
8841 if( res == INT_MAX2147483647 || res == INT_MIN(-2147483647 -1) ) {
8842 return 2;
8843 }
8844 res /= 100;
8845 if( res <= 0 ) {
8846 return 0;
8847 }
8848 return res;
8849 }
8850 }
8851
8852 const int total = type->mat_portion_total == 0 ? 1 : type->mat_portion_total;
8853 for( const std::pair<material_id, int> mat : made_of() ) {
8854 const int val = ( mat.first->chip_resist() * mat.second ) / total;
8855 res = worst ? std::min( res, val ) : std::max( res, val );
8856 }
8857
8858 if( res == INT_MAX2147483647 || res == INT_MIN(-2147483647 -1) ) {
8859 return 2;
8860 }
8861
8862 if( res <= 0 ) {
8863 return 0;
8864 }
8865
8866 return res;
8867}
8868
8869int item::max_damage() const
8870{
8871 return type->damage_max();
8872}
8873
8874float item::get_relative_health() const
8875{
8876 const int max_dmg = max_damage();
8877 if( max_dmg == 0 ) { // count_by_charges items
8878 return 1.0f;
8879 }
8880 return 1.0f - static_cast<float>( damage() ) / max_dmg;
8881}
8882
8883static int get_degrade_amount( const item &it, int dmgNow_, int dmgPrev )
8884{
8885 const int max_dmg = it.max_damage();
8886 const int degrade_increments = it.type->degrade_increments();
8887 if( max_dmg == 0 || degrade_increments == 0 ) {
8888 return 0; // count by charges
8889 }
8890 const int facNow_ = dmgNow_ == 0 ? -1 : ( dmgNow_ - 1 ) * 5 / max_dmg;
8891 const int facPrev = dmgPrev == 0 ? -1 : ( dmgPrev - 1 ) * 5 / max_dmg;
8892
8893 return std::max( facNow_ - facPrev, 0 ) * max_dmg / degrade_increments;
8894}
8895
8896bool item::mod_damage( int qty )
8897{
8898 if( has_flag( flag_UNBREAKABLE ) ) {
8899 return false;
8900 }
8901 if( count_by_charges() ) {
8902 charges -= std::min( type->stack_size * qty / itype::damage_scale, charges );
8903 return charges == 0; // return destroy = true if no charges
8904 } else {
8905 const int dmg_before = damage_;
8906 const bool destroy = ( damage_ + qty ) > max_damage();
8907 set_damage( damage_ + qty );
8908
8909 if( qty > 0 && !destroy ) { // apply automatic degradation
8910 set_degradation( degradation_ + get_degrade_amount( *this, damage_, dmg_before ) );
8911 }
8912 return destroy;
8913 }
8914}
8915
8916bool item::inc_damage()
8917{
8918 return mod_damage( itype::damage_scale );
8919}
8920
8921int item::repairable_levels() const
8922{
8923 const int levels = type->damage_level( damage_ ) - type->damage_level( degradation_ );
8924
8925 return levels > 0
8926 ? levels // full integer levels of damage
8927 : damage() > degradation(); // partial level of damage can still be repaired
8928}
8929
8930item::armor_status item::damage_armor_durability( damage_unit &du, const bodypart_id &bp )
8931{
8932 if( has_flag( flag_UNBREAKABLE ) ) {
8933 return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8934 }
8935
8936 // We want armor's own resistance to this type, not the resistance it grants
8937 const float armors_own_resist = resist( du.type, true, bp );
8938 if( armors_own_resist > 1000.0f ) {
8939 // This is some weird type that doesn't damage armors
8940 return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8941 }
8942 // Fragile items take damage if the block more than 15% of their armor value
8943 if( has_flag( flag_FRAGILE ) && du.amount / armors_own_resist > 0.15f ) {
8944 return mod_damage( itype::damage_scale ) ? armor_status::DESTROYED : armor_status::DAMAGED;
8945 }
8946
8947 // Scale chance of article taking damage based on the number of parts it covers.
8948 // This represents large articles being able to take more punishment
8949 // before becoming ineffective or being destroyed.
8950 const int num_parts_covered = get_covered_body_parts().count();
8951 if( !one_in( num_parts_covered ) ) {
8952 return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8953 }
8954
8955 // Don't damage armor as much when bypassed by armor piercing
8956 // Most armor piercing damage comes from bypassing armor, not forcing through
8957 const float post_mitigated_dmg = du.amount;
8958 // more gradual damage chance calc
8959 const float damaged_chance = 0.11 * ( post_mitigated_dmg / ( armors_own_resist + 2 ) ) + 0.1;
8960 if( post_mitigated_dmg > armors_own_resist ) {
8961 // handle overflow, if you take a lot of damage your armor should be damaged
8962 if( damaged_chance >= 1 ) {
8963 return armor_status::DAMAGED;
8964 }
8965 if( one_in( 1 / ( 1 - damaged_chance ) ) ) {
8966 return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8967 }
8968 } else {
8969 // Sturdy items and power armors never take chip damage.
8970 // Other armors have 0.5% of getting damaged from hits below their armor value.
8971 if( has_flag( flag_STURDY ) || is_power_armor() || !one_in( 200 ) ) {
8972 return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8973 }
8974 }
8975
8976 return mod_damage( itype::damage_scale ) ? armor_status::DESTROYED : armor_status::DAMAGED;
8977}
8978
8979item::armor_status item::damage_armor_transforms( damage_unit &du ) const
8980{
8981 // We want armor's own resistance to this type, not the resistance it grants
8982 const float armors_own_resist = resist( du.type, true );
8983
8984 // to avoid dumb chip damage plates shouldn't ever transform if they take less than
8985 // 20% of their protection in damage
8986 if( du.amount / armors_own_resist < 0.2f ) {
8987 return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
8988 }
8989
8990 // plates are rated to survive 3 shots at the caliber they protect
8991 // linearly scale off the scale value to find the chance it breaks
8992 float break_chance = 33.3f * ( du.amount / armors_own_resist );
8993
8994 float roll_to_break = rng_float( 0.0, 100.0 );
8995
8996 if( roll_to_break < break_chance ) {
8997 //the plate is broken
8998 return armor_status::TRANSFORMED;
8999 }
9000 return armor_status::UNDAMAGED;
9001}
9002
9003std::string item::damage_indicator() const
9004{
9005 return cata::options::damage_indicators[damage_level()];
9006}
9007
9008std::string item::durability_indicator( bool include_intact ) const
9009{
9010 const std::string item_health_option = get_option<std::string>( "ITEM_HEALTH" );
9011 const bool show_bars_only = item_health_option == "bars";
9012 const bool show_description_only = item_health_option == "descriptions";
9013 const bool show_both = item_health_option == "both";
9014 const bool show_bars = show_both || show_bars_only;
9015 const bool show_description = show_both || show_description_only;
9016 std::string bars;
9017 std::string description;
9018 if( show_bars ) {
9019 bars = damage_indicator() + degradation_symbol() + "\u00A0";
9020 }
9021 if( damage() < 0 ) {
9022 if( show_description ) {
9023 if( is_gun() ) {
9024 description = pgettext( "damage adjective", "accurized " );
9025 } else {
9026 description = pgettext( "damage adjective", "reinforced " );
9027 }
9028 }
9029 if( show_bars_only ) {
9030 return bars;
9031 }
9032 if( show_description_only ) {
9033 return description;
9034 }
9035 return bars + description;
9036 }
9037 if( has_flag( flag_CORPSE ) ) {
9038 if( damage() > 0 ) {
9039 switch( damage_level() ) {
9040 case 1:
9041 return pgettext( "damage adjective", "bruised " );
9042 case 2:
9043 return pgettext( "damage adjective", "damaged " );
9044 case 3:
9045 return pgettext( "damage adjective", "mangled " );
9046 default:
9047 return pgettext( "damage adjective", "pulped " );
9048 }
9049 }
9050 }
9051 if( show_bars_only ) {
9052 return bars;
9053 }
9054 description = string_format( "%s ", get_base_material().dmg_adj( damage_level() ) );
9055 if( description == " " ) {
9056 if( include_intact ) {
9057 description = _( "fully intact " )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "fully intact " ) ) );
9058 } else {
9059 description = "";
9060 }
9061 }
9062 if( show_description_only ) {
9063 return description;
9064 }
9065 return bars + description;
9066}
9067
9068const std::set<itype_id> &item::repaired_with() const
9069{
9070 static std::set<itype_id> no_repair;
9071 static std::set<itype_id> tools;
9072 tools.clear();
9073
9074 std::copy_if( type->repair.begin(), type->repair.end(), std::inserter( tools, tools.begin() ),
9075 []( const itype_id & i ) {
9076 return !item_is_blacklisted( i );
9077 } );
9078
9079 return has_flag( flag_NO_REPAIR ) ? no_repair : tools;
9080}
9081
9082void item::mitigate_damage( damage_unit &du, const bodypart_id &bp, int roll ) const
9083{
9084 const resistances res = resistances( *this, false, roll, bp );
9085 const float mitigation = res.get_effective_resist( du );
9086 // get_effective_resist subtracts the flat penetration value before multiplying the remaining armor.
9087 // therefore, res_pen is reduced by the full value of the item's armor value even though mitigation might be smaller (such as an attack with a 0.5 armor multiplier)
9088 du.res_pen -= res.type_resist( du.type );
9089 du.res_pen = std::max( 0.0f, du.res_pen );
9090 du.amount -= mitigation;
9091 du.amount = std::max( 0.0f, du.amount );
9092}
9093
9094void item::mitigate_damage( damage_unit &du, const sub_bodypart_id &bp, int roll ) const
9095{
9096 const resistances res = resistances( *this, false, roll, bp );
9097 const float mitigation = res.get_effective_resist( du );
9098 // get_effective_resist subtracts the flat penetration value before multiplying the remaining armor.
9099 // therefore, res_pen is reduced by the full value of the item's armor value even though mitigation might be smaller (such as an attack with a 0.5 armor multiplier)
9100 du.res_pen -= res.type_resist( du.type );
9101 du.res_pen = std::max( 0.0f, du.res_pen );
9102 du.amount -= mitigation;
9103 du.amount = std::max( 0.0f, du.amount );
9104}
9105
9106bool item::is_two_handed( const Character &guy ) const
9107{
9108 if( has_flag( flag_ALWAYS_TWOHAND ) ) {
9109 return true;
9110 }
9111 ///\EFFECT_STR determines which weapons can be wielded with one hand
9112 return ( ( weight() / 113_gram ) > guy.get_arm_str() * 4 );
9113}
9114
9115const std::map<material_id, int> &item::made_of() const
9116{
9117 if( is_corpse() ) {
9118 return corpse->mat;
9119 }
9120 return type->materials;
9121}
9122
9123std::vector<const part_material *> item::armor_made_of( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
9124{
9125 std::vector<const part_material *> matlist;
9126 const islot_armor *a = find_armor_data();
9127 if( a == nullptr || a->data.empty() || !covers( bp ) ) {
9128 return matlist;
9129 }
9130 for( const armor_portion_data &d : a->data ) {
9131 if( !d.covers.has_value() ) {
9132 continue;
9133 }
9134 for( const bodypart_str_id &bpid : d.covers.value() ) {
9135 if( bp != bpid ) {
9136 continue;
9137 }
9138 matlist.reserve( matlist.size() + d.materials.size() );
9139 for( const part_material &m : d.materials ) {
9140 matlist.emplace_back( &m );
9141 }
9142 return matlist;
9143 }
9144 }
9145 return matlist;
9146}
9147
9148std::vector<const part_material *> item::armor_made_of( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const
9149{
9150 std::vector<const part_material *> matlist;
9151 const islot_armor *a = find_armor_data();
9152 if( a == nullptr || a->data.empty() || !covers( bp ) ) {
9153 return matlist;
9154 }
9155 for( const armor_portion_data &d : a->sub_data ) {
9156 if( d.sub_coverage.empty() ) {
9157 continue;
9158 }
9159 for( const sub_bodypart_str_id &bpid : d.sub_coverage ) {
9160 if( bp != bpid ) {
9161 continue;
9162 }
9163 for( const part_material &m : d.materials ) {
9164 matlist.emplace_back( &m );
9165 }
9166 return matlist;
9167 }
9168 }
9169 return matlist;
9170}
9171
9172std::vector<const material_type *> item::made_of_types() const
9173{
9174 std::vector<const material_type *> material_types_composed_of;
9175 if( is_corpse() ) {
9176 for( const auto &mat_id : made_of() ) {
9177 material_types_composed_of.push_back( &mat_id.first.obj() );
9178 }
9179 } else {
9180 for( const auto &mat_id : type->materials ) {
9181 material_types_composed_of.push_back( &mat_id.first.obj() );
9182 }
9183 }
9184 return material_types_composed_of;
9185}
9186
9187bool item::made_of_any( const std::set<material_id> &mat_idents ) const
9188{
9189 const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
9190 if( mats.empty() ) {
9191 return false;
9192 }
9193
9194 return std::any_of( mats.begin(),
9195 mats.end(), [&mat_idents]( const std::pair<material_id, int> &e ) {
9196 return mat_idents.count( e.first );
9197 } );
9198}
9199
9200bool item::only_made_of( const std::set<material_id> &mat_idents ) const
9201{
9202 const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
9203 if( mats.empty() ) {
9204 return false;
9205 }
9206
9207 return std::all_of( mats.begin(),
9208 mats.end(), [&mat_idents]( const std::pair<material_id, int> &e ) {
9209 return mat_idents.count( e.first );
9210 } );
9211}
9212
9213int item::made_of( const material_id &mat_ident ) const
9214{
9215 const std::map<material_id, int> &materials = made_of();
9216 auto mat = materials.find( mat_ident );
9217 if( mat == materials.end() ) {
9218 return 0;
9219 }
9220 return mat->second;
9221}
9222
9223bool item::can_repair_with( const material_id &mat_ident ) const
9224{
9225 auto mat = type->repairs_with.find( mat_ident );
9226 return mat != type->repairs_with.end();
9227}
9228
9229bool item::made_of( phase_id phase ) const
9230{
9231 if( is_null() ) {
9232 return false;
9233 }
9234 return current_phase == phase;
9235}
9236
9237bool item::made_of_from_type( phase_id phase ) const
9238{
9239 if( is_null() ) {
9240 return false;
9241 }
9242 return type->phase == phase;
9243}
9244
9245bool item::conductive() const
9246{
9247 if( is_null() ) {
9248 return false;
9249 }
9250
9251 if( has_flag( flag_CONDUCTIVE ) ) {
9252 return true;
9253 }
9254
9255 if( has_flag( flag_NONCONDUCTIVE ) ) {
9256 return false;
9257 }
9258
9259 // If any material has electricity resistance equal to or lower than flesh (1) we are conductive.
9260 const std::vector<const material_type *> &mats = made_of_types();
9261 return std::any_of( mats.begin(), mats.end(), []( const material_type * mt ) {
9262 return mt->is_conductive();
9263 } );
9264}
9265
9266bool item::is_gun() const
9267{
9268 return !!type->gun;
9269}
9270
9271void item::select_itype_variant()
9272{
9273 weighted_int_list<std::string> variants;
9274 for( const itype_variant_data &iv : type->variants ) {
9275 variants.add( iv.id, iv.weight );
9276 }
9277
9278 const std::string *selected = variants.pick();
9279 if( !selected ) {
9280 // No variants exist
9281 return;
9282 }
9283
9284 set_itype_variant( *selected );
9285}
9286
9287bool item::can_have_itype_variant() const
9288{
9289 return !type->variants.empty();
9290}
9291
9292bool item::possible_itype_variant( const std::string &test ) const
9293{
9294 if( !can_have_itype_variant() ) {
9295 return false;
9296 }
9297
9298 const auto variant_looking_for = [&test]( const itype_variant_data & variant ) {
9299 return variant.id == test;
9300 };
9301
9302 return std::find_if( type->variants.begin(), type->variants.end(),
9303 variant_looking_for ) != type->variants.end();
9304}
9305
9306bool item::has_itype_variant( bool check_option ) const
9307{
9308 if( _itype_variant == nullptr ) {
9309 return false;
9310 } else if( !check_option ) {
9311 return true;
9312 }
9313
9314 switch( type->variant_kind ) {
9315 case itype_variant_kind::gun:
9316 return get_option<bool>( "SHOW_GUN_VARIANTS" );
9317 case itype_variant_kind::drug:
9318 return get_option<bool>( "SHOW_DRUG_VARIANTS" );
9319 default:
9320 return true;
9321 }
9322 return false;
9323}
9324
9325const itype_variant_data &item::itype_variant() const
9326{
9327 return *_itype_variant;
9328}
9329
9330void item::set_itype_variant( const std::string &variant )
9331{
9332 if( variant.empty() || type->variants.empty() ) {
9333 return;
9334 }
9335
9336 if( variant == "<any>" ) {
9337 select_itype_variant();
9338 return;
9339 }
9340
9341 for( const itype_variant_data &option : type->variants ) {
9342 if( option.id == variant ) {
9343 _itype_variant = &option;
9344 if( option.expand_snippets ) {
9345 set_var( "description", SNIPPET.expand( variant_description() ) );
9346 }
9347 return;
9348 }
9349 }
9350
9351 debugmsg( "item '%s' has no variant '%s'!", typeId().str(), variant )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "9351", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "item '%s' has no variant '%s'!"
, typeId().str(), variant);
9352}
9353
9354std::string item::variant_description() const
9355{
9356 if( !has_itype_variant() ) {
9357 return "";
9358 }
9359
9360 // append the description instead of fully overwriting it
9361 if( itype_variant().append ) {
9362 return string_format( pgettext( "variant description", "%s %s" ), type->description.translated(),
9363 itype_variant().alt_description.translated() );
9364 } else {
9365 return itype_variant().alt_description.translated();
9366 }
9367}
9368
9369void item::clear_itype_variant()
9370{
9371 _itype_variant = nullptr;
9372}
9373
9374bool item::is_firearm() const
9375{
9376 return is_gun() && !has_flag( flag_PRIMITIVE_RANGED_WEAPON );
9377}
9378
9379int item::get_reload_time() const
9380{
9381 if( !is_gun() && !is_magazine() ) {
9382 return 0;
9383 }
9384 int reload_time = 0;
9385 if( is_gun() ) {
9386 reload_time = type->gun->reload_time;
9387 } else if( type->magazine ) {
9388 reload_time = type->magazine->reload_time;
9389 } else {
9390 reload_time = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY;
9391 }
9392 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
9393 reload_time = static_cast<int>( reload_time * ( 100 + mod->type->gunmod->reload_modifier ) / 100 );
9394 }
9395
9396 return reload_time;
9397}
9398
9399bool item::is_silent() const
9400{
9401 return gun_noise().volume < 5;
9402}
9403
9404bool item::is_gunmod() const
9405{
9406 return !!type->gunmod;
9407}
9408
9409bool item::is_bionic() const
9410{
9411 return !!type->bionic;
9412}
9413
9414bool item::is_magazine() const
9415{
9416 return !!type->magazine || contents.has_pocket_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE );
9417}
9418
9419bool item::is_battery() const
9420{
9421 return is_magazine() && ammo_capacity( ammo_battery );
9422}
9423
9424bool item::is_vehicle_battery() const
9425{
9426 return !!type->battery;
9427}
9428
9429bool item::is_ammo_belt() const
9430{
9431 return is_magazine() && has_flag( flag_MAG_BELT );
9432}
9433
9434bool item::is_holster() const
9435{
9436 return type->can_use( "holster" );
9437}
9438
9439bool item::is_ammo() const
9440{
9441 return !!type->ammo;
9442}
9443
9444bool item::is_comestible() const
9445{
9446 return !!get_comestible();
9447}
9448
9449bool item::is_food() const
9450{
9451 if( !is_comestible() ) {
9452 return false;
9453 }
9454 const std::string &comest_type = get_comestible()->comesttype;
9455 return comest_type == "FOOD" || comest_type == "DRINK";
9456}
9457
9458bool item::is_medication() const
9459{
9460 if( !is_comestible() ) {
9461 return false;
9462 }
9463 return get_comestible()->comesttype == "MED";
9464}
9465
9466bool item::is_medical_tool() const
9467{
9468 return type->get_use( "heal" ) != nullptr;
9469}
9470
9471bool item::is_brewable() const
9472{
9473 return !!type->brewable;
9474}
9475
9476bool item::is_food_container() const
9477{
9478 return ( !is_food() && has_item_with( []( const item & food ) {
9479 return food.is_food();
9480 } ) ) ||
9481 ( is_craft() && !craft_data_->disassembly &&
9482 craft_data_->making->create_results().front().is_food_container() );
9483}
9484
9485bool item::has_temperature() const
9486{
9487 return is_comestible() || is_corpse();
9488}
9489
9490bool item::is_corpse() const
9491{
9492 return corpse != nullptr && has_flag( flag_CORPSE );
9493}
9494
9495const mtype *item::get_mtype() const
9496{
9497 return corpse;
9498}
9499
9500float item::get_specific_heat_liquid() const
9501{
9502 if( is_comestible() ) {
9503 return get_comestible()->specific_heat_liquid;
9504 }
9505 return made_of_types()[0]->specific_heat_liquid();
9506}
9507
9508float item::get_specific_heat_solid() const
9509{
9510 if( is_comestible() ) {
9511 return get_comestible()->specific_heat_solid;
9512 }
9513 return made_of_types()[0]->specific_heat_solid();
9514}
9515
9516float item::get_latent_heat() const
9517{
9518 if( is_comestible() ) {
9519 return get_comestible()->latent_heat;
9520 }
9521 return made_of_types()[0]->latent_heat();
9522}
9523
9524units::temperature item::get_freeze_point() const
9525{
9526 if( is_comestible() ) {
9527 return units::from_celsius( get_comestible()->freeze_point );
9528 }
9529 return units::from_celsius( made_of_types()[0]->freeze_point() );
9530}
9531
9532void item::set_mtype( const mtype *const m )
9533{
9534 // This is potentially dangerous, e.g. for corpse items, which *must* have a valid mtype pointer.
9535 if( m == nullptr ) {
9536 debugmsg( "setting item::corpse of %s to NULL", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "9536", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "setting item::corpse of %s to NULL"
, tname());
9537 return;
9538 }
9539 corpse = m;
9540}
9541
9542bool item::is_ammo_container() const
9543{
9544 return contents.has_any_with(
9545 []( const item & it ) {
9546 return it.is_ammo();
9547 }, pocket_type::CONTAINER );
9548}
9549
9550bool item::is_melee() const
9551{
9552 for( const damage_type &dt : damage_type::get_all() ) {
9553 if( is_melee( dt.id ) ) {
6
←
Calling 'item::is_melee'
→
9554 return true;
9555 }
9556 }
9557 return false;
9558}
9559
9560bool item::is_melee( const damage_type_id &dt ) const
9561{
9562 return damage_melee( dt ) > MELEE_STAT;
7
←
Calling 'item::damage_melee'
→
9563}
9564
9565const islot_armor *item::find_armor_data() const
9566{
9567 if( type->armor ) {
9568 return &*type->armor;
9569 }
9570 // Currently the only way to make a non-armor item into armor is to install a gun mod.
9571 // The gunmods are stored in the items contents, as are the contents of a container, and the
9572 // tools in a tool belt (a container actually), or the ammo in a quiver (container again).
9573 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
9574 if( mod->type->armor ) {
9575 return &*mod->type->armor;
9576 }
9577 }
9578 return nullptr;
9579}
9580
9581bool item::is_pet_armor( bool on_pet ) const
9582{
9583 bool is_worn = on_pet && !get_var( "pet_armor", "" ).empty();
9584 return has_flag( flag_IS_PET_ARMOR ) && ( is_worn || !on_pet );
9585}
9586
9587bool item::is_armor() const
9588{
9589 return find_armor_data() != nullptr || has_flag( flag_IS_ARMOR );
9590}
9591
9592bool item::is_book() const
9593{
9594 return !!type->book;
9595}
9596
9597std::string item::get_book_skill() const
9598{
9599 if( is_book() ) {
9600 if( type->book->skill->ident() != skill_id::NULL_ID() ) {
9601 return type->book->skill->name();
9602 }
9603 }
9604 return "";
9605}
9606
9607bool item::is_map() const
9608{
9609 return get_category_shallow().get_id() == item_category_maps;
9610}

9613{

9616 } else {
9617 return false;
9618 }

9704
9705bool item::is_watertight_container() const
9706{
9707 return contents.can_contain_liquid( true );
9708}
9709
9710bool item::is_bucket_nonempty() const
9711{
9712 return !contents.empty() && will_spill();
9713}
9714
9715bool item::is_engine() const
9716{
9717 return !!type->engine;
9718}
9719
9720bool item::is_wheel() const
9721{
9722 return !!type->wheel;
9723}
9724
9725bool item::is_fuel() const
9726{
9727 // A fuel is made of only one material
9728 if( type->materials.size() != 1 ) {
9729 return false;
9730 }
9731 // and this material has to produce energy
9732 if( get_base_material().get_fuel_data().energy <= 0_J ) {
9733 return false;
9734 }
9735 // and it needs to be have consumable charges
9736 return count_by_charges();
9737}
9738
9739bool item::is_toolmod() const
9740{
9741 return !is_gunmod() && type->mod;
9742}
9743
9744bool item::is_irremovable() const
9745{
9746 return has_flag( flag_IRREMOVABLE );
9747}
9748
9749bool item::is_broken() const
9750{
9751 return has_flag( flag_ITEM_BROKEN );
9752}
9753
9754bool item::is_broken_on_active() const
9755{
9756 return has_flag( flag_ITEM_BROKEN ) || ( wetness && has_flag( flag_WATER_BREAK_ACTIVE ) );
9757}
9758
9759int item::wind_resist() const
9760{
9761 std::vector<const material_type *> materials = made_of_types();
9762 if( materials.empty() ) {
9763 debugmsg( "Called item::wind_resist on an item (%s) made of nothing!", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "9763", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Called item::wind_resist on an item (%s) made of nothing!"
, tname());
9764 return 99;
9765 }
9766
9767 int best = -1;
9768 for( const material_type *mat : materials ) {
9769 std::optional<int> resistance = mat->wind_resist();
9770 if( resistance && *resistance > best ) {
9771 best = *resistance;
9772 }
9773 }
9774
9775 // Default to 99% effective
9776 if( best == -1 ) {
9777 return 99;
9778 }
9779
9780 return best;
9781}
9782
9783std::set<fault_id> item::faults_potential() const
9784{
9785 std::set<fault_id> res;
9786 res.insert( type->faults.begin(), type->faults.end() );
9787 return res;
9788}
9789
9790int item::wheel_area() const
9791{
9792 return is_wheel() ? type->wheel->diameter * type->wheel->width : 0;
9793}
9794
9795units::energy item::fuel_energy() const
9796{
9797 // The odd units and division are to avoid integer rounding errors.
9798 return get_base_material().get_fuel_data().energy * units::to_milliliter( base_volume() ) / 1000;
9799}
9800
9801std::string item::fuel_pump_terrain() const
9802{
9803 return get_base_material().get_fuel_data().pump_terrain;
9804}
9805
9806bool item::has_explosion_data() const
9807{
9808 return !get_base_material().get_fuel_data().explosion_data.is_empty();
9809}
9810
9811struct fuel_explosion_data item::get_explosion_data() const {
9812 return get_base_material().get_fuel_data().explosion_data;
9813}
9814
9815bool item::is_container_empty() const
9816{
9817 return contents.empty();
9818}
9819
9820bool item::is_container_full( bool allow_bucket ) const
9821{
9822 return contents.full( allow_bucket );
9823}
9824
9825bool item::is_magazine_full() const
9826{
9827 return contents.is_magazine_full();
9828}
9829
9830bool item::can_unload_liquid() const
9831{
9832 if( has_flag( flag_NO_UNLOAD ) ) {
9833 return false;
9834 }
9835
9836 return contents.can_unload_liquid();
9837}
9838
9839bool item::contains_no_solids() const
9840{
9841 return contents.contains_no_solids();
9842}
9843
9844bool item::allows_speedloader( const itype_id &speedloader_id ) const
9845{
9846 return contents.allows_speedloader( speedloader_id );
9847}
9848
9849bool item::can_reload_with( const item &ammo, bool now ) const
9850{
9851 if( has_flag( flag_NO_RELOAD ) && !has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) ) {
9852 return false; // turrets ignore NO_RELOAD flag
9853 }
9854
9855 if( now && ammo.is_magazine() && !ammo.empty() ) {
9856 if( is_tool() ) {
9857 // Dirty hack because "ammo" on tools is actually completely separate thing from "ammo" on guns and "ammo_types()" works only for guns
9858 if( !type->tool->ammo_id.count( ammo.contents.first_ammo().ammo_type() ) ) {
9859 return false;
9860 }
9861 } else {
9862 if( !ammo_types().count( ammo.contents.first_ammo().ammo_type() ) ) {
9863 return false;
9864 }
9865 }
9866 }
9867
9868 // Check if the item is in general compatible with any reloadable pocket.
9869 return contents.can_reload_with( ammo, now );
9870}
9871
9872bool item::is_salvageable() const
9873{
9874 if( is_null() ) {
9875 return false;
9876 }
9877 // None of the materials are salvageable or they turn into the original item
9878 const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
9879 if( std::none_of( mats.begin(), mats.end(), [this]( const std::pair<material_id, int> &m ) {
9880 return m.first->salvaged_into().has_value() && m.first->salvaged_into().value() != type->get_id();
9881 } ) ) {
9882 return false;
9883 }
9884 return !has_flag( flag_NO_SALVAGE );
9885}
9886
9887bool item::is_disassemblable() const
9888{
9889 return !ethereal && ( recipe_dictionary::get_uncraft( typeId() ) || typeId() == itype_disassembly );
9890}
9891
9892bool item::is_craft() const
9893{
9894 return craft_data_ != nullptr;
9895}
9896
9897bool item::is_funnel_container( units::volume &bigger_than ) const
9898{
9899 if( get_total_capacity() <= bigger_than ) {
9900 return false; // skip contents check, performance
9901 }
9902 return contents.is_funnel_container( bigger_than );
9903}
9904
9905bool item::is_emissive() const
9906{
9907 return light.luminance > 0 || type->light_emission > 0;
9908}
9909
9910bool item::is_deployable() const
9911{
9912 return type->can_use( "deploy_furn" ) || type->can_use( "deploy_appliance" );
9913}
9914
9915bool item::is_tool() const
9916{
9917 return !!type->tool;
9918}
9919
9920bool item::is_transformable() const
9921{
9922 return type->use_methods.find( "transform" ) != type->use_methods.end();
9923}
9924
9925bool item::is_relic() const
9926{
9927 return !!relic_data;
9928}
9929
9930bool item::is_same_relic( item const &rhs ) const
9931{
9932 return ( !is_relic() && !rhs.is_relic() ) ||
9933 ( is_relic() && rhs.is_relic() && *relic_data == *rhs.relic_data );
9934}
9935
9936bool item::is_same_temperature( item const &rhs ) const
9937{
9938 return ( !has_temperature() && !rhs.has_temperature() ) ||
9939 ( has_temperature() && rhs.has_temperature() &&
9940 has_flag( flag_HOT ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_HOT ) &&
9941 has_flag( flag_COLD ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_COLD ) &&
9942 has_flag( flag_FROZEN ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_FROZEN ) &&
9943 has_flag( flag_MELTS ) == rhs.has_flag( flag_MELTS ) );
9944}
9945
9946bool item::has_relic_recharge() const
9947{
9948 return is_relic() && relic_data->has_recharge();
9949}
9950
9951bool item::has_relic_activation() const
9952{
9953 return is_relic() && relic_data->has_activation();
9954}
9955
9956std::vector<enchant_cache> item::get_proc_enchantments() const
9957{
9958 if( !is_relic() ) {
9959 return std::vector<enchant_cache> {};
9960 }
9961 return relic_data->get_proc_enchantments();
9962}
9963
9964std::vector<enchantment> item::get_defined_enchantments() const
9965{
9966 if( !is_relic() || !type->relic_data ) {
9967 return std::vector<enchantment> {};
9968 }
9969
9970 return type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments();
9971}
9972
9973double item::calculate_by_enchantment( const Character &owner, double modify,
9974 enchant_vals::mod value, bool round_value ) const
9975{
9976 double add_value = 0.0;
9977 double mult_value = 1.0;
9978 for( const enchant_cache &ench : get_proc_enchantments() ) {
9979 if( ench.is_active( owner, *this ) ) {
9980 add_value += ench.get_value_add( value );
9981 mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value );
9982 }
9983 }
9984 if( type->relic_data ) {
9985 for( const enchantment &ench : type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments() ) {
9986 if( ench.is_active( owner, *this ) ) {
9987 add_value += ench.get_value_add( value, owner );
9988 mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value, owner );
9989 }
9990 }
9991 }
9992 modify += add_value;
9993 modify *= mult_value;
9994 if( round_value ) {
9995 modify = std::round( modify );
9996 }
9997 return modify;
9998}
9999
10000double item::calculate_by_enchantment_wield( const Character &owner, double modify,
10001 enchant_vals::mod value,
10002 bool round_value ) const
10003{
10004 double add_value = 0.0;
10005 double mult_value = 1.0;
10006 for( const enchant_cache &ench : get_proc_enchantments() ) {
10007 if( ench.active_wield() ) {
10008 add_value += ench.get_value_add( value );
10009 mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value );
10010 }
10011 }
10012 if( type->relic_data ) {
10013 for( const enchantment &ench : type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments() ) {
10014 if( ench.active_wield() ) {
10015 add_value += ench.get_value_add( value, owner );
10016 mult_value += ench.get_value_multiply( value, owner );
10017 }
10018 }
10019 }
10020 modify += add_value;
10021 modify *= mult_value;
10022 if( round_value ) {
10023 modify = std::round( modify );
10024 }
10025 return modify;
10026}
10027
10028units::length item::max_containable_length( const bool unrestricted_pockets_only ) const
10029{
10030 return contents.max_containable_length( unrestricted_pockets_only );
10031}
10032
10033units::length item::min_containable_length() const
10034{
10035 return contents.min_containable_length();
10036}
10037
10038units::volume item::max_containable_volume() const
10039{
10040 return contents.max_containable_volume();
10041}
10042
10043ret_val<void> item::is_compatible( const item &it ) const
10044{
10045 if( this == &it ) {
10046 // does the set of all sets contain itself?
10047 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10048 }
10049 // disallow putting portable holes into bags of holding
10050 if( contents.bigger_on_the_inside( volume() ) &&
10051 it.contents.bigger_on_the_inside( it.volume() ) ) {
10052 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10053 }
10054
10055 return contents.is_compatible( it );
10056}
10057
10058ret_val<void> item::can_contain_directly( const item &it ) const
10059{
10060 return can_contain( it, false, false, true, item_location(), 10000000_ml, false );
10061}
10062
10063ret_val<void> item::can_contain( const item &it, const bool nested, const bool ignore_rigidity,
10064 const bool ignore_pkt_settings, const item_location &parent_it,
10065 units::volume remaining_parent_volume, const bool allow_nested ) const
10066{
10067 int copies = 1;
10068 return can_contain( it, copies, nested, ignore_rigidity,
10069 ignore_pkt_settings, parent_it,
10070 remaining_parent_volume, allow_nested );
10071}
10072
10073ret_val<void> item::can_contain( const item &it, int &copies_remaining, const bool nested,
10074 const bool ignore_rigidity, const bool ignore_pkt_settings,
10075 const item_location &parent_it, units::volume remaining_parent_volume,
10076 const bool allow_nested ) const
10077{
10078 if( copies_remaining <= 0 ) {
10079 return ret_val<void>::make_success();
10080 }
10081 if( this == &it || ( parent_it.where() != item_location::type::invalid &&
10082 this == parent_it.get_item() ) ) {
10083 // does the set of all sets contain itself?
10084 // or does this already contain it?
10085 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( "can't put a container into itself" );
10086 }
10087 if( nested && !this->is_container() ) {
10088 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10089 }
10090 // disallow putting portable holes into bags of holding
10091 if( contents.bigger_on_the_inside( volume() ) &&
10092 it.contents.bigger_on_the_inside( it.volume() ) ) {
10093 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
10094 }
10095
10096 if( allow_nested ) {
10097 for( const item_pocket *pkt : contents.get_all_contained_pockets() ) {
10098 if( pkt->empty() ) {
10099 continue;
10100 }
10101
10102 // early exit for max length no nested item is gonna fix this
10103 if( pkt->max_containable_length() < it.length() ) {
10104 continue;
10105 }
10106
10107 // If the current pocket has restrictions or blacklists the item,
10108 // try the nested pocket regardless of whether it's soft or rigid.
10109 const bool ignore_nested_rigidity =
10110 !pkt->settings.accepts_item( it ) ||
10111 !pkt->get_pocket_data()->get_flag_restrictions().empty();
10112 for( const item *internal_it : pkt->all_items_top() ) {
10113 if( parent_it.where() != item_location::type::invalid && internal_it == parent_it.get_item() ) {
10114 continue;
10115 }
10116 if( !internal_it->is_container() ) {
10117 continue;
10118 }
10119 auto ret = internal_it->can_contain( it, copies_remaining, true, ignore_nested_rigidity,
10120 ignore_pkt_settings, parent_it, pkt->remaining_volume() );
10121 if( copies_remaining <= 0 ) {
10122 return ret;
10123 }
10124 }
10125 }
10126 }
10127
10128 return nested && !ignore_rigidity ?
10129 contents.can_contain_rigid( it, copies_remaining, ignore_pkt_settings ) :
10130 contents.can_contain( it, copies_remaining, ignore_pkt_settings, remaining_parent_volume );
10131}
10132
10133ret_val<void> item::can_contain( const itype &tp ) const
10134{
10135 return can_contain( item( &tp ) );
10136}
10137
10138ret_val<void> item::can_contain_partial( const item &it ) const
10139{
10140 item i_copy = it;
10141 if( i_copy.count_by_charges() ) {
10142 i_copy.charges = 1;
10143 }
10144 return can_contain( i_copy );
10145}
10146
10147ret_val<void> item::can_contain_partial_directly( const item &it ) const
10148{
10149 item i_copy = it;
10150 if( i_copy.count_by_charges() ) {
10151 i_copy.charges = 1;
10152 }
10153 return can_contain( i_copy, false, false, true, item_location(), 10000000_ml, false );
10154}
10155
10156std::pair<item_location, item_pocket *> item::best_pocket( const item &it, item_location &this_loc,
10157 const item *avoid, const bool allow_sealed, const bool ignore_settings,
10158 const bool nested, bool ignore_rigidity )
10159{
10160 return contents.best_pocket( it, this_loc, avoid, allow_sealed, ignore_settings,
10161 nested, ignore_rigidity );
10162}
10163
10164bool item::spill_contents( Character &c )
10165{
10166 if( !is_container() || is_container_empty() ) {
10167 return true;
10168 }
10169
10170 if( c.is_npc() ) {
10171 return spill_contents( c.pos() );
10172 }
10173
10174 contents.handle_liquid_or_spill( c, /*avoid=*/this );
10175 on_contents_changed();
10176
10177 return is_container_empty();
10178}
10179
10180bool item::spill_contents( const tripoint &pos )
10181{
10182 if( !is_container() || is_container_empty() ) {
10183 return true;
10184 }
10185 return contents.spill_contents( pos );
10186}
10187
10188bool item::spill_open_pockets( Character &guy, const item *avoid )
10189{
10190 return contents.spill_open_pockets( guy, avoid );
10191}
10192
10193void item::overflow( const tripoint &pos, const item_location &loc )
10194{
10195 contents.overflow( pos, loc );
10196}
10197
10198book_proficiency_bonuses item::get_book_proficiency_bonuses() const
10199{
10200 book_proficiency_bonuses ret;
10201
10202 if( is_ebook_storage() ) {
10203 for( const item *book : ebooks() ) {
10204 ret += book->get_book_proficiency_bonuses();
10205 }
10206 }
10207
10208 if( !type->book ) {
10209 return ret;
10210 }
10211 for( const book_proficiency_bonus &bonus : type->book->proficiencies ) {
10212 ret.add( bonus );
10213 }
10214 return ret;
10215}
10216
10217int item::get_chapters() const
10218{
10219 if( !type->book ) {
10220 return 0;
10221 }
10222 return type->book->chapters;
10223}
10224
10225int item::get_remaining_chapters( const Character &u ) const
10226{
10227 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
10228 const std::string var = string_format( "remaining-chapters-%d", u.getID().get_value() );
10229 return get_var( var, get_chapters() );
10230}
10231
10232void item::mark_chapter_as_read( const Character &u )
10233{
10234 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
10235 const std::string var = string_format( "remaining-chapters-%d", u.getID().get_value() );
10236 if( type->book && type->book->chapters == 0 ) {
10237 // books without chapters will always have remaining chapters == 0, so we don't need to store them
10238 erase_var( var );
10239 return;
10240 }
10241 const int remain = std::max( 0, get_remaining_chapters( u ) - 1 );
10242 set_var( var, remain );
10243}
10244
10245std::set<recipe_id> item::get_saved_recipes() const
10246{
10247 if( is_broken_on_active() ) {
10248 return {};
10249 }
10250 std::set<recipe_id> result;
10251 for( const std::string &rid_str : string_split( get_var( "EIPC_RECIPES" ), ',' ) ) {
10252 const recipe_id rid( rid_str );
10253 if( rid.is_empty() ) {
10254 continue;
10255 }
10256 if( !rid.is_valid() ) {
10257 DebugLog( D_WARNING, D_GAME ) << type->get_id().str() <<
10258 " contained invalid recipe id '" << rid.str() << "'";
10259 continue;
10260 }
10261 result.emplace( rid );
10262 }
10263 return result;
10264}
10265
10266void item::set_saved_recipes( const std::set<recipe_id> &recipes )
10267{
10268 set_var( "EIPC_RECIPES", string_join( recipes, "," ) );
10269}
10270
10271std::vector<std::pair<const recipe *, int>> item::get_available_recipes(
10272 const Character &u ) const
10273{
10274 std::vector<std::pair<const recipe *, int>> recipe_entries;
10275 if( is_book() ) {
10276 if( !u.has_identified( typeId() ) ) {
10277 return {};
10278 }
10279
10280 for( const islot_book::recipe_with_description_t &elem : type->book->recipes ) {
10281 if( u.get_knowledge_level( elem.recipe->skill_used ) >= elem.skill_level ) {
10282 recipe_entries.emplace_back( elem.recipe, elem.skill_level );
10283 }
10284 }
10285 } else {
10286 for( const recipe_id &rid : get_saved_recipes() ) {
10287 const recipe *r = &rid.obj();
10288 if( u.get_knowledge_level( r->skill_used ) >= r->difficulty ) {
10289 recipe_entries.emplace_back( r, r->difficulty );
10290 }
10291 }
10292 }
10293 return recipe_entries;
10294}
10295
10296const material_type &item::get_random_material() const
10297{
10298 std::vector<material_id> matlist;
10299 const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
10300 matlist.reserve( mats.size() );
10301 for( auto mat : mats ) {
10302 matlist.emplace_back( mat.first );
10303 }
10304 return *random_entry( matlist, material_id::NULL_ID() );
10305}
10306
10307const material_type &item::get_base_material() const
10308{
10309 const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
10310 const material_type *m = &material_id::NULL_ID().obj();
10311 int portion = 0;
10312 for( const std::pair<material_id, int> mat : mats ) {
10313 if( mat.second > portion ) {
10314 portion = mat.second;
10315 m = &mat.first.obj();
10316 }
10317 }
10318 // Material portions all equal / not specified. Select first material.
10319 if( portion == 1 ) {
10320 if( is_corpse() ) {
10321 return corpse->mat.begin()->first.obj();
10322 }
10323 return *type->default_mat;
10324 }
10325 return *m;
10326}
10327
10328bool item::operator<( const item &other ) const
10329{
10330 const item_category &cat_a = get_category_of_contents();
10331 const item_category &cat_b = other.get_category_of_contents();
10332 if( cat_a != cat_b ) {
10333 return cat_a < cat_b;
10334 } else {
10335
10336 if( this->typeId() == other.typeId() ) {
10337 if( this->is_money() ) {
10338 return this->charges > other.charges;
10339 }
10340 return this->charges < other.charges;
10341 } else {
10342 std::string n1 = this->type->nname( 1 );
10343 std::string n2 = other.type->nname( 1 );
10344 return localized_compare( n1, n2 );
10345 }
10346 }
10347}
10348
10349skill_id item::gun_skill() const
10350{
10351 if( !is_gun() ) {
10352 return skill_id::NULL_ID();
10353 }
10354 return type->gun->skill_used;
10355}
10356
10357gun_type_type item::gun_type() const
10358{
10359 static skill_id skill_archery( "archery" );
10360
10361 if( !is_gun() ) {
10362 return gun_type_type( std::string() );
10363 }
10364 // TODO: move to JSON and remove extraction of this from "GUN" (via skill id)
10365 //and from "GUNMOD" (via "mod_targets") in lang/extract_json_strings.py
10366 if( gun_skill() == skill_archery ) {
10367 if( ammo_types().count( ammo_bolt ) || typeId() == itype_bullet_crossbow ) {
10368 return gun_type_type( translate_marker_context( "gun_type_type", "crossbow" )"crossbow" );
10369 } else {
10370 return gun_type_type( translate_marker_context( "gun_type_type", "bow" )"bow" );
10371 }
10372 }
10373 return gun_type_type( gun_skill().str() );
10374}
10375
10376skill_id item::melee_skill() const
10377{
10378 if( !is_melee() ) {
10379 return skill_id::NULL_ID();
10380 }
10381
10382 int hi = 0;
10383 skill_id res = skill_id::NULL_ID();
10384
10385 for( const damage_type &dt : damage_type::get_all() ) {
10386 const int val = damage_melee( dt.id );
10387 if( val > hi && !dt.skill.is_null() ) {
10388 hi = val;
10389 res = dt.skill;
10390 }
10391 }
10392
10393 return res;
10394}
10395
10396int item::min_cycle_recoil() const
10397{
10398 if( !is_gun() ) {
10399 return 0;
10400 }
10401 int to_cycle = type->gun->min_cycle_recoil;
10402 // This should only be used for one mod or it'll mess things up
10403 // TODO: maybe generalize this so you can have mods for hot loads or whatever
10404 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10405 // this value defaults to -1
10406 if( mod->type->gunmod->overwrite_min_cycle_recoil > 0 ) {
10407 to_cycle = mod->type->gunmod->overwrite_min_cycle_recoil;
10408 }
10409 }
10410 return to_cycle;
10411}
10412
10413int item::gun_dispersion( bool with_ammo, bool with_scaling ) const
10414{
10415 if( !is_gun() ) {
10416 return 0;
10417 }
10418 int dispersion_sum = type->gun->dispersion;
10419 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10420 dispersion_sum += mod->type->gunmod->dispersion;
10421 }
10422 int dispPerDamage = get_option< int >( "DISPERSION_PER_GUN_DAMAGE" );
10423 dispersion_sum += damage_level() * dispPerDamage;
10424 dispersion_sum = std::max( dispersion_sum, 0 );
10425 if( with_ammo && ammo_data() ) {
10426 dispersion_sum += ammo_data()->ammo->dispersion_considering_length( barrel_length() );
10427 }
10428 if( !with_scaling ) {
10429 return dispersion_sum;
10430 }
10431
10432 // Dividing dispersion by 15 temporarily as a gross adjustment,
10433 // will bake that adjustment into individual gun definitions in the future.
10434 // Absolute minimum gun dispersion is 1.
10435 double divider = get_option< float >( "GUN_DISPERSION_DIVIDER" );
10436 dispersion_sum = std::max( static_cast<int>( std::round( dispersion_sum / divider ) ), 1 );
10437
10438 return dispersion_sum;
10439}
10440
10441std::pair<int, int> item::sight_dispersion( const Character &character ) const
10442{
10443 if( !is_gun() ) {
10444 return std::make_pair( 0, 0 );
10445 }
10446 int act_disp = has_flag( flag_DISABLE_SIGHTS ) ? 300 : type->gun->sight_dispersion;
10447 int eff_disp = character.effective_dispersion( act_disp );
10448
10449 for( const item *e : gunmods() ) {
10450 const islot_gunmod &mod = *e->type->gunmod;
10451 int e_act_disp = mod.sight_dispersion;
10452 if( mod.sight_dispersion < 0 || mod.field_of_view <= 0 ) {
10453 continue;
10454 }
10455 int e_eff_disp = character.effective_dispersion( e_act_disp, e->has_flag( flag_ZOOM ) );
10456 if( eff_disp > e_eff_disp ) {
10457 eff_disp = e_eff_disp;
10458 act_disp = e_act_disp;
10459
10460 }
10461 }
10462 return std::make_pair( act_disp, eff_disp );
10463}
10464
10465damage_instance item::gun_damage( bool with_ammo, bool shot ) const
10466{
10467 if( !is_gun() ) {
10468 return damage_instance();
10469 }
10470
10471 units::length bl = barrel_length();
10472 damage_instance ret = type->gun->damage.di_considering_length( bl );
10473
10474 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10475 ret.add( mod->type->gunmod->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10476 }
10477
10478 if( with_ammo && ammo_data() ) {
10479 if( shot ) {
10480 ret.add( ammo_data()->ammo->shot_damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10481 } else {
10482 ret.add( ammo_data()->ammo->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10483 }
10484 }
10485
10486 if( damage() > 0 ) {
10487 // TODO: This isn't a good solution for multi-damage guns/ammos
10488 for( damage_unit &du : ret ) {
10489 if( du.amount <= 1.0 ) {
10490 continue;
10491 }
10492 du.amount = std::max<float>( 1.0f, damage_adjusted_gun_damage( du.amount ) );
10493 }
10494 }
10495
10496 return ret;
10497}
10498
10499damage_instance item::gun_damage( itype_id ammo ) const
10500{
10501 if( !is_gun() ) {
10502 return damage_instance();
10503 }
10504
10505 units::length bl = barrel_length();
10506 damage_instance ret = type->gun->damage.di_considering_length( bl );
10507
10508 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10509 ret.add( mod->type->gunmod->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10510 }
10511
10512 ret.add( ammo->ammo->damage.di_considering_length( bl ) );
10513
10514 if( damage() > 0 ) {
10515 // TODO: This isn't a good solution for multi-damage guns/ammos
10516 for( damage_unit &du : ret ) {
10517 if( du.amount <= 1.0 ) {
10518 continue;
10519 }
10520 du.amount = std::max<float>( 1.0f, damage_adjusted_gun_damage( du.amount ) );
10521 }
10522 }
10523
10524 return ret;
10525}
10526units::mass item::gun_base_weight() const
10527{
10528 units::mass base_weight = type->weight;
10529 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10530 if( !mod->type->mod->ammo_modifier.empty() ) {
10531 base_weight += mod->type->integral_weight;
10532 }
10533 }
10534 return base_weight;
10535
10536}
10537int item::gun_recoil( const Character &p, bool bipod, bool ideal_strength ) const
10538{
10539 if( !is_gun() || ( ammo_required() && !ammo_remaining() ) ) {
10540 return 0;
10541 }
10542
10543 ///\ARM_STR improves the handling of heavier weapons
10544 // we consider only base weight to avoid exploits
10545 // now we need to add weight of receiver
10546 double wt = ideal_strength ? gun_base_weight() / 333.0_gram : std::min( gun_base_weight(),
10547 p.get_arm_str() * 333_gram ) / 333.0_gram;
10548
10549 double handling = type->gun->handling;
10550 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10551 if( bipod || !mod->has_flag( flag_BIPOD ) ) {
10552 handling += mod->type->gunmod->handling;
10553 }
10554 }
10555
10556 // rescale from JSON units which are intentionally specified as integral values
10557 handling /= 10;
10558
10559 // algorithm is biased so heavier weapons benefit more from improved handling
10560 handling = std::pow( wt, 0.8 ) * std::pow( handling, 1.2 );
10561
10562 int qty = type->gun->recoil;
10563 if( ammo_data() ) {
10564 qty += ammo_data()->ammo->recoil;
10565 }
10566
10567 // handling could be either a bonus or penalty dependent upon installed mods
10568 if( handling > 1.0 ) {
10569 return qty / handling;
10570 } else {
10571 return qty * ( 1.0 + std::abs( handling ) );
10572 }
10573}
10574
10575float item::gun_shot_spread_multiplier() const
10576{
10577 if( !is_gun() ) {
10578 return 0;
10579 }
10580 float ret = 1.0f;
10581 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10582 ret += mod->type->gunmod->shot_spread_multiplier_modifier;
10583 }
10584 return std::max( ret, 0.0f );
10585}
10586
10587int item::gun_range( bool with_ammo ) const
10588{
10589 if( !is_gun() ) {
10590 return 0;
10591 }
10592 int ret = type->gun->range;
10593 float range_multiplier = 1.0;
10594 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
10595 ret += mod->type->gunmod->range;
10596 range_multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->range_multiplier;
10597 }
10598 if( with_ammo && ammo_data() ) {
10599 ret += ammo_data()->ammo->range;
10600 range_multiplier *= ammo_data()->ammo->range_multiplier;
10601 }
10602 ret *= range_multiplier;
10603 return std::min( std::max( 0, ret ), RANGE_HARD_CAP );
10604}
10605
10606int item::gun_range( const Character *p ) const
10607{
10608 int ret = gun_range( true );
10609 if( p == nullptr ) {
10610 return ret;
10611 }
10612 if( !p->meets_requirements( *this ) ) {
10613 return 0;
10614 }
10615
10616 // Reduce bow range until player has twice minimum required strength
10617 if( has_flag( flag_STR_DRAW ) ) {
10618 ret += std::max( 0.0, ( p->get_str() - get_min_str() ) * 0.5 );
10619 }
10620
10621 ret = p->enchantment_cache->modify_value( enchant_vals::mod::RANGE, ret );
10622
10623 return std::max( 0, ret );
10624}
10625
10626int item::shots_remaining( const Character *carrier ) const
10627{
10628 int ret = 1000; // Arbitrary large number for things that do not require ammo.
10629 if( ammo_required() ) {
10630 ret = std::min( ammo_remaining( carrier, true ) / ammo_required(), ret );
10631 }
10632 if( get_gun_energy_drain() > 0_kJ ) {
10633 ret = std::min( static_cast<int>( energy_remaining( carrier ) / get_gun_energy_drain() ), ret );
10634 }
10635 return ret;
10636}
10637
10638int item::ammo_remaining( const std::set<ammotype> &ammo, const Character *carrier,
10639 const bool include_linked ) const
10640{
10641 int ret = 0;
10642
10643 // Magazine in the item
10644 const item *mag = magazine_current();
10645 if( mag ) {
10646 ret += mag->ammo_remaining();
10647 }
10648
10649 // Cable connections
10650 if( include_linked && link_length() >= 0 && link().efficiency >= MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ) {
10651 if( link().t_veh ) {
10652 ret += link().t_veh->connected_battery_power_level().first;
10653 } else {
10654 const optional_vpart_position vp = get_map().veh_at( link().t_abs_pos );
10655 if( vp ) {
10656 ret += vp->vehicle().connected_battery_power_level().first;
10657 }
10658 }
10659 }
10660
10661 // Non ammo using item that uses charges
10662 if( ammo.empty() ) {
10663 ret += charges;
10664 }
10665
10666 // Magazines and integral magazines on their own
10667 if( is_magazine() ) {
10668 for( const item *e : contents.all_items_top( pocket_type::MAGAZINE ) ) {
10669 if( e->is_ammo() ) {
10670 ret += e->charges;
10671 }
