12821 units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy - specific_energy );
12822 new_item_temperature = ( ( freezing_temperature - env_temperature )
12823 * std::exp( - extra_time * conductivity_term / ( mass *
12824 specific_heat_liquid ) )
12825 + env_temperature );
12826 new_specific_energy = ( new_item_temperature - freezing_temperature ) * specific_heat_liquid +
12827 units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy );
12828 } else if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12829 // Item froze before temp was calculated
12830 // Calculate how long the item was freezing
12831 // and apply rest of the time as solid
12832 extra_time = to_turns<int>( time_delta ) - ( mass / ( conductivity_term * temperature_difference ) )
12833 *
12834 units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_frozen_specific_energy - specific_energy );
12835 new_item_temperature = ( ( freezing_temperature - env_temperature )
12836 * std::exp( - extra_time * conductivity_term / ( mass *
12837 specific_heat_solid ) )
12838 + env_temperature );
12839 new_specific_energy = new_item_temperature * specific_heat_solid;
12840 }
12841 }
12842 // Check freeze status now based on energies.
12843 if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) > completely_liquid_specific_energy ) {
12844 freeze_percentage = 0;
12845 } else if( units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy ) < completely_frozen_specific_energy ) {
12846 // Item is solid
12847 freeze_percentage = 1;
12848 } else {
12849 // Item is partially solid
12850 freeze_percentage = ( units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy ) -
12851 new_specific_energy ) /
12852 units::to_joule_per_gram( completely_liquid_specific_energy - completely_frozen_specific_energy );
12853 }
12854
12855 temperature = units::from_kelvin( new_item_temperature );
12856 specific_energy = units::from_joule_per_gram( new_specific_energy );
12857 set_temp_flags( temperature, freeze_percentage );
12858}
12859
12860void item::set_temp_flags( units::temperature new_temperature, float freeze_percentage )
12861{
12862 units::temperature freezing_temperature = get_freeze_point();
12863 // Apply temperature tags tags
12864 // Hot = over temperatures::hot
12865 // Warm = over temperatures::warm
12866 // Cold = below temperatures::cold
12867 // Frozen = Over 50% frozen
12868 if( has_own_flag( flag_FROZEN ) ) {
12869 unset_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12870 if( freeze_percentage < 0.5 ) {
12871 // Item melts and becomes mushy
12872 current_phase = type->phase;
12873 apply_freezerburn();
12874 unset_flag( flag_SHREDDED );
12875 if( made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
12876 set_flag( flag_FROM_FROZEN_LIQUID );
12877 }
12878 }
12879 } else if( has_own_flag( flag_COLD ) ) {
12880 unset_flag( flag_COLD );
12881 } else if( has_own_flag( flag_HOT ) ) {
12882 unset_flag( flag_HOT );
12883 }
12884 if( new_temperature > temperatures::hot ) {
12885 set_flag( flag_HOT );
12886 } else if( freeze_percentage > 0.5 ) {
12887 set_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12888 current_phase = phase_id::SOLID;
12889 // If below freezing temp AND the food may have parasites AND food does not have "NO_PARASITES" tag then add the "NO_PARASITES" tag.
12890 if( is_food() && new_temperature < freezing_temperature && get_comestible()->parasites > 0 ) {
12891 set_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES );
12892 }
12893 } else if( new_temperature < temperatures::cold ) {
12894 set_flag( flag_COLD );
12895 }
12896
12897 // Convert water into clean water if it starts boiling
12898 if( typeId() == itype_water && new_temperature > temperatures::boiling ) {
12899 convert( itype_water_clean ).poison = 0;
12900 }
12901}
12902
12903float item::get_item_thermal_energy() const
12904{
12905 const float mass = to_gram( weight() ); // g
12906 return units::to_joule_per_gram( specific_energy ) * mass;
12907}
12908
12909void item::heat_up()
12910{
12911 unset_flag( flag_COLD );
12912 unset_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12913 unset_flag( flag_SHREDDED );
12914 set_flag( flag_HOT );
12915 current_phase = type->phase;
12916 // Set item temperature to 60 C (333.15 K, 122 F)
12917 // Also set the energy to match
12918 temperature = units::from_celsius( 60 );
12919 specific_energy = get_specific_energy_from_temperature( units::from_celsius( 60 ) );
12920
12921 reset_temp_check();
12922}
12923
12924void item::cold_up()
12925{
12926 unset_flag( flag_HOT );
12927 unset_flag( flag_FROZEN );
12928 unset_flag( flag_SHREDDED );
12929 set_flag( flag_COLD );
12930 current_phase = type->phase;
12931 // Set item temperature to 3 C (276.15 K, 37.4 F)
12932 // Also set the energy to match
12933 temperature = units::from_celsius( 3 );
12934 specific_energy = get_specific_energy_from_temperature( units::from_celsius( 3 ) );
12935
12936 reset_temp_check();
12937}
12938
12939void item::reset_temp_check()
12940{
12941 last_temp_check = calendar::turn;
12942}
12943
12944std::vector<trait_id> item::mutations_from_wearing( const Character &guy, bool removing ) const
12945{
12946 if( !is_relic() ) {
12947 return std::vector<trait_id> {};
12948 }
12949 std::vector<trait_id> muts;
12950
12951 for( const enchant_cache &ench : relic_data->get_proc_enchantments() ) {
12952 for( const trait_id &mut : ench.get_mutations() ) {
12953 // this may not be perfectly accurate due to conditions
12954 muts.push_back( mut );
12955 }
12956 }
12957 if( type->relic_data ) {
12958 for( const enchantment &ench : type->relic_data->get_defined_enchantments() ) {
12959 for( const trait_id &mut : ench.get_mutations() ) {
12960 // this may not be perfectly accurate due to conditions
12961 muts.push_back( mut );
12962 }
12963 }
12964 }
12965 for( const trait_id &char_mut : guy.get_mutations( true, removing ) ) {
12966 for( auto iter = muts.begin(); iter != muts.end(); ) {
12967 if( char_mut == *iter ) {
12968 iter = muts.erase( iter );
12969 } else {
12970 ++iter;
12971 }
12972 }
12973 }
12974
12975 return muts;
12976}
12977
12978void item::overwrite_relic( const relic &nrelic )
12979{
12980 this->relic_data = cata::make_value<relic>( nrelic );
12981}
12982
12983bool item::use_relic( Character &guy, const tripoint &pos )
12984{
12985 return relic_data->activate( guy, pos );
12986}
12987
12988void item::process_relic( Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
12989{
12990 if( !is_relic() ) {
12991 return;
12992 }
12993
12994 relic_data->try_recharge( *this, carrier, pos );
12995}
12996
12997bool item::process_corpse( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
12998{
12999 // some corpses rez over time
13000 if( corpse == nullptr || damage() >= max_damage() ) {
13001 return false;
13002 }
13003
13004 if( corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_DORMANT ) ) {
13005 //if dormant, ensure trap still exists.
13006 const trap *trap_here = &here.tr_at( pos );
13007 if( trap_here->is_null() ) {
13008 // if there isn't a trap, we need to add one again.
13009 here.trap_set( pos, trap_id( "tr_dormant_corpse" ) );
13010 } else if( trap_here->loadid != trap_id( "tr_dormant_corpse" ) ) {
13011 // if there is a trap, but it isn't the right one, we need to revive the zombie manually.
13012 return g->revive_corpse( pos, *this, 3 );
13013 }
13014 return false;
13015 }
13016
13017 // handle human corpses rising as zombies
13018 if( corpse->id == mtype_id::NULL_ID() && !has_var( "zombie_form" ) &&
13019 !mon_human->zombify_into.is_empty() ) {
13020 set_var( "zombie_form", mon_human->zombify_into.c_str() );
13021 }
13022
13023 if( !ready_to_revive( here, pos ) ) {
13024 return false;
13025 }
13026 if( rng( 0, volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor ) > burnt && g->revive_corpse( pos, *this ) ) {
13027 if( carrier == nullptr ) {
13028 if( corpse->in_species( species_ROBOT ) ) {
13029 add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_warning, _( "A nearby robot has repaired itself and stands up!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "A nearby robot has repaired itself and stands up!"
) ) ) );
13030 } else {
13031 add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_warning, _( "A nearby corpse rises and moves towards you!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "A nearby corpse rises and moves towards you!"
) ) ) );
13032 }
13033 } else {
13034 if( corpse->in_species( species_ROBOT ) ) {
13035 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning,
13036 _( "Oh dear god, a robot you're carrying has started moving!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Oh dear god, a robot you're carrying has started moving!"
) ) ) );
13037 } else {
13038 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning,
13039 _( "Oh dear god, a corpse you're carrying has started moving!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Oh dear god, a corpse you're carrying has started moving!"
) ) ) );
13040 }
13041 }
13042 // Destroy this corpse item
13043 return true;
13044 }
13045
13046 return false;
13047}
13048
13049bool item::process_fake_mill( map &here, Character * /*carrier*/, const tripoint &pos )
13050{
13051 if( here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_wind_mill_active &&
13052 here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_water_mill_active ) {
13053 item_counter = 0;
13054 return true; //destroy fake mill
13055 }
13056 if( age() >= 6_hours || item_counter == 0 ) {
13057 iexamine::mill_finalize( get_avatar(), pos ); //activate effects when timers goes to zero
13058 return true; //destroy fake mill item
13059 }
13060
13061 return false;
13062}
13063
13064bool item::process_fake_smoke( map &here, Character * /*carrier*/, const tripoint &pos )
13065{
13066 if( here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_smoking_rack_active &&
13067 here.furn( pos ) != furn_f_metal_smoking_rack_active ) {
13068 item_counter = 0;
13069 return true; //destroy fake smoke
13070 }
13071
13072 if( age() >= 6_hours || item_counter == 0 ) {
13073 iexamine::on_smoke_out( pos, birthday() ); //activate effects when timers goes to zero
13074 return true; //destroy fake smoke when it 'burns out'
13075 }
13076
13077 return false;
13078}
13079
13080bool item::process_litcig( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13081{
13082 // cig dies out
13083 if( item_counter == 0 ) {
13084 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13085 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You finish your %s." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You finish your %s." ) ) ), tname() );
13086 }
13087 if( typeId() == itype_cig_lit ) {
13088 convert( itype_cig_butt, carrier );
13089 } else if( typeId() == itype_cigar_lit ) {
13090 convert( itype_cigar_butt, carrier );
13091 } else { // joint
13092 convert( itype_joint_roach, carrier );
13093 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13094 carrier->add_effect( effect_weed_high, 1_minutes ); // one last puff
13095 here.add_field( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), field_type_id( "fd_weedsmoke" ), 2 );
13096 weed_msg( *carrier );
13097 }
13098 }
13099 active = false;
13100 return false;
13101 }
13102
13103 if( !one_in( 10 ) ) {
13104 return false;
13105 }
13106 process_extinguish( here, carrier, pos );
13107 // process_extinguish might have extinguished the item already
13108 if( !active ) {
13109 return false;
13110 }
13111 // if carried by someone:
13112 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13113 time_duration duration = 15_seconds;
13114 if( carrier->has_trait( trait_TOLERANCE ) ) {
13115 duration = 7_seconds;
13116 } else if( carrier->has_trait( trait_LIGHTWEIGHT ) ) {
13117 duration = 30_seconds;
13118 }
13119 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You take a puff of your %s." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You take a puff of your %s."
) ) ), tname() );
13120 if( has_flag( flag_TOBACCO ) ) {
13121 carrier->add_effect( effect_cig, duration );
13122 } else {
13123 carrier->add_effect( effect_weed_high, duration / 2 );
13124 }
13125 carrier->moves -= 15;
13126
13127 if( ( carrier->has_effect( effect_shakes ) && one_in( 10 ) ) ||
13128 ( carrier->has_trait( trait_JITTERY ) && one_in( 200 ) ) ) {
13129 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your shaking hand causes you to drop your %s." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your shaking hand causes you to drop your %s."
) ) ),
13130 tname() );
13131 here.add_item_or_charges( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), *this );
13132 return true; // removes the item that has just been added to the map
13133 }
13134
13135 if( carrier->has_effect( effect_sleep ) ) {
13136 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You fall asleep and drop your %s." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You fall asleep and drop your %s."
) ) ),
13137 tname() );
13138 here.add_item_or_charges( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), *this );
13139 return true; // removes the item that has just been added to the map
13140 }
13141 } else {
13142 // If not carried by someone, but laying on the ground:
13143 if( item_counter % 5 == 0 ) {
13144 // lit cigarette can start fires
13145 if( here.flammable_items_at( pos ) ||
13146 here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE, pos ) ||
13147 here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE_ASH, pos ) ) {
13148 here.add_field( pos, fd_fire, 1 );
13149 }
13150 }
13151 }
13152
13153 // Item remains
13154 return false;
13155}
13156
13157bool item::process_extinguish( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13158{
13159 // checks for water
13160 bool extinguish = false;
13161 bool in_inv = carrier != nullptr && carrier->has_item( *this );
13162 bool submerged = false;
13163 bool precipitation = false;
13164 bool windtoostrong = false;
13165 bool in_veh = carrier != nullptr && carrier->in_vehicle;
13166 w_point weatherPoint = *get_weather().weather_precise;
13167 int windpower = get_weather().windspeed;
13168 switch( get_weather().weather_id->precip ) {
13169 case precip_class::very_light:
13170 precipitation = one_in( 100 );
13171 break;
13172 case precip_class::light:
13173 precipitation = one_in( 50 );
13174 break;
13175 case precip_class::heavy:
13176 precipitation = one_in( 10 );
13177 break;
13178 default:
13179 break;
13180 }
13181 if( in_inv && !in_veh && here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, pos ) ) {
13182 extinguish = true;
13183 submerged = true;
13184 }
13185 if( ( !in_inv && here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_LIQUID, pos ) && !here.veh_at( pos ) ) ||
13186 ( precipitation && !g->is_sheltered( pos ) ) ) {
13187 extinguish = true;
13188 }
13189 if( in_inv && windpower > 5 && !g->is_sheltered( pos ) &&
13190 this->has_flag( flag_WIND_EXTINGUISH ) ) {
13191 windtoostrong = true;
13192 extinguish = true;
13193 }
13194 if( !extinguish ||
13195 ( in_inv && precipitation && carrier->get_wielded_item() &&
13196 carrier->get_wielded_item()->has_flag( flag_RAIN_PROTECT ) ) ) {
13197 return false; //nothing happens
13198 }
13199 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13200 if( submerged ) {
13201 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is quenched by water." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s is quenched by water."
) ) ), tname() );
13202 } else if( precipitation ) {
13203 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is quenched by precipitation." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s is quenched by precipitation."
) ) ),
13204 tname() );
13205 } else if( windtoostrong ) {
13206 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is blown out by the wind." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s is blown out by the wind."
) ) ),
13207 tname() );
13208 }
13209 }
13210
13211 // cig dies out
13212 if( has_flag( flag_LITCIG ) ) {
13213 if( typeId() == itype_cig_lit ) {
13214 convert( itype_cig_butt, carrier );
13215 } else if( typeId() == itype_cigar_lit ) {
13216 convert( itype_cigar_butt, carrier );
13217 } else { // joint
13218 convert( itype_joint_roach, carrier );
13219 }
13220 } else { // transform (lit) items
13221 if( type->revert_to ) {
13222 convert( *type->revert_to, carrier );
13223 } else {
13224 type->invoke( carrier, *this, pos, "transform" );
13225 }
13226
13227 }
13228 active = false;
13229 // Item remains
13230 return false;
13231}
13232
13233item::link_data &item::link()
13234{
13235 if( link_ ) {
13236 return *link_;
13237 }
13238 if( !can_link_up() ) {
13239 debugmsg( "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link().",realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13240", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link()."
, tname())
13240 tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13240", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link()."
, tname());
13241 }
13242 return *( link_ = cata::make_value<item::link_data>() );
13243}
13244
13245const item::link_data &item::link() const
13246{
13247 if( link_ ) {
13248 return *link_;
13249 }
13250 if( !can_link_up() ) {
13251 debugmsg( "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link().",realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13252", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link()."
, tname())
13252 tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13252", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "%s is creating link_data even though it doesn't have a link_up action! can_link_up() should be checked before using link()."
, tname());
13253 }
13254 return *( link_ = cata::make_value<item::link_data>() );
13255}
13256
13257bool item::has_link_data() const
13258{
13259 return !!link_;
13260}
13261
13262bool item::can_link_up() const
13263{
13264 return has_link_data() || type->can_use( "link_up" );
13265}
13266
13267bool item::link_has_state( link_state state ) const
13268{
13269 return !has_link_data() ? state == link_state::no_link :
13270 link_->source == state || link_->target == state;
13271}
13272
13273bool item::link_has_states( link_state source, link_state target ) const
13274{
13275 return !has_link_data() ? source == link_state::no_link && target == link_state::no_link :
13276 ( link_->source == source || link_->source == link_state::automatic ) &&
13277 ( link_->target == target || link_->target == link_state::automatic );
13278}
13279
13280bool item::has_no_links() const
13281{
13282 return !has_link_data() ? true :
13283 link_->source == link_state::no_link && link_->target == link_state::no_link;
13284}
13285
13286std::string item::link_name() const
13287{
13288 return has_flag( flag_CABLE_SPOOL ) ? label( 1 ) : string_format( " %s's cable", label( 1 ) );
13289}
13290
13291ret_val<void> item::link_to( const optional_vpart_position &linked_vp, link_state link_type )
13292{
13293 return linked_vp ? link_to( linked_vp->vehicle(), linked_vp->mount(), link_type ) :
13294 ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13295}
13296
13297ret_val<void> item::link_to( const optional_vpart_position &first_linked_vp,
13298 const optional_vpart_position &second_linked_vp, link_state link_type )
13299{
13300 if( !first_linked_vp || !second_linked_vp ) {
13301 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13302 }
13303 // Link up the second vehicle first so, if it's a tow cable, the first vehicle will tow the second.
13304 ret_val<void> result = link_to( second_linked_vp->vehicle(), second_linked_vp->mount(), link_type );
13305 if( !result.success() ) {
13306 return result;
13307 }
13308 return link_to( first_linked_vp->vehicle(), first_linked_vp->mount(), link_type );
13309}
13310
13311ret_val<void> item::link_to( vehicle &veh, const point &mount, link_state link_type )
13312{
13313 if( !can_link_up() ) {
13314 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %s doesn't have a cable!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %s doesn't have a cable!"
) ) ), type_name() );
13315 }
13316
13317 // First, check if the desired link is actually possible.
13318
13319 if( link_type == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13320 if( veh.has_tow_attached() || veh.is_towed() || veh.is_towing() ) {
13321 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "That vehicle already has a tow-line attached." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "That vehicle already has a tow-line attached."
) ) ) );
13322 } else if( !veh.is_external_part( veh.mount_to_tripoint( mount ) ) ) {
13323 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach a tow-line to an internal part." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You can't attach a tow-line to an internal part."
) ) ) );
13324 } else {
13325 const int part_at = veh.part_at( mount );
13326 if( part_at != -1 && !veh.part( part_at ).carried_stack.empty() ) {
13327 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach a tow-line to a racked part." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You can't attach a tow-line to a racked part."
) ) ) );
13328 }
13329 }
13330 } else {
13331 const link_up_actor *it_actor = static_cast<const link_up_actor *>
13332 ( get_use( "link_up" )->get_actor_ptr() );
13333 bool can_link_port = ( link_type == link_state::vehicle_port ||
13334 link_type == link_state::automatic ) &&
13335 it_actor->targets.find( link_state::vehicle_port ) != it_actor->targets.end() &&
13336 veh.avail_linkable_part( mount, true ) != -1;
13337
13338 bool can_link_battery = ( link_type == link_state::vehicle_battery ||
13339 link_type == link_state::automatic ) &&
13340 it_actor->targets.find( link_state::vehicle_battery ) != it_actor->targets.end() &&
13341 veh.avail_linkable_part( mount, false ) != -1;
13342
13343 if( !can_link_port && !can_link_battery ) {
13344 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %s can't connect to that." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %s can't connect to that."
) ) ), type_name() );
13345 } else if( link_type == link_state::automatic ) {
13346 link_type = can_link_port ? link_state::vehicle_port : link_state::vehicle_battery;
13347 }
13348 }
13349
13350 bool bio_link = link_has_states( link_state::no_link, link_state::bio_cable );
13351 if( bio_link || has_no_links() ) {
13352
13353 // No link exists, so start a new link to a vehicle/appliance.
13354
13355 link().source = bio_link ? link_state::bio_cable : link_state::no_link;
13356 link().target = link_type;
13357 link().t_veh = veh.get_safe_reference();
13358 link().t_abs_pos = get_map().getglobal( link().t_veh->global_pos3() );
13359 link().t_mount = mount;
13360 link().s_bub_pos = tripoint_min; // Forces the item to check the length during process_link.
13361
13362 update_link_traits();
13363 return ret_val<void>::make_success();
13364 }
13365
13366 // There's already a link, so connect the previous vehicle/appliance to the new one.
13367
13368 if( !link_has_state( link_state::no_link ) ) {
13369 debugmsg( "Failed to connect the %s, both ends are already connected!", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13369", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Failed to connect the %s, both ends are already connected!"
, tname());
13370 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13371 }
13372 if( !link().t_veh ) {
13373 vehicle *found_veh = vehicle::find_vehicle( link().t_abs_pos );
13374 if( found_veh ) {
13375 link().t_veh = found_veh->get_safe_reference();
13376 } else {
13377 debugmsg( "Failed to connect the %s, it lost its vehicle pointer!", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13377", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Failed to connect the %s, it lost its vehicle pointer!"
, tname());
13378 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13379 }
13380 }
13381 vehicle *prev_veh = link().t_veh.get();
13382 if( prev_veh == &veh ) {
13383 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You cannot connect the %s to itself." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You cannot connect the %s to itself."
) ) ), prev_veh->name );
13384 }
13385
13386 // Prepare target tripoints for the cable parts that'll be added to the selected/previous vehicles
13387 const std::pair<tripoint, tripoint> prev_part_target = std::make_pair(
13388 ( veh.global_square_location() + veh.coord_translate( mount ) ).raw(),
13389 veh.global_square_location().raw() );
13390 const std::pair<tripoint, tripoint> sel_part_target = std::make_pair(
13391 ( link().t_abs_pos + prev_veh->coord_translate( link().t_mount ) ).raw(),
13392 link().t_abs_pos.raw() );
13393
13394 for( const vpart_reference &vpr : prev_veh->get_any_parts( VPFLAG_POWER_TRANSFER ) ) {
13395 if( vpr.part().target.first == prev_part_target.first &&
13396 vpr.part().target.second == prev_part_target.second ) {
13397 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %1$s and %2$s are already connected." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %1$s and %2$s are already connected."
) ) ),
13398 veh.name, prev_veh->name );
13399 }
13400 }
13401
13402 if( rl_dist( prev_part_target.first, sel_part_target.first ) > link().max_length ) {
13403 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "The %s can't stretch that far!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %s can't stretch that far!"
) ) ), type_name() );
13404 }
13405
13406 const itype_id item_id = typeId();
13407 vpart_id vpid = vpart_id::NULL_ID();
13408 for( const vpart_info &e : vehicles::parts::get_all() ) {
13409 if( e.base_item == item_id ) {
13410 vpid = e.id;
13411 break;
13412 }
13413 }
13414
13415 if( vpid.is_null() ) {
13416 debugmsg( "item %s is not base item of any vehicle part!", item_id.c_str() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13416", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "item %s is not base item of any vehicle part!"
, item_id.c_str());
13417 return ret_val<void>::make_failure();
13418 }
13419
13420 const point prev_mount = link().t_mount;
13421
13422 const ret_val<void> can_mount1 = prev_veh->can_mount( prev_mount, *vpid );
13423 if( !can_mount1.success() ) {
13424 //~ %1$s - cable name, %2$s - the reason why it failed
13425 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach the %1$s: %2$s" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You can't attach the %1$s: %2$s"
) ) ),
13426 type_name(), can_mount1.str() );
13427 }
13428 const ret_val<void> can_mount2 = veh.can_mount( mount, *vpid );
13429 if( !can_mount2.success() ) {
13430 //~ %1$s - cable name, %2$s - the reason why it failed
13431 return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You can't attach the %1$s: %2$s" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You can't attach the %1$s: %2$s"
) ) ),
13432 type_name(), can_mount2.str() );
13433 }
13434
13435 vehicle_part prev_veh_part( vpid, item( *this ) );
13436 prev_veh_part.target.first = prev_part_target.first;
13437 prev_veh_part.target.second = prev_part_target.second;
13438 prev_veh->install_part( prev_mount, std::move( prev_veh_part ) );
13439 prev_veh->precalc_mounts( 1, prev_veh->pivot_rotation[1], prev_veh->pivot_anchor[1] );
13440
13441 vehicle_part sel_veh_part( vpid, item( *this ) );
13442 sel_veh_part.target.first = sel_part_target.first;
13443 sel_veh_part.target.second = sel_part_target.second;
13444 veh.install_part( mount, std::move( sel_veh_part ) );
13445 veh.precalc_mounts( 1, veh.pivot_rotation[1], veh.pivot_anchor[1] );
13446
13447 if( link_type == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13448 if( link().source == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13449 veh.tow_data.set_towing( prev_veh, &veh ); // Previous vehicle is towing.
13450 } else {
13451 veh.tow_data.set_towing( &veh, prev_veh ); // Previous vehicle is being towed.
13452 }
13453 }
13454
13455 if( typeId() != itype_power_cord ) {
13456 // Remove linked_flag from attached parts - the just-added cable vehicle parts do the same thing.
13457 reset_link();
13458 }
13459 //~ %1$s - first vehicle name, %2$s - second vehicle name - %3$s - cable name,
13460 return ret_val<void>::make_success( _( "You connect the %1$s and %2$s with the %3$s." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You connect the %1$s and %2$s with the %3$s."
) ) ),
13461 prev_veh->disp_name(), veh.disp_name(), type_name() );
13462}
13463
13464void item::update_link_traits()
13465{
13466 if( !can_link_up() ) {
13467 return;
13468 }
13469
13470 const link_up_actor *it_actor = static_cast<const link_up_actor *>
13471 ( get_use( "link_up" )->get_actor_ptr() );
13472 link().max_length = it_actor->cable_length == -1 ? type->maximum_charges() : it_actor->cable_length;
13473 link().efficiency = it_actor->efficiency < MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ? 0.0f : it_actor->efficiency;
13474 // Reset s_bub_pos to force the item to check the length during process_link.
13475 link().s_bub_pos = tripoint_min;
13476 link().last_processed = calendar::turn;
13477
13478 for( const item *cable : cables() ) {
13479 if( !cable->can_link_up() ) {
13480 continue;
13481 }
13482 const link_up_actor *actor = static_cast<const link_up_actor *>
13483 ( cable->get_use( "link_up" )->get_actor_ptr() );
13484 link().max_length += actor->cable_length == -1 ? cable->type->maximum_charges() :
13485 actor->cable_length;
13486 link().efficiency = link().efficiency < MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ? 0.0f :
13487 link().efficiency * actor->efficiency;
13488 }
13489
13490 if( link().efficiency >= MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ) {
13491 link().charge_rate = it_actor->charge_rate.value();
13492 // Convert charge_rate to how long it takes to charge 1 kW, the unit batteries use.
13493 // 0 means batteries won't be charged, but it can still provide power to devices unless efficiency is also 0.
13494 if( it_actor->charge_rate != 0_W ) {
13495 double charge_rate = std::floor( 1000000.0 / abs( it_actor->charge_rate.value() ) + 0.5 );
13496 link().charge_interval = std::max( 1, static_cast<int>( charge_rate ) );
13497 }
13498 }
13499}
13500
13501int item::link_length() const
13502{
13503 return has_no_links() ? -2 :
13504 link_has_state( link_state::needs_reeling ) ? -1 : link().length;
13505}
13506
13507int item::max_link_length() const
13508{
13509 return !has_link_data() ? -2 :
13510 link().max_length != -1 ? link().max_length : type->maximum_charges();
13511}
13512
13513int item::link_sort_key() const
13514{
13515 const int length = link_length();
13516 int key = length >= 0 ? -1000000000 : length == -1 ? 0 : 1000000000;
13517 key += max_link_length() * 100000;
13518 return key - length;
13519}
13520
13521bool item::process_link( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13522{
13523 if( link_length() < 0 ) {
13524 return false;
13525 }
13526
13527 const bool is_cable_item = has_flag( flag_CABLE_SPOOL );
13528
13529 // Handle links to items in the inventory.
13530 if( link().source == link_state::solarpack ) {
13531 if( carrier == nullptr || !carrier->worn_with_flag( flag_SOLARPACK_ON ) ) {
13532 add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_bad, _( "The %s has come loose from the solar pack." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %s has come loose from the solar pack."
) ) ),
13533 link_name() );
13534 reset_link( true, carrier );
13535 return false;
13536 }
13537 }
13538 const item_filter used_ups = [&]( const item & itm ) {
13539 return itm.get_var( "cable" ) == "plugged_in";
13540 };
13541 if( link().source == link_state::ups ) {
13542 if( carrier == nullptr || !carrier->cache_has_item_with( flag_IS_UPS, used_ups ) ) {
13543 add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_bad, _( "The %s has come loose from the UPS." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %s has come loose from the UPS."
) ) ), link_name() );
13544 reset_link( true, carrier );
13545 return false;
13546 }
13547 }
13548 // Certain cable states should skip processing and also become inactive if dropped.
13549 if( ( link().target == link_state::no_link && link().source != link_state::vehicle_tow ) ||
13550 link().target == link_state::bio_cable ) {
13551 if( carrier == nullptr ) {
13552 return reset_link( true, nullptr, -1, true, pos );
13553 }
13554 return false;
13555 }
13556
13557 const bool last_t_abs_pos_is_oob = !here.inbounds( link().t_abs_pos );
13558
13559 // Lambda function for checking if a cable has been stretched too long, resetting it if so.
13560 // @return True if the cable is disconnected.
13561 const auto check_length = [this, carrier, pos, last_t_abs_pos_is_oob, is_cable_item]() {
13562 if( debug_mode ) {
13563 add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_IUSE, "%s linked to %s%s, length %d/%d", type_name(),do { if( debug_mode && Messages::has_debug_filter( debugmode
::DF_IUSE ) && ( true ) ) { Messages::add_msg( m_debug
, clang_tidy_no_translations( string_format( "%s linked to %s%s, length %d/%d"
, type_name(), link().t_abs_pos.to_string_writable(), last_t_abs_pos_is_oob
? " (OoB)" : "", link().length, link().max_length ) ) ); } }
while( false )
13564 link().t_abs_pos.to_string_writable(), last_t_abs_pos_is_oob ? " (OoB)" : "",do { if( debug_mode && Messages::has_debug_filter( debugmode
::DF_IUSE ) && ( true ) ) { Messages::add_msg( m_debug
, clang_tidy_no_translations( string_format( "%s linked to %s%s, length %d/%d"
, type_name(), link().t_abs_pos.to_string_writable(), last_t_abs_pos_is_oob
? " (OoB)" : "", link().length, link().max_length ) ) ); } }
while( false )
13565 link().length, link().max_length )do { if( debug_mode && Messages::has_debug_filter( debugmode
::DF_IUSE ) && ( true ) ) { Messages::add_msg( m_debug
, clang_tidy_no_translations( string_format( "%s linked to %s%s, length %d/%d"
, type_name(), link().t_abs_pos.to_string_writable(), last_t_abs_pos_is_oob
? " (OoB)" : "", link().length, link().max_length ) ) ); } }
while( false );
13566 }
13567 if( link().length > link().max_length ) {
13568 std::string cable_name = is_cable_item ? string_format( "over-extended %s", label( 1 ) ) :
13569 string_format( "%s's over-extended cable", label( 1 ) );
13570 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
13571 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your %s breaks loose!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s breaks loose!" ) ) ), cable_name );
13572 } else {
13573 add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_bad, _( "Your %s breaks loose!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s breaks loose!" ) ) ), cable_name );
13574 }
13575 return true;
13576 } else if( link().length + M_SQRT21.41421356237309504880 >= link().max_length + 1 && carrier != nullptr ) {
13577 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "Your %s is stretched to its limit!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s is stretched to its limit!"
) ) ), link_name() );
13578 }
13579 return false;
13580 };
13581
13582 // Check if the item has moved positions this turn.
13583 bool length_check_needed = false;
13584 if( link().s_bub_pos != pos ) {
13585 link().s_bub_pos = pos;
13586 length_check_needed = true;
13587 }
13588
13589 // Re-establish vehicle pointer if it got lost or if this item just got loaded.
13590 if( !link().t_veh ) {
13591 vehicle *found_veh = vehicle::find_vehicle( link().t_abs_pos );
13592 if( !found_veh ) {
13593 return reset_link( true, carrier, -2, true, pos );
13594 }
13595 if( debug_mode ) {
13596 add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_IUSE, "Re-established link of %s to %s.", type_name(),do { if( debug_mode && Messages::has_debug_filter( debugmode
::DF_IUSE ) && ( true ) ) { Messages::add_msg( m_debug
, clang_tidy_no_translations( string_format( "Re-established link of %s to %s."
, type_name(), found_veh->disp_name() ) ) ); } } while( false
)
13597 found_veh->disp_name() )do { if( debug_mode && Messages::has_debug_filter( debugmode
::DF_IUSE ) && ( true ) ) { Messages::add_msg( m_debug
, clang_tidy_no_translations( string_format( "Re-established link of %s to %s."
, type_name(), found_veh->disp_name() ) ) ); } } while( false
);
13598 }
13599 link().t_veh = found_veh->get_safe_reference();
13600 }
13601
13602 // Regular pointers are faster, so make one now that we know the reference is valid.
13603 vehicle *t_veh = link().t_veh.get();
13604
13605 // We should skip processing if the last saved target point is out of bounds, since vehicles give innacurate absolute coordinates when out of bounds.
13606 // However, if the linked vehicle is moving fast enough, we should always do processing to avoid erroneously skipping linked items riding inside of it.
13607 if( last_t_abs_pos_is_oob && t_veh->velocity < HALF_MAPSIZE_X * 400 ) {
13608 if( !length_check_needed ) {
13609 return false;
13610 }
13611 link().length = rl_dist( here.getabs( pos ), link().t_abs_pos.raw() ) +
13612 link().t_mount.abs().x + link().t_mount.abs().y;
13613 if( check_length() ) {
13614 return reset_link( true, carrier );
13615 }
13616 return false;
13617 }
13618
13619 // Find the vp_part index the cable is linked to.
13620 int link_vp_index = -1;
13621 if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_port ) {
13622 for( int idx : t_veh->cable_ports ) {
13623 if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13624 link_vp_index = idx;
13625 break;
13626 }
13627 }
13628 } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_battery ) {
13629 for( int idx : t_veh->batteries ) {
13630 if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13631 link_vp_index = idx;
13632 break;
13633 }
13634 }
13635 if( link_vp_index == -1 ) {
13636 // Check cable_ports, since that includes appliances
13637 for( int idx : t_veh->cable_ports ) {
13638 if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13639 link_vp_index = idx;
13640 break;
13641 }
13642 }
13643 }
13644 } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_tow || link().source == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13645 link_vp_index = t_veh->part_at( t_veh->coord_translate( link().t_mount ) );
13646 }
13647 if( link_vp_index == -1 ) {
13648 // The part with cable ports was lost, so disconnect the cable.
13649 return reset_link( true, carrier, -2, true, pos );
13650 }
13651
13652 if( link().last_processed <= t_veh->part( link_vp_index ).last_disconnected ) {
13653 add_msg_if_player_sees( pos, m_warning, string_format( _( "You detached the %s." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You detached the %s." ) ) ), type_name() ) );
13654 return reset_link( true, carrier, -2 );
13655 }
13656 t_veh->part( link_vp_index ).set_flag( vp_flag::linked_flag );
13657
13658 int turns_elapsed = to_turns<int>( calendar::turn - link().last_processed );
13659 link().last_processed = calendar::turn;
13660
13661 // Set the new absolute position to the vehicle's origin.
13662 tripoint t_veh_bub_pos = t_veh->global_pos3();
13663 tripoint_abs_ms new_t_abs_pos = here.getglobal( t_veh_bub_pos );
13664 if( link().t_abs_pos != new_t_abs_pos ) {
13665 link().t_abs_pos = new_t_abs_pos;
13666 length_check_needed = true;
13667 }
13668
13669 // If either of the link's connected sides moved, check the cable's length.
13670 if( length_check_needed ) {
13671 link().length = rl_dist( pos, t_veh_bub_pos + t_veh->part( link_vp_index ).precalc[0] );
13672 if( check_length() ) {
13673 return reset_link( true, carrier, link_vp_index );
13674 }
13675 }
13676
13677 // Extra behaviors for the cabled item.
13678 if( !is_cable_item ) {
13679 int power_draw = 0;
13680
13681 if( link().efficiency < MIN_LINK_EFFICIENCY ) {
13682 return false;
13683 }
13684 // Recharge or charge linked batteries
13685 power_draw -= charge_linked_batteries( *t_veh, turns_elapsed );
13686
13687 // Tool power draw display
13688 if( active && type->tool && type->tool->power_draw > 0_W ) {
13689 power_draw -= type->tool->power_draw.value();
13690 }
13691
13692 // Send total power draw to the vehicle so it can be displayed.
13693 if( power_draw != 0 ) {
13694 t_veh->linked_item_epower_this_turn += units::from_milliwatt( power_draw );
13695 }
13696 } else if( has_flag( flag_NO_DROP ) ) {
13697 debugmsg( "%s shouldn't exist outside of an item or vehicle part.", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "13697", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "%s shouldn't exist outside of an item or vehicle part."
, tname());
13698 return true;
13699 }
13700
13701 return false;
13702}
13703
13704int item::charge_linked_batteries( vehicle &linked_veh, int turns_elapsed )
13705{
13706 if( !has_link_data() || link().charge_rate == 0 || link().charge_interval < 1 ) {
13707 return 0;
13708 }
13709
13710 if( !is_battery() ) {
13711 const item *parent_mag = magazine_current();
13712 if( !parent_mag || !parent_mag->has_flag( flag_RECHARGE ) ) {
13713 return 0;
13714 }
13715 }
13716
13717 const bool power_in = link().charge_rate > 0;
13718 if( power_in ? ammo_remaining() >= ammo_capacity( ammo_battery ) :
13719 ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
13720 return 0;
13721 }
13722
13723 // Normally efficiency is the chance to get a charge every charge_interval, but if we're catching up from
13724 // time spent ouside the reality bubble it should be applied as a percentage of the total instead.
13725 bool short_time_passed = turns_elapsed <= link().charge_interval;
13726
13727 if( turns_elapsed < 1 || ( short_time_passed &&
13728 !calendar::once_every( time_duration::from_turns( link().charge_interval ) ) ) ) {
13729 return link().charge_rate;
13730 }
13731
13732 // If a long time passed, multiply the total by the efficiency rather than cancelling a charge.
13733 int transfer_total = short_time_passed ? 1 :
13734 ( turns_elapsed * 1.0f / link().charge_interval ) * link().charge_interval;
13735
13736 if( power_in ) {
13737 const int battery_deficit = linked_veh.discharge_battery( transfer_total, true );
13738 // Around 85% efficient by default; a few of the discharges don't actually recharge
13739 if( battery_deficit == 0 && ( !short_time_passed || rng_float( 0.0, 1.0 ) <= link().efficiency ) ) {
13740 ammo_set( itype_battery, ammo_remaining() + transfer_total );
13741 }
13742 } else {
13743 // Around 85% efficient by default; a few of the discharges don't actually charge
13744 if( !short_time_passed || rng_float( 0.0, 1.0 ) <= link().efficiency ) {
13745 const int battery_surplus = linked_veh.charge_battery( transfer_total, true );
13746 if( battery_surplus == 0 ) {
13747 ammo_set( itype_battery, ammo_remaining() - transfer_total );
13748 }
13749 } else {
13750 const std::pair<int, int> linked_levels = linked_veh.connected_battery_power_level();
13751 if( linked_levels.first < linked_levels.second ) {
13752 ammo_set( itype_battery, ammo_remaining() - transfer_total );
13753 }
13754 }
13755 }
13756 return link().charge_rate;
13757}
13758
13759bool item::reset_link( bool unspool_if_too_long, Character *p, int vpart_index,
13760 const bool loose_message, const tripoint cable_position )
13761{
13762 if( !has_link_data() ) {
13763 return has_flag( flag_NO_DROP );
13764 }
13765 if( unspool_if_too_long && link_has_state( link_state::needs_reeling ) ) {
13766 // Cables that need reeling should be reset with a reel_cable_activity_actor instead.
13767 return false;
13768 }
13769
13770 if( vpart_index != -2 && link().t_veh ) {
13771 if( vpart_index == -1 ) {
13772 vehicle *t_veh = link().t_veh.get();
13773 // Find the vp_part index the cable is linked to.
13774 if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_port ) {
13775 for( int idx : t_veh->cable_ports ) {
13776 if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13777 vpart_index = idx;
13778 break;
13779 }
13780 }
13781 } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_battery ) {
13782 for( int idx : t_veh->batteries ) {
13783 if( t_veh->part( idx ).mount == link().t_mount ) {
13784 vpart_index = idx;
13785 break;
13786 }
13787 }
13788 } else if( link().target == link_state::vehicle_tow || link().source == link_state::vehicle_tow ) {
13789 vpart_index = t_veh->part_at( t_veh->coord_translate( link().t_mount ) );
13790 }
13791 }
13792 if( vpart_index != -1 ) {
13793 link().t_veh->part( vpart_index ).remove_flag( vp_flag::linked_flag );
13794 }
13795 }
13796
13797 if( loose_message ) {
13798 if( p != nullptr ) {
13799 p->add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "Your %s has come loose." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s has come loose." ) )
), link_name() );
13800 } else {
13801 add_msg_if_player_sees( cable_position, m_warning, _( "The %s has come loose." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %s has come loose." ) ) ), link_name() );
13802 }
13803 }
13804
13805 if( unspool_if_too_long && link().length > LINK_RESPOOL_THRESHOLD ) {
13806 // Cables that are too long need to be manually rewound before reuse.
13807 link().source = link_state::needs_reeling;
13808 return false;
13809 }
13810
13811 if( loose_message && p ) {
13812 p->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You reel in the %s and wind it up." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You reel in the %s and wind it up."
) ) ), link_name() );
13813 }
13814
13815 link_.reset();
13816 if( !cables().empty() ) {
13817 // If there are extensions, keep link active to maintain max_length.
13818 update_link_traits();
13819 }
13820 return has_flag( flag_NO_DROP );
13821}
13822
13823bool item::process_linked_item( Character *carrier, const tripoint & /*pos*/,
13824 const link_state required_state )
13825{
13826 if( carrier == nullptr ) {
13827 erase_var( "cable" );
13828 active = false;
13829 return false;
13830 }
13831 bool has_connected_cable = carrier->cache_has_item_with( "can_link_up", &item::can_link_up,
13832 [&required_state]( const item & it ) {
13833 return it.link_has_state( required_state );
13834 } );
13835 if( !has_connected_cable ) {
13836 erase_var( "cable" );
13837 active = false;
13838 }
13839 return false;
13840}
13841
13842bool item::process_wet( Character *carrier, const tripoint & /*pos*/ )
13843{
13844 if( item_counter == 0 ) {
13845 if( type->revert_to ) {
13846 convert( *type->revert_to, carrier );
13847 }
13848 unset_flag( flag_WET );
13849 active = false;
13850 }
13851 // Always return true so our caller will bail out instead of processing us as a tool.
13852 return true;
13853}
13854
13855bool item::process_tool( Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos )
13856{
13857 // FIXME: remove this once power armors don't need to be TOOL_ARMOR anymore
13858 if( is_power_armor() && carrier && carrier->can_interface_armor() && carrier->has_power() ) {
13859 return false;
13860 }
13861
13862 // if insufficient available charges shutdown the tool
13863 if( ( type->tool->turns_per_charge > 0 || type->tool->power_draw > 0_W ) &&
13864 ammo_remaining( carrier, true ) == 0 ) {
13865 if( carrier && has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
13866 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You need an UPS to run the %s!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You need an UPS to run the %s!"
) ) ), tname() );
13867 }
13868 if( carrier ) {
13869 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "The %s ran out of energy!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "The %s ran out of energy!" )
) ), tname() );
13870 }
13871 if( type->revert_to.has_value() ) {
13872 deactivate( carrier );
13873 return false;
13874 } else {
13875 return true;
13876 }
13877 }
13878
13879 int energy = 0;
13880 if( type->tool->turns_per_charge > 0 &&
13881 to_turn<int>( calendar::turn ) % type->tool->turns_per_charge == 0 ) {
13882 energy = std::max( ammo_required(), 1 );
13883 } else if( type->tool->power_draw > 0_W ) {
13884 // kJ (battery unit) per second
13885 energy = units::to_kilowatt( type->tool->power_draw );
13886 // energy_bat remainder results in chance at additional charge/discharge
13887 const int kw_in_mw = units::to_milliwatt( 1_kW );
13888 energy += x_in_y( units::to_milliwatt( type->tool->power_draw ) % kw_in_mw, kw_in_mw ) ? 1 : 0;
13889 }
13890
13891 if( energy > 0 ) {
13892 ammo_consume( energy, pos, carrier );
13893 }
13894
13895 type->tick( carrier, *this, pos );
13896 return false;
13897}
13898
13899bool item::process_blackpowder_fouling( Character *carrier )
13900{
13901 // rust is deterministic. 12 hours for first rust, then 24 (36 total), then 36 (72 total) and finally 48 (120 hours to go to XX)
13902 // this speeds up by the amount the gun is dirty, 2-6x as fast depending on dirt level.
13903 set_var( "rust_timer", get_var( "rust_timer", 0 ) + 1 + get_var( "dirt", 0 ) / 2000 );
13904 double time_mult = 1.0 + ( 4.0 * static_cast<double>( damage() ) ) / static_cast<double>
13905 ( max_damage() );
13906 if( damage() < max_damage() && get_var( "rust_timer", 0 ) > 43200.0 * time_mult ) {
13907 inc_damage();
13908 set_var( "rust_timer", 0 );
13909 if( carrier ) {
13910 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your %s rusts due to corrosive powder fouling." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s rusts due to corrosive powder fouling."
) ) ), tname() );
13911 }
13912 }
13913 return false;
13914}
13915
13916bool item::process_gun_cooling( Character *carrier )
13917{
13918 double heat = get_var( "gun_heat", 0 );
13919 double overheat_modifier = 0;
13920 float overheat_multiplier = 1.0f;
13921 double cooling_modifier = 0;
13922 float cooling_multiplier = 1.0f;
13923 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
13924 overheat_modifier += mod->type->gunmod->overheat_threshold_modifier;
13925 overheat_multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->overheat_threshold_multiplier;
13926 cooling_modifier += mod->type->gunmod->cooling_value_modifier;
13927 cooling_multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->cooling_value_multiplier;
13928 }
13929 double threshold = std::max( ( type->gun->overheat_threshold * overheat_multiplier ) +
13930 overheat_modifier, 5.0 );
13931 heat -= std::max( ( type->gun->cooling_value * cooling_multiplier ) + cooling_modifier, 0.5 );
13932 set_var( "gun_heat", std::max( 0.0, heat ) );
13933 if( faults.count( fault_overheat_safety ) && heat < threshold * 0.2 ) {
13934 faults.erase( fault_overheat_safety );
13935 if( carrier ) {
13936 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Your %s beeps as its cooling cycle concludes." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s beeps as its cooling cycle concludes."
) ) ), tname() );
13937 }
13938 }
13939 if( carrier ) {
13940 if( heat > threshold ) {
13941 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
13942 _( "You can feel the struggling systems of your %s beneath the blare of the overheat alarm." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "You can feel the struggling systems of your %s beneath the blare of the overheat alarm."
) ) ),
13943 tname() );
13944 } else if( heat > threshold * 0.8 ) {
13945 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your %s frantically sounds an overheat alarm." )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s frantically sounds an overheat alarm."
) ) ), tname() );
13946 } else if( heat > threshold * 0.6 ) {
13947 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "Your %s sounds a heat warning chime!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s sounds a heat warning chime!"
) ) ), tname() );
13948 }
13949 }
13950 return false;
13951}
13952
13953bool item::process( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos, float insulation,
13954 temperature_flag flag, float spoil_multiplier_parent, bool recursive )
13955{
13956 process_relic( carrier, pos );
13957 if( recursive ) {
13958 contents.process( here, carrier, pos, type->insulation_factor * insulation, flag,
13959 spoil_multiplier_parent );
13960 }
13961 return process_internal( here, carrier, pos, insulation, flag, spoil_multiplier_parent );
13962}
13963
13964bool item::leak( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos, item_pocket *pocke )
13965{
13966 if( is_container() ) {
13967 contents.leak( here, carrier, pos, pocke );
13968 return false;
13969 } else if( this->made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) && !this->is_frozen_liquid() ) {
13970 if( pocke ) {
13971 if( pocke->watertight() ) {
13972 unset_flag( flag_FROM_FROZEN_LIQUID );
13973 return false;
13974 }
13975 return true;
13976 }
13977 return true;
13978 }
13979 return false;
13980}
13981
13982void item::set_last_temp_check( const time_point &pt )
13983{
13984 last_temp_check = pt;
13985}
13986
13987bool item::process_internal( map &here, Character *carrier, const tripoint &pos,
13988 float insulation, const temperature_flag flag, float spoil_modifier )
13989{
13990 if( ethereal ) {
13991 if( !has_var( "ethereal" ) ) {
13992 return true;
13993 }
13994 set_var( "ethereal", std::stoi( get_var( "ethereal" ) ) - 1 );
13995 const bool processed = std::stoi( get_var( "ethereal" ) ) <= 0;
13996 if( processed && carrier != nullptr ) {
13997 carrier->add_msg_if_player( _( "Your %s disappears!" )( ( []( const auto & arg ) { static auto cache = detail::
get_local_translation_cache( arg ); return cache( arg ); } )(
translation_argument_identity( "Your %s disappears!" ) ) ), tname() );
13998 }
13999 return processed;
14000 }
14001
14002 // How this works: it checks what kind of processing has to be done
14003 // (e.g. for food, for drying towels, lit cigars), and if that matches,
14004 // call the processing function. If that function returns true, the item
14005 // has been destroyed by the processing, so no further processing has to be
14006 // done.
14007 // Otherwise processing continues. This allows items that are processed as
14008 // food and as litcig and as ...
14009
14010 if( wetness > 0 ) {
14011 wetness -= 1;
14012 }
14013
14014 if( has_link_data() ) {
14015 process_link( here, carrier, pos );
14016 }
14017
14018 // Remaining stuff is only done for active items.
14019 if( active ) {
14020
14021 if( wetness && has_flag( flag_WATER_BREAK ) ) {
14022 deactivate();
14023 set_flag( flag_ITEM_BROKEN );
14024 }
14025
14026 if( !is_food() && item_counter > 0 ) {
14027 item_counter--;
14028 }
14029
14030 if( calendar::turn >= countdown_point ) {
14031 active = false;
14032 if( type->countdown_action ) {
14033 type->countdown_action.call( carrier, *this, pos );
14034 }
14035 countdown_point = calendar::turn_max;
14036 if( type->revert_to ) {
14037 convert( *type->revert_to, carrier );
14038
14039 active = needs_processing();
14040 } else {
14041 return true;
14042 }
14043 }
14044
14045 for( const emit_id &e : type->emits ) {
14046 here.emit_field( pos, e );
14047 }
14048
14049 if( requires_tags_processing ) {
14050 // `mark` becomes true if any of the flags that require processing are present
14051 bool mark = false;
14052 const auto mark_flag = [&mark]() {
14053 mark = true;
14054 return true;
14055 };
14056
14057 if( has_flag( flag_FAKE_SMOKE ) && mark_flag() && process_fake_smoke( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14058 return true;
14059 }
14060 if( has_flag( flag_FAKE_MILL ) && mark_flag() && process_fake_mill( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14061 return true;
14062 }
14063 if( is_corpse() && mark_flag() && process_corpse( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14064 return true;
14065 }
14066 if( has_flag( flag_WET ) && mark_flag() && process_wet( carrier, pos ) ) {
14067 // Drying items are never destroyed, but we want to exit so they don't get processed as tools.
14068 return false;
14069 }
14070 if( has_flag( flag_LITCIG ) && mark_flag() && process_litcig( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14071 return true;
14072 }
14073 if( ( has_flag( flag_WATER_EXTINGUISH ) || has_flag( flag_WIND_EXTINGUISH ) ) &&
14074 mark_flag() && process_extinguish( here, carrier, pos ) ) {
14075 return false;
14076 }
14077 if( has_flag( flag_CABLE_SPOOL ) && mark_flag() ) {
14078 // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
14079 // Cables have been reworked and shouldn't be active items anymore.
14080 active = false;
14081 return false;
14082 }
14083 if( has_flag( flag_IS_UPS ) && mark_flag() ) {
14084 // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
14085 return process_linked_item( carrier, pos, link_state::ups );
14086 }
14087 if( ( has_flag( flag_SOLARPACK ) || has_flag( flag_SOLARPACK_ON ) ) && mark_flag() ) {
14088 // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
14089 return process_linked_item( carrier, pos, link_state::solarpack );
14090 }
14091
14092 if( !mark ) {
14093 // no flag checks above were successful and no additional processing logic
14094 // that could've changed flags was executed
14095 requires_tags_processing = false;
14096 }
14097 }
14098
14099 if( is_tool() ) {
14100 return process_tool( carrier, pos );
14101 }
14102 // All foods that go bad have temperature
14103 if( has_temperature() &&
14104 process_temperature_rot( insulation, pos, here, carrier, flag, spoil_modifier ) ) {
14105 if( is_comestible() ) {
14106 here.rotten_item_spawn( *this, pos );
14107 }
14108 return true;
14109 }
14110 } else {
14111 // guns are never active so we only need to tick this on inactive items. For performance reasons.
14112 if( has_fault_flag( flag_BLACKPOWDER_FOULING_DAMAGE ) ) {
14113 return process_blackpowder_fouling( carrier );
14114 }
14115 if( get_var( "gun_heat", 0 ) > 0 ) {
14116 return process_gun_cooling( carrier );
14117 }
14118 }
14119
14120 return false;
14121}
14122
14123void item::mod_charges( int mod )
14124{
14125 if( has_infinite_charges() ) {
14126 return;
14127 }
14128
14129 if( !count_by_charges() ) {
14130 debugmsg( "Tried to remove %s by charges, but item is not counted by charges.", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "14130", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Tried to remove %s by charges, but item is not counted by charges."
, tname());
14131 } else if( mod < 0 && charges + mod < 0 ) {
14132 debugmsg( "Tried to remove charges that do not exist, removing maximum available charges instead." )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "14132", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "Tried to remove charges that do not exist, removing maximum available charges instead."
);
14133 charges = 0;
14134 } else if( mod > 0 && charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES - mod ) {
14135 charges = INFINITE_CHARGES - 1; // Highly unlikely, but finite charges should not become infinite.
14136 } else {
14137 charges += mod;
14138 }
14139}
14140
14141bool item::is_seed() const
14142{
14143 return !!type->seed;
14144}
14145
14146time_duration item::get_plant_epoch() const
14147{
14148 if( !type->seed ) {
14149 return 0_turns;
14150 }
14151 // Growing times have been based around real world season length rather than
14152 // the default in-game season length to give
14153 // more accuracy for longer season lengths
14154 // Also note that seed->grow is the time it takes from seeding to harvest, this is
14155 // divided by 3 to get the time it takes from one plant state to the next.
14156 // TODO: move this into the islot_seed
14157 return type->seed->grow * calendar::season_ratio() / 3;
14158}
14159
14160std::string item::get_plant_name() const
14161{
14162 if( !type->seed ) {
14163 return std::string{};
14164 }
14165 return type->seed->plant_name.translated();
14166}
14167
14168std::optional<furn_str_id> item::get_plant_seedling_form() const
14169{
14170 if( !type->seed ) {
14171 return std::nullopt;
14172 }
14173 return type->seed->seedling_form;
14174}
14175
14176std::optional<furn_str_id> item::get_plant_mature_form() const
14177{
14178 if( !type->seed ) {
14179 return std::nullopt;
14180 }
14181 return type->seed->mature_form;
14182}
14183
14184std::optional<furn_str_id> item::get_plant_harvestable_form() const
14185{
14186 if( !type->seed ) {
14187 return std::nullopt;
14188 }
14189 return type->seed->harvestable_form;
14190}
14191
14192bool item::is_dangerous() const
14193{
14194 if( has_flag( flag_DANGEROUS ) ) {
14195 return true;
14196 }
14197
14198 // Note: Item should be dangerous regardless of what type of a container is it
14199 // Visitable interface would skip some options
14200 for( const item *it : contents.all_items_top() ) {
14201 if( it->is_dangerous() ) {
14202 return true;
14203 }
14204 }
14205 return false;
14206}
14207
14208bool item::is_tainted() const
14209{
14210 return corpse && corpse->has_flag( mon_flag_POISON );
14211}
14212
14213bool item::is_soft() const
14214{
14215 if( has_flag( flag_SOFT ) ) {
14216 return true;
14217 } else if( has_flag( flag_HARD ) ) {
14218 return false;
14219 }
14220
14221 const std::map<material_id, int> &mats = made_of();
14222 return std::all_of( mats.begin(), mats.end(), []( const std::pair<material_id, int> &mid ) {
14223 return mid.first->soft();
14224 } );
14225}
14226
14227bool item::is_rigid() const
14228{
14229 // overrides for the item overall
14230 if( has_flag( flag_SOFT ) ) {
14231 return false;
14232 } else if( has_flag( flag_HARD ) ) {
14233 return true;
14234 }
14235
14236 // if the item has no armor data it isn't rigid
14237 const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
14238 if( armor == nullptr ) {
14239 return false;
14240 }
14241
14242 bool is_rigid = false;
14243
14244 for( const armor_portion_data &portion : armor->sub_data ) {
14245 is_rigid |= portion.rigid;
14246 }
14247
14248 // check if ablative pieces are rigid too
14249 if( is_ablative() ) {
14250 for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
14251 if( !pocket->empty() ) {
14252 // get the contained plate
14253 const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
14254 is_rigid |= ablative_armor.is_rigid();
14255 }
14256 }
14257 }
14258
14259 return is_rigid;
14260}
14261
14262bool item::is_comfortable() const
14263{
14264 // overrides for the item overall
14265 // NO_WEAR_EFFECT is there for jewelry and the like which is too small to be considered
14266 if( has_flag( flag_SOFT ) || has_flag( flag_PADDED ) || has_flag( flag_NO_WEAR_EFFECT ) ) {
14267 return true;
14268 } else if( has_flag( flag_HARD ) ) {
14269 return false;
14270 }
14271
14272 // if the item has no armor data it isn't rigid
14273 const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
14274 if( armor == nullptr ) {
14275 return true;
14276 }
14277
14278 for( const armor_portion_data &portion : armor->sub_data ) {
14279 if( portion.comfortable ) {
14280 return true;
14281 }
14282 }
14283
14284 return false;
14285}
14286
14287template <typename T>
14288bool item::is_bp_rigid( const T &bp ) const
14289{
14290 // overrides for the item overall
14291 if( has_flag( flag_SOFT ) ) {
14292 return false;
14293 } else if( has_flag( flag_HARD ) ) {
14294 return true;
14295 }
14296
14297 const armor_portion_data *portion = portion_for_bodypart( bp );
14298
14299 bool is_rigid = false;
14300
14301 if( portion ) {
14302 is_rigid |= portion->rigid;
14303 }
14304
14305 // check if ablative pieces are rigid too
14306 if( is_ablative() ) {
14307 for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_ablative_pockets() ) {
14308 if( !pocket->empty() ) {
14309 // get the contained plate
14310 const item &ablative_armor = pocket->front();
14311 is_rigid |= ablative_armor.is_bp_rigid( bp );
14312 }
14313 }
14314 }
14315
14316 return is_rigid;
14317}
14318
14319// initialize for sub_bodyparts and body parts
14320template bool item::is_bp_rigid<sub_bodypart_id>( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const;
14321
14322template bool item::is_bp_rigid<bodypart_id>( const bodypart_id &bp ) const;
14323
14324template <typename T>
14325bool item::is_bp_rigid_selective( const T &bp ) const
14326{
14327 bool is_rigid;
14328
14329 const armor_portion_data *portion = portion_for_bodypart( bp );
14330
14331 if( !portion ) {
14332 return false;
14333 }
14334
14335 // overrides for the item overall
14336 if( has_flag( flag_SOFT ) ) {
14337 is_rigid = false;
14338 } else if( has_flag( flag_HARD ) ) {
14339 is_rigid = true;
14340 } else {
14341 is_rigid = portion->rigid;
14342 }
14343
14344 return is_rigid && portion->rigid_layer_only;
14345}
14346
14347// initialize for sub_bodyparts and body parts
14348template bool item::is_bp_rigid_selective<sub_bodypart_id>( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const;
14349
14350template bool item::is_bp_rigid_selective<bodypart_id>( const bodypart_id &bp ) const;
14351
14352template <typename T>
14353bool item::is_bp_comfortable( const T &bp ) const
14354{
14355 // overrides for the item overall
14356 // NO_WEAR_EFFECT is there for jewelry and the like which is too small to be considered
14357 if( has_flag( flag_SOFT ) || has_flag( flag_PADDED ) || has_flag( flag_NO_WEAR_EFFECT ) ) {
14358 return true;
14359 } else if( has_flag( flag_HARD ) ) {
14360 return false;
14361 }
14362
14363 const armor_portion_data *portion = portion_for_bodypart( bp );
14364
14365 if( !portion ) {
14366 return false;
14367 }
14368
14369 return portion->comfortable;
14370}
14371
14372// initialize for sub_bodyparts and body parts
14373template bool item::is_bp_comfortable<sub_bodypart_id>( const sub_bodypart_id &bp ) const;
14374
14375template bool item::is_bp_comfortable<bodypart_id>( const bodypart_id &bp ) const;
14376
14377bool item::is_reloadable() const
14378{
14379 if( has_flag( flag_NO_RELOAD ) && !has_flag( flag_VEHICLE ) ) {
14380 return false; // turrets ignore NO_RELOAD flag
14381
14382 }
14383
14384 for( const item_pocket *pocket : contents.get_all_reloadable_pockets() ) {
14385 if( pocket->is_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE_WELL ) ) {
14386 if( pocket->empty() || !pocket->front().is_magazine_full() ) {
14387 return true;
14388 }
14389 } else if( pocket->is_type( pocket_type::MAGAZINE ) ) {
14390 if( remaining_ammo_capacity() > 0 ) {
14391 return true;
14392 }
14393 } else if( pocket->is_type( pocket_type::CONTAINER ) ) {
14394 // Container pockets are reloadable only if they are watertight, not full and do not contain non-liquid item
14395 if( pocket->full( false ) || !pocket->watertight() ) {
14396 continue;
14397 }
14398 if( pocket->empty() || pocket->front().made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
14399 return true;
14400 }
14401 }
14402 }
14403
14404 for( const item *gunmod : gunmods() ) {
14405 if( gunmod->is_reloadable() ) {
14406 return true;
14407 }
14408 }
14409
14410 return false;
14411}
14412
14413std::string item::type_name( unsigned int quantity, bool use_variant, bool use_cond_name,
14414 bool use_corpse ) const
14415{
14416 const auto iter = item_vars.find( "name" );
14417 std::string ret_name;
14418 if( typeId() == itype_blood ) {
14419 if( corpse == nullptr || corpse->id.is_null() ) {
14420 return npgettext( "item name", "human blood", "human blood", quantity );
14421 } else {
14422 return string_format( npgettext( "item name", "%s blood",
14423 "%s blood", quantity ),
14424 corpse->nname() );
14425 }
14426 } else if( iter != item_vars.end() ) {
14427 return iter->second;
14428 } else if( use_variant && has_itype_variant() ) {
14429 ret_name = itype_variant().alt_name.translated( quantity );
14430 } else {
14431 ret_name = type->nname( quantity );
14432 }
14433
14434 // Apply conditional names, in order.
14435 std::vector<conditional_name> const &cond_names =
14436 use_cond_name ? type->conditional_names : std::vector<conditional_name> {};
14437 for( const conditional_name &cname : cond_names ) {
14438 // Lambda for searching for a item ID among all components.
14439 std::function<bool( const item_components & )> component_id_equals =
14440 [&]( const item_components & components ) {
14441 for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
14442 for( const item &component : tvp.second ) {
14443 if( component.typeId().str() == cname.condition ) {
14444 return true;
14445 }
14446 }
14447 }
14448 return false;
14449 };
14450 // Lambda for recursively searching for a item ID substring among all components.
14451 std::function<bool ( const item_components & )> component_id_contains =
14452 [&]( const item_components & components ) {
14453 for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
14454 for( const item &component : tvp.second ) {
14455 if( component.typeId().str().find( cname.condition ) != std::string::npos ||
14456 component_id_contains( component.components ) ) {
14457 return true;
14458 }
14459 }
14460 }
14461 return false;
14462 };
14463 switch( cname.type ) {
14464 case condition_type::FLAG:
14465 if( has_flag( flag_id( cname.condition ) ) ) {
14466 ret_name = string_format( cname.name.translated( quantity ), ret_name );
14467 }
14468 break;
14469 case condition_type::COMPONENT_ID:
14470 if( component_id_equals( components ) ) {
14471 ret_name = string_format( cname.name.translated( quantity ), ret_name );
14472 }
14473 break;
14474 case condition_type::COMPONENT_ID_SUBSTRING:
14475 if( component_id_contains( components ) ) {
14476 ret_name = string_format( cname.name.translated( quantity ), ret_name );
14477 }
14478 break;
14479 case condition_type::VAR:
14480 if( has_var( cname.condition ) && get_var( cname.condition ) == cname.value ) {
14481 ret_name = string_format( cname.name.translated( quantity ), ret_name );
14482 }
14483 break;
14484 case condition_type::SNIPPET_ID:
14485 if( has_var( cname.condition + "_snippet_id" ) &&
14486 get_var( cname.condition + "_snippet_id" ) == cname.value ) {
14487 ret_name = string_format( cname.name.translated( quantity ), ret_name );
14488 }
14489 break;
14490 case condition_type::num_condition_types:
14491 break;
14492 }
14493 }
14494
14495 // Identify who this corpse belonged to, if applicable.
14496 if( corpse != nullptr && use_corpse && has_flag( flag_CORPSE ) ) {
14497 if( corpse_name.empty() ) {
14498 //~ %1$s: name of corpse with modifiers; %2$s: species name
14499 ret_name = string_format( pgettext( "corpse ownership qualifier", "%1$s of a %2$s" ),
14500 ret_name, corpse->nname() );
14501 } else {
14502 //~ %1$s: name of corpse with modifiers; %2$s: proper name; %3$s: species name
14503 ret_name = string_format( pgettext( "corpse ownership qualifier", "%1$s of %2$s, %3$s" ),
14504 ret_name, corpse_name, corpse->nname() );
14505 }
14506 }
14507
14508 return ret_name;
14509}
14510
14511std::string item::get_corpse_name() const
14512{
14513 return corpse_name;
14514}
14515
14516std::string item::nname( const itype_id &id, unsigned int quantity )
14517{
14518 const itype *t = find_type( id );
14519 return t->nname( quantity );
14520}
14521
14522bool item::count_by_charges( const itype_id &id )
14523{
14524 const itype *t = find_type( id );
14525 return t->count_by_charges();
14526}
14527
14528bool item::type_is_defined( const itype_id &id )
14529{
14530 return item_controller->has_template( id );
14531}
14532
14533const itype *item::find_type( const itype_id &type )
14534{
14535 return item_controller->find_template( type );
14536}
14537
14538units::energy item::get_gun_energy_drain() const
14539{
14540 units::energy draincount = 0_kJ;
14541 if( type->gun ) {
14542 units::energy modifier = 0_kJ;
14543 float multiplier = 1.0f;
14544 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
14545 modifier += mod->type->gunmod->energy_drain_modifier;
14546 multiplier *= mod->type->gunmod->energy_drain_multiplier;
14547 }
14548 draincount = ( type->gun->energy_drain * multiplier ) + modifier;
14549 }
14550 return draincount;
14551}
14552
14553units::energy item::get_gun_ups_drain() const
14554{
14555 if( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
14556 return get_gun_energy_drain();
14557 }
14558 return 0_kJ;
14559}
14560
14561units::energy item::get_gun_bionic_drain() const
14562{
14563 if( has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
14564 return get_gun_energy_drain();
14565 }
14566 return 0_kJ;
14567}
14568
14569bool item::has_label() const
14570{
14571 return has_var( "item_label" );
14572}
14573
14574std::string item::label( unsigned int quantity, bool use_variant,
14575 bool use_cond_name, bool use_corpse ) const
14576{
14577 if( has_label() ) {
14578 return get_var( "item_label" );
14579 }
14580
14581 return type_name( quantity, use_variant, use_cond_name, use_corpse );
14582}
14583
14584bool item::has_infinite_charges() const
14585{
14586 return charges == INFINITE_CHARGES;
14587}
14588
14589skill_id item::contextualize_skill( const skill_id &id ) const
14590{
14591 if( id->is_contextual_skill() ) {
1
Assuming the condition is true
→
2
←
Taking true branch
→
14592 if( id == skill_weapon ) {
3
←
Taking true branch
→
14593 if( is_gun() ) {
4
←
Taking false branch
→
14594 return gun_skill();
14595 } else if( is_melee() ) {
5
←
Calling 'item::is_melee'
→
14596 return melee_skill();
14597 }
14598 }
14599 }
14600
14601 return id;
14602}
14603
14604bool item::is_filthy() const
14605{
14606 return has_flag( flag_FILTHY );
14607}
14608
14609bool item::on_drop( const tripoint &pos )
14610{
14611 return on_drop( pos, get_map() );
14612}
14613
14614bool item::on_drop( const tripoint &pos, map &m )
14615{
14616 // dropping liquids, even currently frozen ones, on the ground makes them
14617 // dirty
14618 if( made_of_from_type( phase_id::LIQUID ) && !m.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_LIQUIDCONT, pos ) &&
14619 !has_own_flag( flag_DIRTY ) ) {
14620 set_flag( flag_DIRTY );
14621 }
14622
14623 avatar &player_character = get_avatar();
14624
14625 // set variable storing information of character dropping item
14626 dropped_char_stats.throwing = player_character.get_skill_level( skill_throw );
14627
14628 return type->drop_action && type->drop_action.call( &player_character, *this, pos );
14629}
14630
14631time_duration item::age() const
14632{
14633 return calendar::turn - birthday();
14634}
14635
14636void item::set_age( const time_duration &age )
14637{
14638 set_birthday( time_point( calendar::turn ) - age );
14639}
14640
14641time_point item::birthday() const
14642{
14643 return bday;
14644}
14645
14646void item::set_birthday( const time_point &bday )
14647{
14648 this->bday = std::max( calendar::turn_zero, bday );
14649}
14650
14651bool item::is_upgrade() const
14652{
14653 if( !type->bionic ) {
14654 return false;
14655 }
14656 return type->bionic->is_upgrade;
14657}
14658
14659int item::get_min_str() const
14660{
14661 const Character &p = get_player_character();
14662 if( type->gun ) {
14663 int min_str = type->min_str;
14664 min_str -= p.get_proficiency_bonus( "archery", proficiency_bonus_type::strength );
14665
14666 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
14667 min_str += mod->type->gunmod->min_str_required_mod;
14668 }
14669 return min_str > 0 ? min_str : 0;
14670 } else {
14671 return type->min_str;
14672 }
14673}
14674
14675std::vector<item_comp> item::get_uncraft_components() const
14676{
14677 std::vector<item_comp> ret;
14678 if( components.empty() ) {
14679 //If item wasn't crafted with specific components use default recipe
14680 std::vector<std::vector<item_comp>> recipe = recipe_dictionary::get_uncraft(
14681 typeId() ).disassembly_requirements().get_components();
14682 for( std::vector<item_comp> &component : recipe ) {
14683 ret.push_back( component.front() );
14684 }
14685 } else {
14686 //Make a new vector of components from the registered components
14687 for( const item_components::type_vector_pair &tvp : components ) {
14688 for( const item &component : tvp.second ) {
14689 if( component.has_flag( flag_UNRECOVERABLE ) ) {
14690 continue;
14691 }
14692 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-analyzer-cplusplus.NewDeleteLeaks)
14693 auto iter = std::find_if( ret.begin(), ret.end(), [component]( item_comp & obj ) {
14694 return obj.type == component.typeId();
14695 } );
14696
14697 if( iter != ret.end() ) {
14698 iter->count += component.count();
14699 } else {
14700 ret.emplace_back( component.typeId(), component.count() );
14701 }
14702 }
14703 }
14704 }
14705 return ret;
14706}
14707
14708void item::set_favorite( const bool favorite )
14709{
14710 is_favorite = favorite;
14711}
14712
14713const recipe &item::get_making() const
14714{
14715 if( !craft_data_ ) {
14716 debugmsg( "'%s' is not a craft or has a null recipe", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "14716", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "'%s' is not a craft or has a null recipe"
, tname());
14717 static const recipe dummy{};
14718 return dummy;
14719 }
14720 cata_assert( craft_data_->making )(static_cast <bool> (craft_data_->making) ? void (0)
: __assert_fail ("craft_data_->making", "/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, 14720, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
14721 return *craft_data_->making;
14722}
14723
14724int item::get_making_batch_size() const
14725{
14726 if( !craft_data_ ) {
14727 debugmsg( "'%s' is not a craft or has a null recipe", tname() )realDebugmsg("/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, "14727", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, "'%s' is not a craft or has a null recipe"
, tname());
14728 return 0;
14729 }
14730 cata_assert( craft_data_->batch_size )(static_cast <bool> (craft_data_->batch_size) ? void
(0) : __assert_fail ("craft_data_->batch_size", "/usr/STLcheck/sekitest/Cataclysm-DDA/src/item.cpp"
, 14730, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
14731 return craft_data_->batch_size;
14732}
14733
